text: Very friendly staff. A unique place with vegan options. I love the salads and lentil vegan burger. Sweet potato fries are a nice side to go with it.

Place is surprisingly good! At first glance it looked like a tourist-trap kind of place (think south of the border) but we tried it out and it was awesome. After realizing it wasn't a trap, the atmosphere was pretty cool - open air drinking. 

The beer selection was good, but more importantly the grub was great barfood. We had the nachos which were delicious (spin on the simple nacho-cheese style) and the seitan nuggets which were AWESOME! I would definetly go back.

I would have never gone here on my own because I'm a vegetarian and the name just doesn't sound like a place for me.  Boy, was I WRONG!  What a pleasant surprise!  We had a large group of 11 and there was plenty of room to relax.  The atmosphere was so comfortable and we didn't have problems talking down the table with each other.  

Being a vegetarian, the menu was fantastic for me!  So many great things to try.  I can honestly say that I have never been out to eat at a restaurant that serves seitan gyros.  I was so excited that there were so many CHOICES FOR ME!  

Adding this to our list of "go to" places.

PS Check for a Groupon!

Very, very loud, large screen tvs (during final hockey game of olympics), less than subtle gas station theme, large, casual, good for kids. Atmosphere included - I kid you not - a large bald man lounging full length on a leather sofa in front of a television with an empty nacho plate in front of him - just like home! We sat in a comfortable booth.

The wings with signature hot sauce were very good without the breaded feeling that cheap wings have. The sauce was delicious - medium hot with butter and garlic notes. I'd like hotter and order "tearjerker" sauce on the side next time for dipping. Lots of creamy blue cheese and a few veggies. At $1 per wing these should be good.

I had turkey burger "rebel yell jalapeno" style, switched to cheddar instead of swiss. I thought I went with a healthier choice but probably not - greasy, very buttered roll, super thick almost compressed burger with odd sausage-like flavor, a few pickled and fresh jalapenos didn't qualify as "rebel yell" to me as I could have used hot sauce. Side dish of broccolini could have been skipped - over buttered, under salted, and server didn't bring utensils (my mouth was full when she checked on us and I gave up by the time she came again). Overall I'm sorry I ordered and ate most of it.

Others ordered the beef burger (extremely thick, oddly spiced), fries (described at fresh cut I expected them to look and taste more like real potatoes you know like the zoo - hmmm, maybe overcooked a bit, not very salty), brisket sandwich (meat good, bbq sauce very not nuanced).

Service was good, other than forgetting the utensils, everything was as it should be including requesting cheese switch and mustard on side.

Overall, I wouldn't return for the food. Maybe a wing or two with a beer.

Double Wide is a place I like going to in the summer. I love the outdoor seating and it doesn't get rowdy at this end of Carson. The waitstaff has always been quick and response. I've only had the BBQ but its always been good. They have a pretty minimal beer selection compared to other Southside establishments but still decent.  If you want a good relaxing night out in he Southside, I would suggest Double Wide.

HORRIBLE GREASEY FOOD.So gross is all I kept saying as I looked at all of it..well what we got of it. Picked up this order and thank god they left half of it out anyway.Will NEVER go there again, the Irwin Pa. One at least.Called to tell them they left stuff out of the order but whomever never came back to the phone.Just a terrible all a round experience.

The vibe here is nice. It's right in the southside with a huge outdoor seating section that allows for friends to get together and hang out. It's a great place to grab a cocktail with friends and enjoy the weather.

That's about all it's good for because to call this barbecue is a joke.

Again my southern roots don't fail me when it comes to traditional food. 

Barbecue is supposed to be cooked for long periods of time on low heat to allow the flavor to set in whether it's vinegar, tomato, or mustard base the premise is still the same.  

Here you can tell that the sauce is an after thought. The meat ends up really kind of dry with little to no flavor.

Service varies. The 1st time I went I had the most amazing server who was sweet and attentive without being over bearing and I loved her. Even though the food wasn't great I thought to myself at least the service is amazing.

 The last couple of times I've gone (always with friends to just grab cocktails before we went out somewhere else) the service has been beyond lacking.

All in all, if you're looking for a cool spot to laugh it up with friends on your way somewhere better in the southside, Double Wide is your place. However if you're looking for tasty barbecue, try to find some place different.

This is the only place I've ever seen before that has vegan BBQ food, and man is it great.  I had the BBQ pulled seiten sandwich with vegan fries and garlic coleslaw.  Super good.  My meat eating boyfriend even said it was good.  They were packed when we got there but we were seated in a timely manner.  Our waitress was very nice, wasn't overbearing and didn't hover like some do.  I would definitely go back asap.  Yum!

All I have to say is Seitan Wings! For all my Vegans trying to curve you Hot wing cravings this is the place! 

I was in Pittsburgh for work and my awesome driver found this place for me. I wasn't sure what to expect since I hadn't been to many Bars that had vegan options. I 'm from Texas where beer and BBQ go hand and hand not meatless wings. I was thrilled to be able to sit at the bar have a beer and enjoy a vegan meal!  The staff was helpful and friendly . This was my first time to Pittsburgh and Double Wide definitely left a lasting impression.  Great Food and great service. looking forward to my next visit to Pittsburgh!

Ugh. I don't know if brunch just isn't the best time to eat here or what, but we had a bad experience on Saturday. My beloved seitan "wings" were hard as rocks (like so hard they were difficult to cut with a knife). Our waiter went AWOL. My son didn't like his cheeseburger, and he likes almost anything. On the plus side, well, they have some Jenga-esque game that kept my kids entertained until our food arrived.

This place has a BIG veg. menu.  The seitan wings are very good!  There regular(aka chicken) wings are good too.  Great during the day, but very busy at night.  Good mixed drinks and a pretty nice beer list.  The pulled pork was good(not excellent).  I usually stick to the wings when I am in town.

Great vegan options, however the service, while super friendly and lovely, is quite slow, and the food is amazing, however they're often out of quite a few things, so have a few ideas of what you want when it's time to place your order...

This place really hits the mark   Nice ambiance.   Wonderful selection of beers on tap.  Above all, the food is delicious:   The ribs are super tender and fall off the bones.  The pulled pork is juicy. Great sauces.  Crispy grilled brussel sprouts (awesome veggie of the day).   All around great experience.

Was in for lunch today. The service was terrible. I ordered the turkey Devonshire and it looked nothing like the picture on the menu.  It didn't taste very good either.  My Friend had a burger that was overdone.  The cherry coke slaw was tasty. This is the third and last time I am eating here.

The food is good,  but over priced. Do NOT bother going here for karaoke.  The waiters make it clear they don't make money serving in the second section and won't come see if you need anything or get you another drink,  and the karaoke guy is the worst I've ever seen.  Way too loud,  complicated to put in a song,  He's up there singing when there is a room full of people,  and if your a new singer you get passed by in the rotation.  He's also incredibly rude.  Good beer selection though.  The place has the potential to be good,  it just isn't there yet

I stopped here on a whim for my burger and was decently surprised. I had one of their house made sodas and a burger and both were delightful. The service was alright, but the waitresses were dressed a little trashy for my taste. I think I've seen classier outfits at Hooters.

RUde, indifferent service to start with. Our drinks were loaded with sugar-GRENADINE SYRUP. I asked for an alteration. The nasty waitress said: He will make you another one but you wont get that one for free (i wasnt looking for FREE, i wanted a palatable one)

THe tv dinner items were stale, overcooked and tough. We summoned the manager who was confrontational. He said his brisket was award winning!!!  IT WAS TOUGH and dry..

He was very combative with us. We showed him the yucky old potatoes they srved us and he said " YOU WANT A FREE MEAL, THAT IS JUST WHAT YOU ARE GETTING AND COME BACK TO SEE US"

Some friends and I tried Double Wide and it wasn't bad. 2 out of 3 of us are picky waters and we found something on the menu to eat. 

I had the whole wings with sweet bbq and they were cooked perfectly. I really did like the sauce but after while it lost its flair. 

My friends had a burger and fries and a TV dinner with brisket, sweet potato fries and pork, mashed potatoes and cherry coleslaw. They both enjoyed their meals. 

I do plan on going back when I'm a bit more hungry and trying something else. 


The portions were a decent size too

Love love love this place!  No where else have I been able to eat my own vegetarian diet while watching my husband blissfully eat his carniverous one!  He says the pulled pork sandwich is his favorite, followed by the ribs.  I am just so happy I can find tofu AND seitan cooked well in this town! I like getting the TV tray dinner, which I still have not been able to finish but gives me the option to ahve a variety of different dishes.  Oh, and the cornbread is AMAZING! Great selection of beers, fun place to watch a game or grab dinner.
Mindy, the server, is awesome too!

Just ate lunch for the first time at Double Wide. Had the pulled pork tacos and the double wide salad. The tacos were good, but I was expecting the pulled pork to have a sauce on them, maybe a BBQ? I liked the salad and the addition of sunflower seeds for crunch.

Waitress was friendly, and to finish we had the death by chocolate cake which was tasty, but really when does chocolate cake not taste good?

It'd be a fun place to have some beers and grab some appetizers. I'll be back.

While visiting my brother up in Pittsburgh, we needed a good after-workout meal. He is pretty carnivorous and I'm vegan. A little bit of scrolling around on Yelp, I found the DWG, which wasn't far from my brothers apartment. The menu looked very accommodating for both of us.

I am very pleased we gave this place a try. There were so many good options for both of us. I got the seitan wing-bits and the vegan gyro. The house hot sauce is very good. A little bit of heat with a little vinegary zing. The gyro was loaded with all kinds of good stuff. My brother also said his meal was very good. They had a nice big beer menu too, with a lot of brews I recognize and even some I didn't. Though, since we just got done exercising, drinking wasn't on the agenda.

The waiter was plenty nice and attentive. Though, being as it was only about 15 degrees out, the place was kind of empty. The interior design is pretty cool, kind of a throw back to classic cars and gas stations.

If I lived in Pittsburgh I would visit place often. They pretty much have something for everyone here.
Love this restaurant! I've been to their location in the South Side and now North Huntingdon. The menu is right on with how people like to eat now a days, and the atmosphere has a very cool vibe!

My girlfriend and I stopped for Sunday brunch on the way home to Ohio. We both had drinks- She had a Bloody Mary and I had the "Back in the Saddle" special (can of Tecate beer and a shot of Jose Cuervo for $5.50). Wish we could have stayed longer as they did have a plentiful drink menu with many fun drinks we would have like to tried. The atmosphere resembles an old-time gasoline shop, a little grungy, but very warm and welcoming.

2nd Amendment (not 21st) bar. (Look them up.) 
Sat at the bar to find the woman next to me had a gun in her waistband. Fine. Whatever. But is taking a gun to a bar a good idea? I told the bartender. His response: "lol I know her she's a good friend. She won't hurt ya"

These are the same owners who ran Rowdy Buck until its fatal shooting http://www.post-gazette.com/local/city/2017/06/29/Man-charged-homicide-Rowdy-Buck-bar-shooting-Pittsburgh-South-Side-Holyfield/stories/201706290230

Did they learn nothing? If you or someone you love is shot at one of their establishments, you have a legitimate wrongful death case.
First time was great..... Second time completely sucked sent two drinks back..... Just awful service nothing like first time here and hardly anyone is here first time there was noooo room

One of my favs in general but did you know they will cater their deliciousness for meetings/lunches? They brought awesomely yummy boxed lunch in a snowstorm for our training. The all vegan fare we got for this meeting surprised even the biggest carnivore with how good it was. Def use them again!

Terrible. I find it to be overpriced for what you get, and the food is mediocre at best. Been here several times, have yet to leave satisfied. Won't be coming back. 

Most recently ordered the jerk chicken... Didn't expect it to be so incredibly greasy, and there wasn't actually much chicken there (mostly all joints--got served a plate of bones and tendons).  Not worth the $14 that was paid.

Old Review: *****
This place has been my favorite for a while now, but when they teamed up with Elysian Brewery (based in Seattle,) my top nearly blew. Always a good time with good people here; great selection of beer and the seitan wings are the best item on the menu! Other positive aspects of this place: Bloody Mary's, Happy Hour prices and grilled veggies. Just don't try to get a job here: The manager will make you wait for two hours and then tell you to come back another time.....

New Review: *
Grouchy staff + barely edible food... At least they still have delicious seitan wings!

I love this place. The atmosphere is pretty cool, kinda has a old car garage look and they turned it into a restaurant. The outside patio is nice too. Plenty of seating and they even have a dog patio which I think is amazing. Don't worry it is another section outside in case you don't want someones dog around your food. 

Each time I have been there I had the Tijuana balls. They are amazing I love them. I also had grilled veggies appetizer. It was good, big slices of veggies but that's not an issue for me. My first time there I had the pulled pork sandwich and have to say I was not a fan of the BBQ sauce. To me it only tasted like vinegar.

The drink selection was also great I was impressed. There are pictures of each drink which is something I really enjoyed, as I am a visual person.

Overall I had a good experience and would definitely go back.

We were visiting from Chicago and called ahead to see if they took reservations. We were told Sundays were slow so we headed on over.  The  first thing I noticed was the waitress and hostess dressed in very short shorts and skimpy tops..on to the service....very slow. We waited quite a long time for a waitress. We asked if the appetisers could please come before dinner. They came at the same time, after a long wait. I have to have gluten free and the one gluten free appetiser was stuffed mushroom. The cheese wasn't melted entirely and it was cold in the center.  Wings weren't anything special.  We had to wait a long time to get our check which was pretty pricey.  To be honest the staff are very low energy and don't seem to care about their work. Whomever is doing the hiring may wan to consider work ethic and intelligence rather than cup size.
  Also, I am not feeling well and I think I may have been given gluten.
After reading some other negative reviews for this restaurant I wonder if the owners read their Yelp reviews.

Great place to bring out of town guests, or to go with people who have different dining preferences.  This former gas station has a cool garage-themed ambiance with a friendly (though not always very attentive) staff.  They have a pretty diverse menu, including many vegetarian and gluten free options, as well as ribs and other BBQ fare.  There is also a huge outdoor patio, with a sectioned-off space for those who want to dine with their dogs. 

I highly recommend the brunch. The lunch/dinner menu can be hit or miss. For vegetarians, I recommend the coconut curry tofu, the potato tacos, and the veggie chilli cheese fries, the salads, and everything veggie on the brunch menu. I would probably stay away from the lentil veggie burger unless you like a mushy burger. The seitan "wings" are interesting, though not necessarily good. They also have a great selection of cocktails.

The food is gimmicky and not that great. The beer selection is top notch and the atmosphere is pretty cool. In the warmer months, the patio outside is excellent. I would give it a much higher rating if they could get their food to be better. I usually eat somehwere else first now and grab a beer there.

I had high hopes for this place and it was slightly disappointing. The seitan wings were delicious and a great choice, I highly recommend them. I had the trailer park punch which was advertised as "Best cocktail Winner" No, it wasn't. It was bland, and overall kind of yucky. For a cocktail that costs almost $8 I would like it to taste better. I had the seitan pulled pork sandwich, the bread it was on was a terrible choice. It was a multigrain bread that was super thin and it was hard to eat, and it was messy in a not delicious way.

My boyfriend had the pulled pork platter, and it was delicious. It had a syrupy, tangy sauce and came on the perfect bread. He left fat and happy. The creamy cherry coleslaw was bland, I was waiting for something special but it never came.

But overall, it was a nice experience. The decor is cool, the service is quick and courteous. I could see this place being fun in the summertime.

Don't let the rugged, garage-like exterior fool you -this place serves up some delicious, high quality food. The Double Wide is one of the first places I went to eat in the Southside, and its unique, vegetarian-friendly menu has kept me coming back.

I would highly recommend their vegetable tofu skewers (yum!). They come drizzled with BBQ sauce, which is a different approach to your average veggie dish. I'm also a big fan of their Saturday/Sunday brunch, during which you can find locals sipping on Mimosas and Bloody Marys. I usually order their tofu scramble wrap, which never disappoints.

Aside from its diverse menu, the Double Wide also has a really "chill" atmosphere. From its funky decor to its quirky staff, the restaurant definitely has a certain appeal.   I like to think of it as the hipster's version of Quaker Steak and Lube.

Used to live across the street from this joint, although the atmosphere is enticing, the food is lacking, so we were never regulars.  Now that we've moved to Bloomfield, I still venture over for karaoke night, which is very fun!  It is hit or miss, depending on the crowd you will sing 30 songs a night or be lucky to get 1 in.  The KJ has the best system jn town ( download his app!).  Love it when he sings!!

They have a pretty nice menu. You can get something for everyone which is huge plus! They also have a fairly good kids menu compared to other places and give children more options than french fries and chicken fingers.

Every time we come here are food is served fairly quickly. I usually get the pulled pork platter and their bbq sauces are AWESOME, it's probably why I rated this place so high, just on the sheer deliciousness of those sauce alone. They go great with french fries or one of the meat selections (pulled pork, ribs, brisket, etc.

I love that fact that they have a doggie patio for the pet parents. I don't have a pet but it's nice to know thats one of the few restaurants who offer that option in the summer. 

The drink selections are also nice. We have opposite taste buds, I like my drinks more on the refreshing side, light, lots of fruits and berries, smooth, etc,  He likes his beverages strong, dark, with very rich flavor, etc, and we are always able to find a good drink to fit us both. 

It is slightly overpriced, nothing too outrageous. I think the last time we went here we spent over $60 for 2 adults and one child. I say "slightly" because you do have to factor in the amount for 2 beers and a mixed drink. 

Overall this place is pretty good. They get the stars mainly for the bbq sauce selection, the tender perfectly cooked brisket, and the optional outdoor seating in the summer months where you have the option to bring your pet.
No complaints. Delicious vegan food, huge menu with great variety. Fun atmosphere and fast friendly service. Two thumbs up!

Good beer selection, great people watching, best patio on the Southside easily.

Food could use some improvement, service can be nightmarish, prices are very high for what you get, and there is a real lack of decent specials. They have some good ones but they are very short - 9pm-11pm for food (and only if you eat in the bar side) - and I'm not even sure if they do drink specials. 

This place has so much potential. I am really hoping for some improvement in these categories. Even with those negatives, this place is still worthwhile for the attractive crowd - especially on a bright sunny day on the patio.

I was there 7/5/2014 & ordered a whole slab of ribs platter. The ribs were fall off the bone. However, the ribs tasted quite like they were baked & not smoked. They were overpriced. They didn't have any hickory or mesquite flavor. I told the waitress that. My fruit cup was not full. My grits were Ok but not delicious, but cheesy. The service was good, but my food was overpriced, more than $24 per order. That's why I only ordered water to drink. The atmosphere is good. I sat outside on the patio. For the price, I expect delicious and I didn't get that.

Lots of veggie/meatless options. I really liked the seitan gyro. The veggie lentil burger was very substantial and thick, nothing like a frozen patty. The seitan wings are large squares with a grainy breading/coating. Not the best, but not bad either. Good beer selection. One of the largest outdoor patios in the city.

"All you can eat" ribs on tuesdays should be called "all you can wait for". Went in for the first time yesterday Tuesday the 19th of August, and had VERY slow service. I waited only 10 minutes for my first piece which was great.  After that I waited 25 minutes for another serving. Then after I finished that second plate - HALF the size of the original - I waited 35 minutes for a third. After more than an hour and a half I had less than a single rack of ribs.

Sincerely,
Disappointed

My husband and I, and our dog were eagerly looking forward to dining at the Double Wide.  We had read about the great food, and respected the owner's efforts to allow dogs on the patio.  However, on a recent Saturday afternoon, we were greatly disappointed, primarily, but not solely due to the poor service.  After finding a table, we sat waiting for approximately 20 minutes, until I decided to ask the hostess for assistance.  

En route, a server asked me if I was seated in the corner; and beckoned me to the counter (we had read a review a while back, and recalled that the servers were not permitted on the "dog" patio, but didn't know what we were expected to do).   He told me to grab a menu, and walked away.  A while later, he stood at the counter, yelled over, and said that he had forgotten to explain the specifics, namely, we place our order at the counter, and get our own utensils, water, etc.---which was fine, had he done so when we got there, minus the rude demeanor.  

As for the food, it was disappointing that only the brunch menu was availlable, but we managed to find a few items, which were just ok.  I'm guessing that dishes, glassware, etc. are not allowed because of the dogs, but food served on a paper plate without a side dish or even a garnish was very unappealing.  Our breakfast burrito was also cold, and for almost $10, should have come with something other than sauce.

Cocktails were also a joke.  I guess beer is the thing here, but we ordered mixed drinks and mimosas, which came in plastic cups barely larger than a dixie cup, and were definitely overpriced.

We are generally pretty easygoing, and don't tend to complain, but I have to agree with another reviewer that you feel like you have the plague in the dog area.  The waiter seemed put out that he had to deal with us, and at one point, another server ran in and grabbed some items left behind, and ran out, as though she might catch something.  
The final straw occured while I was waiting to pay the bill; our waiter presented a couple of large dog bones to the customers' dog right next to me, but didn't offer our pup a thing...I guess she didn't rate either!!  Definitely won't be back.

Double Wide used to be one of my go-to restaurants for the great mix of omni and vegetarian/vegan options, and fast and friendly service. I'm not sure what has changed over the last year, but my last several visits have been incredibly disappointing. Wait time for a table can be 30+ minutes though there are seemingly plenty of empty tables available. Orders have taken 30 - nearly 60 minutes to arrive even outside of peak hours. Despite the wait time, the food has often been cold and/or undercooked. Even when the restaurant is fairly empty, some servers rarely (if ever) return to the table to check to see if drink refills are needed, or anything else is required.

Recently, I visited with friends and their dog to utilize the designated dog seating/eating area. There are not a ton of restaurants in Pittsburgh to which you can bring your dog, most likely due to liability/health/safety concerns. In order to attempt to bypass these issues, the Double Wide dog area is entirely separate from the non-dog outdoor section, and virtually no wait service is provided. You must get up from your table and go across to the counter to order, pick up your food, and pay. Forget drink refills unless you want to serve yourself from a pitcher of warm water that has been sitting out for some time. You are served with paper plates and plastic utensils that you must bus yourself, and then spray and wipe the table down. Again, I get that having your dogs at a restaurant is a novel concept in this city, and that certain safety precautions must be in place, but it is just not worth the trip/cost just to eat with your dog here.

On a positive note, the food (when cooked properly) is consistently good, and the selection of vegetarian/vegan options rivals almost all other omni restaurants in the city.

I like sitting on the patio to eat here. And it's dog-friendly (you can bring your pups to eat on on the patio--very cool). Decent beer list. Food is pretty good, but disclaimer-I'm not vegetarian or vegan, and this place is known for that sort of fare. I think if you are a vegetarian or vegan, you would give this 5 stars.

Our very first time here and I have to say I'm impressed.  Great service which is one of my musts to return to a restaurant.  We will be back. Their corn bread kicks ass and so does their beer list!  Reasonable priced and great food.  I had the pineapple  chicken wrap which was  phenomenal!  My husband loved their meatloaf with chipolte gravy.  The corn  black bean fritters were great if that's something you like.  Enjoy!

It is so refreshing to be able to go out to a restaurant and easily find vegan and vegetarian food. There are so many options for non meat eaters! I recently became a vegetarian so finding foods that are vegetarian friendly is still a challenge but The Doublewide made my dining experience effortless and quite tasty. My favorite dish is their Seitan Wings- bbq being my personal fav. The service is always very helpful and attentive. This place will be my go to from now on!

I'm so happy to see more craft beer in the area! I typically like to go straight to the source and go to breweries, but this place is packed with local beers. I had a few appetizers with friends the first visit during happy hour and I can't wait to go back and try more. The nachos are definitely BIG, but delicious (you can tell the pico is super fresh). We had the boneless wings with honey garlic, oh my gosh, so good. And cheesey tots, so cute and hit the spot while drinking beer. Bartenders were great and really know the drinks. Can't wait to go back!

vegan friendly! great atmosphere. cool vintage looking gas station and crazy decor. the seitan wings are the BEST!! must try, even if youre a meat-eater!!! my go-to is the seitan cheesesteak, on a nice hoagie bun with grilled peppers & onions and a vegan cheese sauce. :) the bartender Anthony is the greatest!!! such great service every time. LOVE!
Awesome food, great service and the bartender was a Browns fan. Doesn't get much better than that

Visited the new Cranberry/Adams Twp location. Great food, atmosphere, service and now convenient location. Our new favorite for ribs. The sauce and rub are the best and the meat was lean and the bones pull out clean.

I usually go here for Sunday brunch after a weekend drinking. I tried on a Saturday night once but I was told there would be an hour wait, so we went next door instead. I never have a problem getting a table on Sunday though.

The food is great. I wish they'd give more than a spoonful of those seasoned diced potatoes though, they're so good, but you only get 6 to 7 pieces. I recommend the carnivore's omelette, though the steak and eggs is good too. The screwdrivers are always sting as well.

The decor is great too, and it's a great place to relax with a low noise level.... However! The reason I gave 3 stars? Every time they drop off the check you won't see the waiter again. Even after handing the check back and asking for a refill, you won't see the refill. In fact, asking the wait staff for anything is a task.

Wasn't crazy about our first visit around dinner time. Food and service were both so-so. Then went  about a month ago for breakfast with a friend and was impressed. So today we decided to go again for brunch. I was again disappointed. DWG apparently uses "brunch" to abbreviate breakfast. They list some of their breakfast items on their brunch menu under the same name but with less food. You have to add on and pay extra to get the same amount  you'd get at breakfast during the week. I think this is a very shady move. That being said, if you're looking for a gamble... Head to DWG. You may get a good meal, you may not. Better off heading down the road a piece to Cracker Barrel!
Very friendly staff. Amazing selection of food, definitely recommend trying the mac n cheese.  Best part is the dog patio available.

In a word: inconsistent. I have had some of my best Pittsburgh dining experiences here, but also some pretty bad ones. In general, the service is slow. Sometimes it's nice to have slow service so you can sit and enjoy the mealtime company, but sometimes the service is really, really slow.  Also, I have gone to the Double Wide craving their seitan wings and left disappointed -- it seems like they change the recipe monthly! In spite of this, I continue to go back because when the service is good and the food is prepared well, it's one of the best places I know. I especially like going for brunch. Although it's a gamble, we take out-of-town visitors here and they are usually pretty impressed.
Was there in August moving daughter into Pitt.  She's a vegan and this place hit the spot for all of us.  From service, to decor, to food...all superb. A friendly funky find.
Something for everyone!  Vegan to Carnivores. Great food and drink options with friendly service.

We ordered a couple of types of burger and a plate of mussels. All substandard that I would find anywhere. Fries were not fit for human consumption. That's it for me-- cross this joint off the list. Oh, and next to us was this white trash pair who wanted everyone in the whole place to hear that they are having fun! Real classy!

This place is clearly very popular, it was filled the entire time we were there with many people who appeared to be regulars.  We went there for the veggie options.  The seitan appetizer was really good, and a huge portion, but the rest of the meal was not so great.
The service was kinda crazy.  Our waiter was nice, but pretty non-existent, and the rest of the staff seemed crazy and frazzled.

I like everything about it. The food was good as well as the atmosphere. Located in the heart of South Side. On a nice evening you have the option of eating outside under an umbrella which is a great option.

Totally not what I expected. The seitan wings were amazingly good, and the bloody mary was just the right amount of spicy. 

I ordered the Trucker Breakfast with the vegetarian sausage -- which was a slight mistake. The toast and eggs and potatoes were great, but the veggie sausage was off. It may have been the cooking oil as it had the odd aftertaste that comes with old oil.

I liked my pancakes as well. Although I wish the butter offered was real, or at least fresher. I think restaurants really miss the mark when they offer butter or creamer in peel-off containers. 

Overall however, very good. I'd like to try some other things when I'm back.

I guess that they were trying to go for trashy chic. What they achieved was trashy and a little dirty. Floors were dirty with piles of things (menus, trays, etc) everywhere. There were four of us and some of the dinners were interesting. My burger was terrible. Bun looked like it came from a grade school cafeteria (post Michelle Obama). Teddy's was bad. I think the location is cursed.

I've eaten here twice during the day when there was no great rush. The burgers were big, tasty & filling. I need more of that in my life. Too bad I spend half the year in a different state. Definitely recommend to friends.

The pros are the outdoor seating and the BBQ dishes. Other than that, the food is not good. The BBQ combo platters are really good and you get a lot of food. I have tried other dishes, a grilled chicken salad, and it pretty much consisted of bagged lettuce with five pieces of grilled chicken breast. Outdoor seating is nice, though.

I came here for dinner with a friend. She's a vegetarian and wanted to go to a place that had more options for vegetarians than just a salad. This place certainly fit the bill.

We were seated immediately when we got there and our waiter was extremely nice. He was really on top of refilling drinks and even gave us a few beers to sample before we made our final choices. 

The food is a little expensive for what it is and it didn't blow me away by any means. It was good, but this is not a place I would crave anything in particular and have to come back. 

The food did come out pretty quickly and the service was great. They have a lot of vegetarian options too so it's good for groups with both meat eaters and non-meat eaters. Everyone will find something they will like on the menu. 

It was a bit cold outside so we dined indoors, but it seems like this would be a really great place on a nice summer night.

Go for the consistently good service.

food was really good, even though one of our dinners came out barely warm. They made a new dinner. Menu choices were excellent, I got the TV dinner with brisket and tilapia, really excellent. Server was very friendly and nice, however really didn't see her much at all. Interestingly enough, seemed like a lot of the wait staff really didn't seem to be overly friendly, like walking around with smiles or anything similar. Probably took. At least 4 or 5 minutes just to flag someone down about the cold dinner. So food selection was excellent, however they could really use some work on customer focus, if that makes sense...Memphis BBQ (the thicker BBQ sauce) was freggin' FANTASTIC!

Took my kids, parents and in-laws to Double Wide for lunch yesterday.  My brother and his girlfriend eat there quite frequently and have tried most of the menu (giving it all thumbs up).  My father and I went with the Pulled Porky sandwiches; my mom got the burrito; and my brother and his girlfriend went with Salads (darn them and their healthiness)...
I LOVED the BBQ and the sauce-on-side was lovely as well.  It doesn't look like typical BBQ sauce, but it rivals it in my opinion.  Even my father (73 and a persnickety eater) loved the BBQ and sauce.  Put on the sauce in moderation, however, as it does have some 'kick'.

A good place for family eating - as the kids were kept entertained by the atmosphere and decorating; and the adults were kept entertained by the people-watching, exceptionally friendly service-staff, and good conversation.

Keep up the good work and looking forward to coming back to relax on the patio for a lazy Saturday afternoon.

It's very hard to get a drink at Double Wide's.  First you enter the restaurant and are made to wait at a hostess stand while the host or hostess ignores your party.  Then when you decide to go sit at the bar because you are tired of waiting around like a fucking asshole; you sit and sit and no amount of gesturing or gesticulation directed at the bartender yields your drink.  Meanwhile the bartender(s) are either updating their Twitter, "I'm like, so @ work right now, LOL!!!", chatting with their bff on Facers, or texting away like it's the first time they ever had a cell phone.  When you finally do get your drink, you better not drink it too quickly or by the time the bartender comes back around, your bleached bones will resemble a skeleton in the Sahara.  

Went in for lunch during the work week one time; big mistake.  First the whole getting told to wait at the hostess stand, in an empty restaurant, while she disappears for an inordinate amount of time.  Then the whole "we have no regard for the fact that you might have to get back to work, so we're to take an hour and a half to complete the process." Seriously Double Wides, you've never had lunch customers that have to get back to work?  Lunch is about getting in and getting out, not about dessert drinks and seconds on pecan pie. 

Now, I'm not just being a gigantic malcontent for no reason.  I've been to Double Wides about 20 times and its always the same shite service.  Why do I keep subjecting myself to their lazy ways?  Well, the food is really good with a definite Southern flare.  Plus, if you can get a drink, they have an excellent beer selection and two awesome drink specials: $2.75 Jagers (anytime) and "Breakfast" one Tecate and one tequilla shot for $5.25.  SOLID.  

So Double Wides, stop hiring these hipster jerks that won't take your customer's drink orders and streamline the seating process; it's annoying as hell to get ignored.  Oh, and one more thing.  Get your science right about fraqing.  Nothing is happening to the drinking water.  Fraqing happens at 7500', the water table is at less than 1000' nothing is matriculating up through a mile of rock.  Naturally occurring methane (coal) is to blame for whatever wad the felonious Gaslands documentary has gotten your panties into.  GO GAS!

Very hit and miss. Some items a great (the appetizers) and pulled pork, while others are bland and lack flavor, the fish tacos and chicken sandwich.  Decent Draft list. Best to go in summer and chill outside.

While I have family in the area this is the first time staying in the city and I was in the mood for some BBQ. The Double Wide Grill hit the spot. Service was great, food was wonderful. I just wish I had had enough room to finish it all in one sitting. We will definitely be back.

REALLY overrated. I've been there 4 or 5 times - the food is OK, a bit overpriced - but the service has always been terribly SLOW - especially when there's a group of more than 4 or 5 people. 

I also don't really get off on sitting inside an old gas station - or - even worse - outside an old gas station.

For advertising as dog friendly this is one of the worst places to eat with your dog. The dog area is some sort of self service where you have to clean your own table, order at a counter, and retrieve your own food.  I understand that it must be some health code requirement that they do this but you can get full service at pretty much any other restaurant with a patio.

Oh, this place could be so so very good but really doesn't quite make it.  On the plus side is the large vegetarian selection.  The execution could be better as the meal that I ordered was a bit over done and the meal my sweetie ordered was a bit under done.  

I got a grilled portabello reuben sandwich and the mushroom was oddly overcooked.  Also the sauce was sort of off.  I can't put my finger on it exactly but it didn't have zest perhaps?  Also the fries were a bit soggy...

My sweetie got the grilled veggie burrito and her veggies were under done (well a bit raw).  Nice sauce though.

Service is prompt and friendly but a bit distracted.  The outdoor seating is nice though.

Located in a renovated repair shop, the Double Wide is chock full of character. There was a very nice verity of clearly marked vegetarian options to choose from which is always a plus. The BBQ Pulled Seitan was a great introduction to seitan (a meat substitute) if you've never had it before. I'd be tempted to come back just to sample more of the unique menu options. Unfortunately my wife's first choice from the menu was unavailable and the coconut tofu didn't quite hit the spot. Also, our server was a bit overloaded when we visited, but tried to be helpful in making recommendations. On the whole it was a fun place to visit & even though our visit wasn't perfect I would definitely recommend trying this place out, at least for the experience.

I haven't eaten here in years. So on my Friday play day we stopped in for lunch. This menu is packed with all types of goodies they cover all bases from your carnivore to the vegetarian. It's also have some neat nostalgic items all over the place. Friday is my food cheat day so I couldn't wait to spend my calories on something crazy good. I ordered the turkey burger with fries my son ordered wings. My waitress's was nice and we didn't have to wait that long for our food. My burger was ok not memorable at all. This sucks because I'm wasting my calories on a mediocre meal.  overall the experience was average

Stopped here for dinner Sunday. It's a gas station converted into a restaurant which was cool. There was also plenty of outside seating. We ordered the dry rubbed wings as an appetizer, and shared the full rack. The meat was tender and fell off the bone, but it was not the best ribs I've had. They were also sparse with sides. Also a full rack of ribs came with only four onion rings (at an additional charge) and a small piece of burnt corn bread.  Keep this as your 2nd choice.

We were seated at 8:00. Our waitress didn't come to our table until 8:25.  I ordered the all you can eat ribs. After 2 plates and about 10-12 ribs I was informed that the kitchen closed at 9:00 and even though we had ordered all you can eat the last order had to be in by 9:00.  I told the waitress to quickly bring me another plate of ribs and asked her to be back before 9:00 so I could order one last round. At 9:05 she returned to the table with three ribs and walked away. My personal opinion is my order wasn't taken until approximately 830 why was I not informed that the kitchen close at 9? The point that I set for 25 minutes before the waitress showed up  didn't help my cause at all. They were not busy so it's not like  anyone was in the weeds. I would have much rather ordered a full rack of ribs and been done with it. The whole "all you can eat ribs" night was supposed to be fun, as any gimmick should be.  Anyway I will not go back there and I will not recommend this restaurant to anyone. As far as the food is concerned it wasn't bad. I would say a little bit above average at best.

First time to Double Wide was their opening night (we didn't know but waited SO long for it to open). They didn't have a full menu but what we had was great! We have returned multiple times and had great service along with good food. Lisa, behind the bar is AWESOME. She makes you feel so welcome!!! Also love that they kept a few Teddy's favorites like the chicken croquettes. Wonderful!!! I highly recommend and can't wait to go back! A wonderful addition to Irwin!!!!

The food was excellent and the staff was awesome. We were seated immediately and treated like family. The host and waitress were so personable :) the menu had so many vegetarian and vegan options, i was very pleased. This is definitely a place i will visit again.

Best place to eat in the southside. Pulled pork sandwiches and burgers were great! The place has a diner-type feel because it was a gas station turned into a restaurant. 35 cent boneless wings made for a nice appetizer. Highly recommend if you're looking for a nice place to eat in the southside

This was my third attempt at giving the Double Wide a chance. 
Their food is overpriced, under seasoned and the service is spotty. 
. 
I ordered a chicken burrito (around $10). After waiting what seemed an unreasonably long time I received a shrimp burrito, but didn't realize it until after I had taken a bite. 
I am allergic to shrimp. 
I had to flag a member of the waitstaff down to let them know of their mistake, and then wait another half hour to get my chicken burrito. 
Meanwhile, our regular waiter was nowhere to be seen. 
The chicken burrito was probably one of the worst I've ever had. The quality of the ingredients seemed okay, it was just SO bland! 
It consisted of chicken chunks with no seasoning, black beans, rice and cabbage shreds. That's it. It was served with a hand full of tri-colored tortilla chips and a "salsa" that was also under seasoned. 
I ordered desert, an ice ream cookie sandwich. I was given 2 supermarket bakery-bought chocolate chip cookies with a scoop of ice cream between. 
The only saving grace was the frozen mojito I ordered, which was VERY good. 

as a whole my 3rd try was an INCREDIBLY disappointing experience, and I wont be back. 
Oh-never did get an apology for the shrimp burrito AND now I have hives all over my face.

I have give the double-wide a few more tries and have been pleased.  Service has improved.   the food is still good.   The atmosphere is funky-cool-good.  They have also seem to have gotten busier.....45 minute wait sometimes!   

It's back onmy place to go list!
Not that good food was average probably won't be back fries were stale and corn bread was lousy pork was watered down
The barbecue and grilled foods is great. I would avoid most appetizers except for the wings. Overall the food is good but sometimes the service isn't the greatest when it's busy.
best Seitan wings in the world. I'm not even vegan and I couldn't tell the difference between the Seitan and real meat. texture is incredibly like meat and so is taste. highly recommend
I've had some pretty mixed experiences here; it's very hit or miss. Great place to surprise friends with their inventive vegan offerings. Good place to take kiddos as well.

Our last out of town on New Years Day and I should have been here earlier. We spent the morning driving around looking for someplace to have brunch, bloody marys and watch the football games. Next time I am in Pittsburgh this is my sunday brunch location.

Lots of TV's, the food looked, at least we got to enjoy a bloody mary.

A bit grim. 

I've been here a bunch of times because it's a great outside spot. Generally, I'm just drinking with friends out on the picnic tables and everything is great, but I brought a visiting vegetarian friend here for the veg food on a recommendation, and we were completely bummed. 

Seitan wings/chunks were DELICIOUS but served in an insultingly small portion for the price. Totally realize the labor involved (if they make it in house), but c'mon. It's friggin' wheat gluten. Felt like we were shouldering some Whole Foods tax. 

Fries were great. No complaints at all.

And then...potato tacos induced sadness. Mushy and watery, like all punishments to vegetarians should be. We didn't come close to finishing, we didn't ask for a box. Server didn't ask why. Apathy ruled the day.

Maybe it's a complete douche move to go to BBQ place and bitch about its vegetarian grub, but if a business is nice enough to include non-dead animal options, they should be good, right? Or at least priced relative to the cost of ingredients?

At any rate, it's a place to go for beers in pleasant weather, for sure.

I really want to like this place since it's around the corner from my house and I love BBQ. But I have never I repeat never had a good meal here and the service is chronically slow. 

Only thing they have going is an excellent patio that fills up fast when the weather is right

I'm disappointed to give this double wide a less than stellar review. I have enjoyed the south side and mars locations but find myself out near Irwin a lot lately so I was excited that it opened. Mostly the negatives are service oriented, particularly bar tender service / attitude. The food and beers are great - except that the constantly run out of a few favorite beers ( "oh that just kicked" I hear way too often ) and don't stay on top of that. Biggest problem is that I have noticed, after a few visits sitting at the bar, that a couple of the women bartenders are cliquey with their locals to the point of neglecting or giving attitude to a pop-in customer. They have long ignored me in and given me attitude when they finally came over to see what I wanted, more than once. That's not something I've seen in other double wides myself. It certainly makes me think twice about stopping and that's something I'd think the management would want to know. Others I was with on my recent visit who live in Irwin  felt the same.
Vegan options are rad! Not your average sad veggie burger options. Service was great, beer selection is good! We will definitely come back.

Food was very good and my wife said the brisket was the best she had ever had.  Busy Saturday night - the wait was only 15 min but it took longer than expected for our meals to arrive - server apologized for the delay - deserts to go where awesome later!

Greta spot to check out if you're a fan of BBQ but also if you're looking for some alternative eats and are trying to dip your toe into throwing more veggies in the repertoire. They make the transition from meat to non-meat pretty seamless, and they have a kickass beer selection.

I'll start by saying the staff was very nice! BUT, the food was awful. Everything was definitely frozen. Kid's Mac and cheese was definitely Kraft and reheated. Make your own TV dinner is such a cute concept, but everything on the tray was awful. Frozen vegetables, colorless carrots, pulled pork that disintegrated when you touched it, and yellow crusty potatoes. We brought it to the attention of the very sweet waitress. She came back from the kitchen with a plate of fresh mashed potatoes, and new pulled pork (still not good). Why would the kitchen put out old food, if they have fresh??? More ridiculous (and partially our fault for not making a bigger deal) was that the virtually untouched food (including the new food) was not taken off the bill! We wasted $100, don't waste yours!!
Not great at all long wait. Service was fair, got their steak and tasted burnt vegetables too had to wait awhile for steak sauce. Husband got a burger said it was OK. Will not be returning.

The BBQ Pulled Porky is absolutely delicious! The staff was personable, fun, and helpful in suggesting local favorites. We enjoyed looking at the auto memorabilia stashed creatively in the decor. Hope to return!
This is my favorite place to eat in Irwin. There gluten free buns are unreal, almost can't tell the difference.  And the Bloody Mary is to die for. Highly recommended.

Wait time for the meal was longer than it should have been.  They weren't really busy when my family had lunch there.   The menu is huge.   I wish they would do fewer menu items  better.   My wife ordered a steak and it was well and burned.   It might be new store opening pains but I have heard through the grapevine that this is common for the DoubleWide.   I hope they focus on getting the food right or it will be Teddy's all over again.

Great food, super fun atmosphere & honestly the service was the very BEST we've had! Kia waited on our group of 20 boisterous family members as we celebrated our brother's 60th birthday. She never faltered! All the orders were correct, water glasses filled, drink orders timely. She even cut & served the birthday cake. By the time we left the restaurant we were hugging & kissing her. Lol. There aren't enough ways to say thank you!! We'll be back.

Good bbq restaurant. Love how they have some spicy items in the menu. Got grilled chicken breast and unfortunately it was overcooked and dry. I think that a bbq restaurant should be able to grill chicken correctly. Would have given them another star otherwise.

Omg. I was in Irwin this evening (haven't been there in a while) and saw that a Double Wide Grill had opened. I remembered seeing something about gluten free options and since my daughter is gluten intolerant, I thought 'let's try it.'  BIG mistake. Both my daughter's dinner and my dinner were well below average.  Nothing in my 'California Salad' was California-like at all. All vegetables were old and honestly rotten. I can't believe a place of this caliber could remain open. I guess people have grown accustomed to mediocrity.  They couldn't even get the fries right. They should have named them 'double-fried' fries. I walked out with a 50 check for garbage and it left a bad taste in my mouth. Our server was pleasant but that was it.

Do not expect to find decent beef bbq here.  Previous reviews led us to think there would be good beef bbq, which was on the menu and which we ordered.  The beef that came was like crockpot-cooked roast beef.  When we asked whether it was smoked, we were told it was "braised."  Look elsewhere for smoked bbq beef!

The service was competent and friendly, and the very informal atmosphere was nice.

Stopped for dinner while visiting my friend in Pittsburgh. Mixed emotions about this place. One thing we agree on, they definitely need to hire more staff! Service was slow from the get go, took forever to place our order, get our order, get refills, etc. My husband and friend liked their dinner. I was unimpressed with mine. Nothing tasted very fresh. I was also amazed, for such a big menu, they were reluctant to make any changes to how I wanted my food customized. I've never encountered that before. I don't think I'd ever done here again honestly.

Decent restaurant. However, the last time I went I did not receive my full order and they tried to make me happy by giving me a "discount" of $1.35. Additionally, the food I received was very mediocre.

Double Wide Grill is an old gas station converted to a bar and grill. I am a sucker for places like this! The corner spot is perfect for the bikers who hang out there and the eclectic decor is cool.

I ordered a Hogaarden, which I get very excited to see on a menu and I got Tilapia tacos for dinner. Never had that kind of fish taco before, and living in San Diego has made me accustomed to getting breaded fish or Mahi Mahi grilled. I loved the Tilapia though! It came with a side of rice and black beans too.

The food was better than expected, based on just the overall feel of the place. They had a few veggie options like grilled tofu and a veggie burger. Good for families, large parties and just plain old fun!

SECRET VEGETARIAN HAVEN!

Came with "THE VEGAN" and was told by my sleek, sophisticated health nut friends that this place was not a burger joint but in fact a haven for vegetarians and vegans in the South Side! Indeed the menu selections were extensive unlike many places limited vegetarian choices.
I actually had a hard time deciding on what to get and chickened out and ordered a salad! PUN PUN PUN! The grilled veggie and brie salad (I can't EVER give up dairy fools!) This was hearty meal and the lime cilantro dressing was a good suggestion.
"THE VEGAN" got the veggyro... seitan instead of lamb...was tasty but more sweet than savory. Corn bread was also tasty for "being up north"
I will go back to try out some of their other vegetarian items!
Love it! Relaxed atmosphere, good beer, and the dog patio makes this place our go to after a long day.

I was very excited to go here since there are so many vegan options, it's a definite plus. I ordered the veggyro with red pepper rice and my sister ordered the pulled seitan sandwich with a fruit cup. It's a great place to watch the game or have a big group. When our food came they got my sisters order wrong and didn't put tomatoes or lettuce in her sandwich. They also gave her coleslaw instead of her fruit cup. I thought the seitan in the veggyro had way too much sauce spilling out of it too. At least the food was good and the service was friendly and fast.

I had been hearing a lot about this place and was excited to finally try it out!  The service was not out-of-control great, but the food was, and it was an overall pleasant experience.

We went at about 9 pm on a Friday, and sat outside, which was great fun, and the BBQ was in full effect, the charcoal smelling awesome.  One thing that was a bummer was that we were excited to try the sweet-potato-and-carmelized-onion croquette appetizer on the menu, only to be told when ordering that they were out of sweet potatoes.  Bummer!  We settled for the onion rings, and they were great, a huge portion with some amazing sauce.

I got a burger with the fresh fries, a mountain of them, which were delicious.  I also tried a frozen mojito, which was something I had never tried, but was also tasty.

I like the atmosphere here and I will most definitely be back!

I have been to the Double Wide about a dozen times and have never been disappointed with the food.  My favorite is the Rubin and I am still trying to duplicate the sauce they serve with the sweet potato fries!   The servers have aways been friendly and right there when we needed them
 My partner is vegetarian and always enjoys being able to order tofu anything!  Not a lot of restaurants in Pittsburgh offer tofu unless they are Asian.

The atmosphere was alright, we were seated quickly and they were polite. The waitress didn't seem to know much, she was unattentive and I felt like she just wanted to get us out the door. 

They are a little pricey for bar food, a lot of vegan friendly items. My friend and I ordered pulled pork sandwiches both with corn bread. We both didn't care for either. The sandwhich came with barbecue on the side, and I'm glad it did because the sauce was awful. The corn bread was burnt on the bottom.

Overall, I didn't care for it I wouldn't recommend.

Solid selection of vegetarian and vegan items at an American BBQ and grill style restaurant. Items are very clearly marked for veg or vegan, making selection easy. The veg dishes are mostly seitan, tofu, or vegetable/portabella based.

In the warmer months it is lovely to sit out on the patio to enjoy your meal and relax. The patio is very dog-friendly and many patrons bring their favorite pals along with them, leaving trails of "oohs" and "aaws" from other restaurant-goers. Service is typically quick, friendly, and knowledgeable of the menu-items. Double Wide is a good selection for a quick lunch or dinner for what you expect at a sit-down restaurant. 

Drawbacks for the vegetarian items are that they seem to be out of stock of items on a somewhat regular basis.

This is quite possibly the least dog friendly establishment I have ever been to. It is highly advertised as "dog friendly" but in fact they completely isolate you and your party from the rest of the restaurant. In addition to that, it is beyond self service. We had to move our own table together, wipe and clean it ourselves and then you must walk up to a counter to order drinks and any food items. You must also pick up or drinks and food yourself at said counter. The worst part is in this area all silverware, cups and dinnerware is paper/plastic. The food took a terribly long time and food was not the best. There are open trash cans lining the area for you to then bus and dispose of your waste. Compared to every other establishment I've been to that is dog friendly that has outside seating or a patio where we have been treated as every other customer just with an animal companion, double wide grill was just not a pleasant experience.

Service was quite poor and food was expensive for brunch.  One person ordered an omelet and it was served as a scramble and served cold.  A kids meal was$5 for an"omlete" without any toast or side... Also served as scrabbled what.. That was another $1.50. it was served dry and our waitress disappeared after she served the food. No refill on coffee, no checking to see how anything was.  We had to ask for creamer after we flagged another server down.  After we realized the toast was dry, we again had to flag down another server because ours was no where to be found.  Food was decent, but too expensive. For two adults and one toddler we spent $40. There are too many other better places with better service and food to return here.

Food was very good for bar food. Wait time to from ordering to service poor but give them benefit of the doubt to work out the kinks. At this point, indifferent to bordering on rude to take out orders. That said..... love the concept and the food. Staff is friendly and solicitous. Just hope the kitchen picks it up. Soft opening and all...it's understandable...so wait and see.

Amazing seitan wings!  Doublewide is a fun party restaurant with great variety of gourmet food rich in flavor.  It's so nice to see so many clearly labeled vegetarian and vegan options on their menu.  Everything we ate exceeded our expectations.  The only disappointments were the absence of vegan desserts, and the noise level of the restaurant was very loud in the main garage.  The bar section was actually much quieter. But being a party restaurant that's exceptionally fun themed, one shouldn't expect this type of place to be quiet.
Great food and really cool atmosphere. Get the Philly cheeseburger!

Best vegan food ever! The place was converted from  a service/gas station into a trendy restaurant. Cool vibe with covered outdoor seating as well as indoor (obviously). Our water Tim was great and very knowledgeable on the best vegan options. 
Sorry I don't have food pics, ate it too fast. We had the seitan wings and the lentil aloha burger. WOW both were incredible!!!!

I read almost every view before walking in. Most of their issues seem to be around service. I experienced it on multiple occasions but the management seems to be a aware of it and is actively working on it. The food is good. I really appreciated their gluten free menu and knowledge. 

We were in town for a wedding from Southern California and we're glad that we didn't have to search too far from our hotel. 

One other suggestion is the temperature of their food. In most occasions the food was luke warm. Most of the times I ordered food to go and with the short drive from my hotel to the restaurant (less than 5mins) food was just coming out of the kitchen still like warm. Fix these issues and you got a 5 star hit!

Terrible terrible experience. After 45 minutes still could not handle a party of 9.  Had to go to another local place. And after talking the "the manager" you could tell she didn't give a $hit. Once the new place allure wears off this place will fail.

When I lived in Pittsburgh, I ate here quite a few times.  On a recent visit back to the 'burgh, I met up with some friends to recollect and enjoy some vegetarian-friendly fare.

The Double Wide has a cool vibe because of the refurbished garage/gas station environment.  The memorabilia and decor capitalize on the history, so there's plenty of old gas-station signs, old oil cans, old hubcaps (...you get the idea) to look at.

The menu also playfully embraces the location's history, with plenty of old-time diner options, BBQ, and burgers.  The twist, of course, is that there are plenty of options for vegetarians and vegans.  Tofu and seitan abound.

The outdoor seating provides the perfect vantage point for people-watching and for observing all the craziness and/or quirkiness of Carson Street. 

While this is all fine and good, there's really nothing spectacular about the food or service.  The greeters and waitress weren't particularly cheery, and the food is a bit underwhelming.  I suppose if I was a vegetarian, I'd be much more delighted.  Still, it's an okay place to check out, especially if you're visiting the South Side.  Try to get a table outdoors when the weather's nice (and when Pittsburgh experiences a rare sunny day).

I've had pretty average experiences here. For a place that can call themselves a vegan-friendly joint, I was pretty disappointed. 

The few times I've been, I keep hoping for the seitan wings to get better. They haven't. Two times I got violently ill from them, and I'm not new to BBQ sauce or seitan. After that, I stopped trying. I returned once more to meet friends and only ordered the Junkyard Nachos to prevent further damage to my stomach. The BBQ sauce was definitely delicious, so I give them some credit. The food is your typical fare of bar food and basic restaurant dishes. My carnivore friends rave about the food though, so if you aren't vegan/vegetarian, it's worth a shot!

Drink specials are not bad. I've returned simply to have a drink with friends, but likely won't have a full meal involving seitan again.

The menu is confusing, it will list that a dish is served with rice and daily vegetable. It also says you get two sides. If you get the two sides, you don't get the things the meal comes with. We were confused, asked our waitress, who was completely clueless. If you order stroganoff, you need rice or something. We explained we wanted the meal as served. She was rude and acted like it was our fault. Food was cold.
Great selection, delicious food and friendly service! Lots of options for vegans and vegetarians and plentiful in items for people who like meat.

Went with family on Saturday night, so no excuse for not being at their best.  The menu is very extensive so it was hard to chose.
Started with the nachos which were good.  Came with a side of dipping cheese which was a pleasant surprise.   I was leaning towards either the ribs or a burger but the waiter recommended the brisket so my wife and I both went with the brisket sandwich.  I was expecting a heaping mound of brisket on a bun but the sandwich was so small that I literally finished it in three bites.  Without the fat it would have been two bites.
My daughter had the chili fries and the were also disappointing.  The fries were mixed with what appeared to be chili made with brisket but the dish looked more like soup than chili.  It was so soggy that the she didn't really eat it.  She also complained that it had no flavor, probably because all the liquid drowned out whatever flavor there was.
My son had the boneless wings.  He didn't eat them as he was in a bad mood so my wife and I cleaned them up.  They were the best part of the meal with the buffalo sauce being a very good flavor.
Overall, vey disappointed but the waiter was so nice we didn't feel like complaining.  Anyway, won't be back.  Too bad as its a nice place with lots of outdoor seating.

This review is for their brunch which is served on both Saturday and Sunday.  (3 stars for lunch or dinner).  It was a rainy Saturday and our group was glad to sit outside under their porch for a very lovely brunch.  I was somewhat skeptical as their food for dinner is just mediocre bbq.  I was pleasantly surprised they had a huge brunch menu with lots of options I wanted to try from omelets to French toast and pancakes.  I went with an omelet that was served with brie, apple slices, and walnuts.  It was delicious and these toppings were actually put on top of scrambled eggs but nevertheless a great combo.  The dish also came with potatoes and a slice of fruit.  I would love to go back and try the pancakes which others in our group ordered including chocolate chip and blueberry which looked fantastic!  They also have lots of fun drink options including a bloody mary and mimosa.  The service was excellent and our food came out very quickly.

Mediocre all around.  Seated quickly at a high-top in the bar, server quickly came to take drink orders. I ordered a beer, my girlfriend ordered a sangria. My beer was just barely on the cool side of room temperature, her sangria was awful. Ordered chili cheese fries, they came quickly, and were OK. I ordered their burger with jalapeños and cheese, she ordered their chicken sandwich with bacon and cheese. Food came quickly, but when it came out it came out backwards (i.e., the toppings for the chicken were melted on the burger and vice versa). Food was taken back and brought back out ~10 mins later. Burger was oddly (read: poorly) cooked. Inside was pink (ordered cooked medium, so OK), but the outside was charred to the point where the burned taste overpowered everything else. Chicken was overcooked and tough. I ordered a second draft beer when the food arrived, the temperature didn't improve noticeably.  Server returned as soon as our mouths stopped chewing to ask about dessert and rush us to get the check (bar was only half full at this point, and karaoke had started about 15 mins prior, so I didn't understand this move).  Check arrived, and I was surprised to see nothing had been adjusted after the kitchen mix-up. Paid, left, don't plan on returning. Also, they allow children in the bar after 10pm, so if this is as off-putting to you as it is me, steer clear.  It's been about a year since I've been to the southside location, but as I recall, it was MUCH better.
The Tuesday all you can eat ribs are just a joke. The ribs are cold inside and served with lukewarm fries and crappy coleslaw. The beer selection was good, but food is just too bad.

As you can see from my profile, I rarely leave low star reviews. But the brunch we had at Double Wide Grill really bothered me throughout my day and I felt compelled to share my experience on Yelp. 

My friends were in town from Chicago and we wanted to sit somewhere outside, so we tried Double Wide since they have a big patio. The patio was really the only good thing about the experience. Our server seemed clueless. She took our drink orders which included bloody marys, beers, and 3 waters. She came back a long time later empty handed and said "they are still making the bloody marys". Great, well bring the waters and beers then!!! It's hot as sh*t outside and how hard is it to bring water right away?

We ordered our meals, my friend got a veggie omelette. Instead, he was given a meat lovers omelette. My friend got the wrong side with his meal. The service overall was slow and lackadaisical. 

As for the food, it was not memorable in any way. You could get this type of breakfast food at any diner or Denny's. Brunch is about unique creations and stuffing your face. The portions were not up to par either. This will not be a place I go back to for brunch.

Dear lord why are you punishing me at food places lately?!  Do I not serve you well!?  Do I not praise everything and appreciate all the amazing food places you've sent me!?  Why God, why now are you punishing me with some of the worst meals I ever had the last few weeks!?

I had a choice, go to the tried and trusted P.F. Changs for dinner or open my mouth and say "hey let's try somewhere we never been"!  I just knew the Double Wide Grill would be awesome cause there's always people outside dining and it's been here awhile but I'm starting to think people just put up with crappy food cause they're afraid to say how they really feel for fear of everyone saying they're difficult or picky but I refuse to spend any dollar amount on crap food or keep my mouth shut about it because in the end, crap food wastes your time, your money, your patience, your enthusiasm and if it really sucks, makes for an awful bathroom experience.

This place has GRILL in the name so ya know, get a burger!  I was gonna get their brisket but the waitress informed me they were out of it.  Ok, burger it is.

...
....
.....
This cook had to be high or drunk cause only a high or drunk person would send this food out...


Before I even discuss this, Texas Toast is THICK cut bread right?  I mean any time I've ever ordered it or seen it, it's ALWAYS been big thick bread.  Well take a look at my bread in my picture, does that look like Texas toast or wonder bread, I say wonder bread.  Again I said NO PINK, not burnt black just no pink was my only request, same as my partners request.

They came out moo'ing of course.  BLACK on the outside and PINK on the inside.  Since when has making a burger with no pink but not burnt been such a hard thing to find!? 

 The fries felt like they came out of the trash bin, cold and grease smothered.  My "Texas Toast" bread was mush (see video) and the mashed potatos I ordered were cold and really just tasted like garlic and nothing else.  The Bloody Mary I ordered while I waited was a cup of horseradish and tasted like sink water.  

The manager came out to try to remedy the issue and he gave us a $10 gift card and asked if we would come back which was nice but it still didn't counter balance his constant attempt at justifying why the food sucked.  Just say "this looks like shit, this is a bad representation of us and when/if you come back I'll make right", Don't go on and on about "well I mean maybe cause, and well it is close to close and this is like this cause, and this and that" just say it sucks and move on!  What is it with managers lately trying to sneakily blame the customer or make them seem like they lack an understanding of good food???  It pisses you off more than the food being bad!  Which brings me to my next point, I don't care if it's 5 minutes before close, a hour before close or first thing when you open up, the experience should be consistent across the board!

My waitress seemed cool, but she seemed just there to get a check, not sell me on what is awesome about the place.  She actually recommended places to go other than there!!!

Ya know, the first impression is everything, so when I go places I've never been I specifically say to our waitress/waiter "I've never been here before, what do you suggest, I want to experience what this place is about" (EVERY TIME it's a new place) and when they look at me like "uhhhhhhhhhhh" lol, um ok cool, let me figure this out!  Where's the training and ENTHUSIASM for where you work?  

My partner did say she thought the cranberry cole slaw was good so I guess there is some silver lining to the story, even if it is still pink in the middle.
I ordered a 15$ pasta dish. Normally these dishes twice the size of what I got. Finished the dish and was still incredibly hungry, I weigh 150lbs so I'm no fatass either.

Doublewide is double good. Again and again.
Tonight was all vegan. 

Started with the wings.
Dinner was the California salad, beef stroganoff, and the seitan gyro. All were amazing. The stroganoff was voted best vegan in Pittsburgh. No surprise, it was!
Ok now the 'meh'...they've added an almost vegan (honey) dessert called the Goo Ball. Don't do it, yet. It's too dry, not remotely gooey. Boring.

But we don't judge by the Goo Ball! Love Double Wide and can't wait to go back in a few days!

The ONLY reason they are getting more than 1 star is for their brunch...  Otherwise, their dinner menu and service are mediocre if not completely unsatisfactory.  

Needless to say, there are 2 reasons to go to the Double Wide Grill:
  1. Brunch: Their breakfast is well worth the lack of service
  2. Vegetarians: If you need to satisfy a vegetarian palette, there are many options and a lot of them are even good.

Always good food and great service here! We love the seitan wings and the pulled seitan sandwich. The vegetarian TV dinner never disappoints and the beer choices are the best! I did a flight of beers the last time we were here. Unlike your local brew pubs, you can sample from 40 or more fun choices of brew. We have been enjoying their menu since they opened. They consistently deliver fun, creative food and drink.

I don't think I would have stopped at the Doublewide if I didn't have a $10 off coupon from restaurant.com but I'm glad that I did after a walk on the southside my wife and I was starving and decided to give the Doublewide a chance not want to risk a lot of money we ordered the large salad and the ribs brisket and pulled pork combo being from the south I know  what good barbecue is and we were not disappointed the ribs were fall off the bone good sauce was excellent everything was prepared perfectly. We already made plans to stop back next Tuesday for all you can eat ribs and I plan on putting them out of business by eating every rib bone they have.  And we have antistate service

No, no, hell NO! I've given the Double Wide Grill two chances, and have been dissatisfied each time. High prices, plain food, slow service...the only thing nice was sitting outside. My smoothie was watery and my portion of food was smaller than expected. I won't be going back.

Quick Review: Good food with surprisingly accessible menu (vegan, vegetarian, etc...) and great bar. 

More Detail: 
When I first tried Double Wide (probably 2009) I hated it. I thought the food was average at best and the service not great. 

But after a long hiatus I tried it again and was pleasantly surprised (this was 2016). Now it's a favorite for our family. 

I love the pulled pork and ribs, while my wife adores the brisket. I have also had their salads, burgers and sandwiches- all good. If you are indecisive try the TV dinner (build your own combo). All of the portions are huge (which is appropriate consid some meals are close to $20).

I find the appetizers to be hit or miss. Tonight we tried the buffalo dip (too much Bleu cheese for my taste). But I've enjoyed the nachos and wings previously. 

The kids meals are a great deal. Drink, meal, side and dessert for $6? I like that! 

Give it a shot for solid bbq and veggie/vegan options.

Stumbled on this diner and was immediately greeted with a very friendly hostess. Waitress just as friendly and the food is very good. 

My only ding is the French fries were a bit stale. Tasty but they seemed to have been sitting around a while before served. 

Overall a good place and I'd come back in a heartbeat

We came here for Father's day today, and to say we had a disappointing experience would be an understatement. There was a 25 minute wait, and there was hardly anyone in the restaurant.
