But we waited, once we were finally seated we promptly ordered. Our waitress seemed miserable. Our food took a half hour to arrive. Once we got the food, it was mediocre at best. The astronomical prices you charge for the actual portions of food is truly absurd. $13 for a breakfast burrito and side of home fries... There was maybe a quarter cup of potatoes on my plate.  Our total came to $40 for three people. Aside from this, I am most upset because I tried to take my dad out for a nice Father's Day brunch and I very much regret coming here. I contemplated saying something while we were there, but there did not seem to be anyone of authority or anyone who cared to be there.
They have a great gluten bread.  I really like the quality of the food but I miss the $3.99 breakfast.

I have to say that I am incredibly underwhelmed with this place. For a restaurant that prides itself in vegetarian cuisine, I would say that the food I've had there is significantly below par. I've been to the Double Wide a couple of times for drinks (even though I avoid the South Side like the plague), but I recently stopped in for food after work on a Groupon. I was by myself, so I had to get a bunch of food to cover the $20 I got on my Groupon :). I started with the seitan wings, which were not cooked well at all. The flavors was great (I think I got the BBQ flavor), but it left a lot to be desired. If you want killer seitan wings, go to Spak Brothers on Penn in Lawrenceville! After the wings, I got a tofu dish with rice. Again, while the flavors and spices were tasty, the tofu wasn't cooked well at all. I know it's difficult to cook tofu well, but come on guys, you advertise yourselves as a vegetarian/friendly restaurant! More so, all of the food was sooooooo overpriced! The seitan wings to start were $10 for 10 wings. Next, the tofu dish was around 12 bucks. I think they jacked up the prices because they know most people are going there with Groupons. For food this bland and untasty, the bang was definitely not worth the buck. I will definitely not go to Double Wide for food again, and I can't recommend this place to vegetarians.

If you're in the mood for spicy BBQ, this is your place.  The decor is more of a gas station (which was different but not necessarily a bad thing) with outdoor and indoor seating available.  The staff was very pleasant oir waitress was extremely honest when asked her feelings about certain items on the menu, which can be slightly overwhelming with the vast number of options.  The raspberry iced tea was tasty and there was a good variety of alcoholic beverages available.  I ordered the chicken, shroom & swiss and it was very good.  Two other options I was hoping for (salmon and turkey burger) were not available.  My wife got the brisket, which came with a dipping sauce that had a kick.  Without the sauce it was on the dryer side and was nothing spectacular.  We also ordered nachos with only cheese as an appetizer.  Some of the chips tasted burnt and the dish was rather dry, even with the cheese on top of it.  If we are in the area again, we would probably visit this place another time.
Large vegetarian-friendly menu; solid beer selection and atmosphere is good for groups and families.  Friendly and helpful staff!

To start off, I am a pescetarian who is a vegetarian who still eats fish. I love trying new vegetarian and vegan places. This place has amazing vegetarian options as well as meals for meat eaters too. The bean nacho appetizer is one of my favorites. The vegetarian gyro is also to die for. However, the vegetarian "wings" are weird. Also made with seitan, they are just meatless cubes that can be seasoned well. Overall an amazing place to experience.

I've been to the annual fried tofu eating contest that they have, it was fun to watch and in the end I was glad I didn't particpate.  

I've also been for their tuesday all you can eat rib special.  I had a whole rack of ribs with their fries and it also came with corn bread.  Their ribs do melt in your mouth, I would say they're almost amazing.  My mouth is actually watering thinking about it.  and the special is only around 13 dollars which is a great deal for unlimited ribs.  

I'd like to return to try their other dishes sometime, its just a very down to earth establishment if you could call a restaurant that.  Their kitchen is open late as well till 1am i believe, which is always a plus.

We ate there last night. I do like the 'theme'. Place has tons of potential. Had the Tijuana rice balls and a burger. My son had the Cajun wings.

The place is just OK. The only thing I can say is that there is just a complete lack of enthusiasm about anything in that place, including the bar staff, the wait staff, the hostess and the food. All the reviews you read about this place are accurate. Blah!

Save your money.
Neat little niche kinda place. Parking sucks but it's Pittsburgh. Nachos were good but the Chili that stated no beans was more like a stew. Kinda disappointed :(

Man, I really want to like this place more than I do.  I love the decor and the vibe, but the food is lacking.  I just moved here from Austin, Texas and I'm a vegetarian.  I like that Double Wide has veggie options, but they just aren't very good.  I've been there mainly for brunch and I always get the Southwestern Tofu Wrap and I add guacamole.  To be fair, maybe I should just order something else, but this always sounds so good.  It just doesn't taste very good.  It lacks in flavor and the guacamole doesn't appear to be housemade.  It look like something you get in a bag.  Another note, the portion sizes are tiny.  Not just for that dish, but I've been with several other people for brunch and I look around at everyone's plates and there just isn't a lot of food there.  Like I said, I really want to dig it, but I think you need to step it up in the food department.  I'll keep trying it, but maybe next time I'll get the veggie burger.

This place is atrocious!  AVOID!

Visited on Feb 7, 2018 for lunch. The place was completely empty except for us for about 15 minutes. One other family arrived and believe it or not, they sat them in the booth right next to us!!! The entire place was EMPTY! WTF???

We immediately felt uncomfortable and discussed moving as soon as we received our food. It was too late, though, the mood was killed and we just wanted to leave, but we'd already ordered. 

I ordered the Philly Cheesesteak Soup and an order of two pieces of cornbread. Would have been nice for the waitress to tell me the soup came with cornbread so I didn't order the extra I didn't need. The soup was essentially partially coagulated fat with a few pieces of jalapeño added in. Since when do Philly Cheesesteaks have jalapeños???  I promptly regurgitated the slightly spicy gelatinous goo before even making it home. In fact, after about three spoonfuls, I almost redecorated the patio. 

One person ordered the chicken nuggets and a basket of fries. The nuggets were over cooked and dry and the fries looked like they'd been sealed in a plastic container after frying making them wet and soggy. 

Last meal we ordered was a sandwich that came piled with a stack of raw, cold jalapeños hidden under a layer of translucent cheese that looked like it had been melted three days ago. 

Just don't do it. AVOID!
It was nice to sit outside. I went there on a blind date, and ended up have a great time.  I have the Rice balls which were delicious.  I don't really eat there, but the atmosphere was decent.

I ate here again recently. WHY Devin WHY must you do this to yourself? 
It was worse than I remember. The seitan is AWFUL. What did they do to it? I remember it being half palatable. 
Anyway, everyone that works there seems to be in a funk and miserable. They just shuffle around like corpses. This is by no means a vegetarian/vegan friendly restaurant. You'd think they hate vegan/vegheads by the way the serve that slop and call it food. My lord! 
I eat meat, but sometimes crave vegan options. This place is a no go. 
Go somewhere else, actually... leave the south side immediately and head over the bridge to society and decent meals. 
YEESH

Love this place! A lot!
 I docked them a star for being out of particular beers on their list on 2 different days we were there.
Anyway, they have a very extensive menu and that includes vegan and vegetarian options. Lots of them. Like seitan wings, what? Oh yes. Awesome!
We were just visiting Pittsburgh for a week and went there twice. Sat outside. The service was prompt and efficient. Very knowledgeable about the vegan choices. 
I will go back in a heartbeat when I'm in town. In the meantime I will miss it terribly.
This place is a hit or miss with the food. I've stopped coming here because you just never really know if it will be amazing or terrible.

Rename it the Double wide disaster. If I could give zero stars I would. 7 of us ladies met today for lunch. I ordered the Grilled Salmon salad no onions, it has a choice of salt & pepper grilled or bbq glaze. The waitress didn't ask me my choice. I got salt & pepper grilled, I think my blood pressure went up with all the salt wow! And it came with diced onions I said I didn't want, sent it back they picked the out (I could have done that) missed a few because I can still taste them. Glad to know someone had their fingers in my food.  One lady ordered a tilapia sandwich, fries were cold, fish was spoiled sent it back. The other lady never received her food, a salad. They brought out 3 different salads to her all of which were not the correct one. She gave up on eating as we were almost finished. Waitress never checked back to see if we needed anything & plates were still on the table when we left. Not an enjoyable place for lunch at all

I have been meaning to try this restaurant on many occasions and I am very glad I finally did! It was a beautiful day so many people were eating outside and the "dog friendly" section was a delight to see! Our food was fantastic (the nachos are crazy good) and the service was excellent. It was so good that we went back the next day for brunch. 
I am excited to have finally tried this gem and fully intend on going back on my next visit.

Double Wide Grill was okay. I had a platter with brisket and a 1/3 rack of pork ribs. The ribs were good, but I thought the sauce was too sweet. The brisket was extremely dry, and the sauces served with it didn't really help.

The platter came with french fries, which were okay, cole slaw that was unremarkable, and corn bread that I didn't eat because I'm on a gluten-free diet.  I shared a serving of wings, which I also thought were too sweet.  So nothing really wowed me, and the brisket was not good.  Total bill was around $25.

There are about twenty beers on tap.  Each item on the menu is marked if it is wheat-free, vegetarian, or vegan, and there are many options of each type; also a separate gluten-free menu which lists all the wheat-free options.  This was very useful, and I was grateful for it.

If I lived in the neighborhood, I might eat at the Double Wide a few times a year.  But I'm not in Pittsburgh much, and the food at the Double Wide was not wonderful enough to make this a place I would go out of my way to visit whenever I'm in town, so I think I'm not likely to go back.

Service was very good. Food was very bad. They had better take the jerk chicken off the menu before they get sued.  It's chopped up chicken legs in a weak jerk that has 0 heat.  Seriously these idiots used a dull cleaver and hacked up chicken legs.  Needless to say the dish was filled with sharp bone shards that made it very dangerous to eat.   Dumb dumb dumb and dumber.

This is another place I'm not quite sure how I went so long without reviewing. I always enjoy a trip to Double Wide when the weather is nice. Sitting outside on their patio drinking a Corona almost makes me feel like I'm at the beach. Whether you have a big group, or your only getting dinner or drinks for two, there's a seat for you on the patio. 

Double Wide's menu has a huge selection. And don't be turned off by the fact they specialize in BBQ if you're vegetarian. There's a full two pages of vegetarian option on the menu. Despite all these options though, many times when I'm there, I always end up turning back to my favorite meal, the Porky Pineapple Burrito. I love love love their pulled pork. If you do get a BBQ'd item, it's good to know that they serve their BBQ sauce on the side. I think this is nice because some people like their meat lightly sauced while others like a lot of sauce. But if you're expecting it to be all in one it can be a little different.

The service is friendly There have been times I've waited a little longer than normal for food, but when I'm sitting outside enjoy whatever I'm drinking I really don't mind so much. Certainly one of my go-to's on the Southside!

This place has really gone down hill. We are Never going back. If you want to enjoy you night out with a good meal go somewhere that cares about their customers. Service is awful! Second time of bad service there will not be a third

I had been looking forward to going here for a while, but the place was always jam packed, so we opted to wait til the new restaurant smell wore off.  Well, I can tell you, it was not worth the wait.  It wasn't too busy, about half full on a weeknight.  Other reviewers said they service was lackluster, but now that time has went on, the staff seems pretty well trained, and our server was very good.  The food also came out very quickly.  That's about all I can say good about this place.

The food was very pricey.  I can see this flying down at their South Side location.  I don't mind paying for good food, but Irwin really isn't the place for an overpriced restaurant. The dinners are about $15-$20 on average with a very few being cheaper, and a few being a bit more.  Someone was taking me out here, so I didn't want to spend all of their money, so I opted to get a sandwich, which was still $11.  Also, half the stuff on the menu I wouldn't even want to try.  A lot of them had ingredients I just wouldn't like.  And I'm not that picky.  They just seem to want to use any and all things I'm opposed to.  Like I wanted to get the mac and cheese, but it was cauliflower mac and cheese as one option, or broccoli mac and cheese as the other.  No thank you.

Ok, so down to what I tried.  I got a pulled pork sandwich and fries.  The fries were terrible.  They were fresh cut, but were way too crispy.  Also, they were not even hot when I got them.  And I ate them first.  They also didn't pull off the bad parts of the potato when they cut them.  So I had a few black pieces on the fries.  Not very appetizing.  Next to the pulled pork sandwich.  They put the bbq sauce on the side, and if you try the sandwich without the sauce it's downright bland.  The sauce was a runny bbq sauce.  It was basically like water.  It tasted ok though.  It was pretty spicy, which I don't mind, but some people wouldn't like it, then they'd be stuck with a bland sandwich.  With the sauce, the sandwich was just ok, but the sandwich was also just lukewarm like the fries.  The only thing I liked about the whole meal was the onion bun they served it on.  

You're better off just going 10 minutes down the road to Smoky Bones.  You can get a whole bbq meal there that tastes good for under $15.

I've been here twice and had the same bad experience both times. The ambiance, food selection, and tastes are amazing. This should be a regular place for us, however, the service is terrible. The servers are not staffed properly. Our server last night, while very fiendly, was in waaaaay too many sections and had 4 parites of more than 6 people that we could see. Not one person at our table was offered a refill on their drinks. The people in my party eating the all you can eat ribs were only offered a second serving 30 minutes after they were done eating the first set. Their second set took an additonal 30 minutes to be delivered to the table.  At that point everyone was ready to go...but we couldn't leave because we were waiting for our checks.for what felt like an extra hour. I love a relaxing slow paced dinner, but 3 hours is waaaaaay toooo long. Both times I was there, I could not identify a manager on site. This place feels really unorganized. Despite the great food, we won't be back. It's not worth the wait.

I really like the double wide. That being said, it doesn't get 5 starts, because I have had some bad experiences there (plural). Their veg menu is awesome. The veg faux chicken wings are to-die-for! Most everything I have tried there was good, and their brunch has some interesting and delish veg options. 

That being said, I have had Turrible T-u-r-r-i-b-l-e service there more than once, and from different waiter/waitresses. They don't really seem to care if you need anything or want anything, and even when you ask, sometimes you don't get. I have also had food come out two shades gray of luke warm and then come back definitely microwaved, yet still delish...

Overall, if you have time to wait and tons of patience (or are drunk) go there, they have good food and beer. If you are in a bad mood or rushed, skip it.

I only ate here once and was sick immediately after. I mean walking through the parking lot I felt sick - that fast. I know lots of people who go here and like the food, maybe I just had a bad experience. Ordered the shrimp salad. My daughter was with me that day - also got sick stomach immediately. Sorry . I won't go back

Lots of meat on the menu - ribs, BBQ,. I got the meatloaf - pretty good with lumpy garlic mashed potatoes- the strings beans were hard, I sent them back only to get the same beans back just hotter and tougher, the waitress couldn't fix it.

DONT GET THE RIBEYE.  Decided to try the special which has been posted on the outside of the restaurant for several  weeks which was the 12oz ribeye steak.  I don't think I've had anything  as bad steakwise since ponderosa closed.  The texture of the meat was spongy and there was so much gristle it was difficult to cut.  The only discernable flavor was a slight smokey taste.  It was truly terrible.

One of the few places in Pittsburgh where vegetarians and vegans aren't an afterthought. Look at the back of the menu for lots of great veggie and vegan options. And, they are especially tasty, not your run of the mill grilled veggies.

We tried the seitan wings, which were very good. Hubby had the grilled portobello reuben, which he thought was quite good. I had the grilled tofu with chimichurri sauce. Both were tasty options that we can't get elsewhere.

Very laid back atmosphere, probably great for groups, but also for those with children. We'll be back for the brunch.
Honestly the worst service I have had in Pittsburgh. Some McDonald's are better. No greeting, no water, then no refills. The food was cold and so uninteresting.

So I went in for lunch. They just started lunch this week. I got the lunch meatloaf with cornbread and onion rings. Everything was good, cooked good and the wait staff was excellent. Meatloaf and corn bread was home made. The onion rings were just frozen ones.

We were excited to see this Pittsburgh favorite closer to home but we left a bit disappointed.  Our service was fine, a bit slow, but knowing that they recently opened and it was a busy Saturday night we didn't let that bother us.  

The reuben appetizer rolls were good but rather expensive at $8 for 2. 
The tilapia tacos looked like someone just put some fish on a soft taco shell. Not terrible but something anyone could make for themselves at home. 
The burgers weren't bad but I not great either. I would have been just as happy down the road at Five Guys paying half the price. The sweet potato fries tasted good but were a little over done. Certainly not worth paying extra for.... although the other fry options that my friends got didn't look any better. 

I don't expect we'll be making a trip back.

I visited Double Wide for the first time today. My first impression was pretty good. The parking lot was packed but our party was seated very quickly and our drinks were brought to us in a timely manner. I decided on the French toast, which was described as two thick cut pieces of bread with a heavy egg batter. I also opted to add bananas and their homemade whip cream. I was really looking forward to my meal, especially after seeing it get served to the table next to us. It looked delicious! 

What I was served was 3 limp pieces of bread with barely any egg batter and 5 brown banana slices. Yes, I counted them. I asked the server about it and pointed out what should have been the proper dish at the table next to us and she told me that "they ran out of the right bread after I put the order in". Okay, that's fine, but it's not my fault. She didn't even offer an apology which is what frustrated me. She should have came out WHEN she found out and asked if I wanted to change my order, because I totally would have. It also wasn't even discounted or anything on our bill (in my opinion it should have been because I got crap compared to what the dish actually looked like).

Overall my first visit was very disappointing.

One of my favorite places to eat in the Southside. I love the food. The service is always amazing. The vegan and vegetarian items are clearly marked, and makes it easy to order. Prices are great. Awesome selection of beer. Try the bbq seitan on a wrap... with cheddar cheese. And shoestring fries. It makes my day.

The Double Wide Grill is a more interesting alternative than the other chain restaurants that are found on the eastern end of Carson St.  The old gas station ambiance is pretty fun as well.  The food seemed pretty mediocre to me, however the prices were quite reasonable.  I had the potato tacos which tasted like they were filled with overseasoned Potato Flakes like you'd get under turkey in a really bad cafeteria.  Maybe it was my fault for ordering such a weird dish in the first place.  The other plates served at my table seemed much better.  The service was quick and friendly.

Now I know why...
why I wouldn't stand in a doorway waiting to be acknowledged
Why I wouldn't sit at a table...surrounded by tables...set with napkins
Waiting for a menu...for a look from the waitstaff...
oh wait we don't have. To sit through the torture!!! Of believing you serve food past 9 pm like your website directs!!
Of hoping for service that I am more than happy to pay for...
But oh well..I guess four parties of less than four can b hard when
You're twirling your hair...
Thanks for the worst service and u didn't even know I wanted food...no attempt in 20 minutes ...to even bring us a beer...
Now I know ...why its way more rewarding to go 50 ft and
eat half price apps with awesome sevice...talking the I've-been-out-to
Eat-at-least-once-before kind of at functional food
carriage with charisma...as if the library has always been an eatery.

First visit here I was really looking forward to it but the menu sucks.. We got seat quick got our drinks but haven't seen out waitress in 45 min.. Got a salad and they messed that up wow!! Not a recomend!!

I had a dismal dining experience last night. Went for the all you can eat rib night. We arrived at 7:00, and were informed that the kitchen closes at 9. Normally that would be more than enough time. We didn't get our first plate until 7:45. We sat for another 30 minutes with empty plates and glasses. Iced tea was warm with a couple of ice cubes. Had to ask for more ice. Second plate shows up, that was fine. Third plate showed up ice cold, we got our check and left. Not going back.

The only reason this place gets a star is because I liked their sauces. 

This place seemed really dirty. There was a section to bring your dogs. Thanks for the ticks. 

THE SERVICE SUCKS! We were there for 25 minutes before getting our drinks. Then after we sat down, another couple was seated and ordered after us and got their appetizer and meal before we got our appetizer. The waitress seemed to be zeroed out, so that's what she got on the tip section of the check, a big ZERO. Just because your waiting on me doesn't mean I have to tip you. Tipping comes from being satisfied with your experience. Sorry but I'm not sorry. Definitely won't be back. Seemed kinda trashy.

I really wanted to love this place... I have to say my first experience fell way short of that. On the night I was in with some friends it happened to be karaoke night. The music was so loud I couldn't carry on a conversation at the table. 
The service was okay to fair... it didn't stand out good or bad.
The food was either really good (In the case of the Cuban Sandwich) or GOD AWFUL (In the case of what passes for cornbread) overall not the worst experience but far from the best.

This place is great for vegans and omnivores. They have a vegan/vegetarian menu with plenty of options for all. My favorite are the seitan wings with vegan BBQ sauce. I get them every time I go. I have tried a few of the other vegan dishes and liked them all but my go-to is still the seitan wings. 

The service is slow but staff are friendly. Gets loud during peak hours and when there is a big sports game on. Parking in this area of South Side isn't too bad either.

The best thing about Double Wide is the outdoor seating and the cute servers.  They have a decent selection of beers too, but the food wasn't that impressive.  I only got a burger with onion rings, but my dining companions weren't super thrilled with the food either.  

It's decently priced though and good for groups, but the meats in the burgers weren't very flavorful nor was the onion rings I got or the soggy fries that T9 got.  They did have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options though for those non-meat eaters.

Been here several times always ordered off the grill. My ribs have always been so tender the bone slides right out. Corn bread is also really sweet I love it. Plenty of craft beers and huge patio. Only gripe is service can often be a little slow. Kitchen open till 1 Friday and saturday.

A gem. This is one of the strangest restaurants of all time. I felt like I was hanging out on the set of Trailer Park Boys (they commit to the theme hardcore), yet they offer an impressive array of vegan and gluten free options. It's quite the juxtaposition. They have gluten free bread and buns, and they even have a gluten free / vegan dessert that was killer. They call it a Goo Ball, and it consists of honey, oats, crisp rice, flax seed, and peanut butter. This place was so unique and satisfying... I just couldn't resist leaving a review.

Great time.   Good food, nice beer selection and funky atmosphere.  We were there for a large (20 people) birthday party.  Kia was a fantastic waitress!  Very attentive.  I'll go back next time in Pittsburgh.

I frickin' love this place.  Get on their birthday mailing list and get a free birthday meal.

You MUST try the vegan Seitan buffalo wings! We end up getting them every time because they're incredible.  We love buffalo sauce or the sauce that has some dude's name in it.  Get them with ranch or blue cheese, your choice.

My favorite thing to get here is the TV dinner.  I love sampling all the different items.  From ordering this I discovered how much I like their Coconut Mango Tofu!  

My partner loves their housemade lentil burger.  Other sandwiches we've gotten here have just been 'okay'.  

Vegans go nuts for this place, and they should.  Street parking is usually around, sometimes you're going to have to pay for it depending on the hour/day, so make sure you check the meters where you're at.

I got a Billy bob burger and it was fantastic.  Everything was seasoned wonderfully and nothing was overdone.  My only complaint about it was that they did not ask me how I wanted my burger cooked but it came out good.  Fantastic fries too.

They also have an extensive vegetarian and vegan menu that all looked fairly good.

We went to Double Wide because We had a coworker with us who needs Gluten Free options. They have a separate menu for GF options which made it really easy for her, with no guess work needed. We were in Pittsburgh for 3 nights and we ate at Double Wide for 2 of those nights because the options were so vast. I had a chicken salad the first night which was massive, and the cajun tilapia the second night. My coworker had the meatloaf which he thought was amazing! A good option for those looking for healthier dinners.

The lentil burger was bland and didn't come with any toppings. Usually, a burger would come with lettuce, tomato, some kind of ketchup mustard or sauce...not this one. The vegan wings were square chunks of seitan that had a great taste but not for the price especially since seitan is literally flour and water. Overpriced and underwhelming.

I absolutely adore this place  I love all the clearly marked vegan/vegetarian options on the menu. I had both the vegan Gyro and the Vegan cheese steak sandwich and both were great! Very tasteful and delicious. Our service was great both times we were there this week and their blended margarita was bomb.com 
10 outa 10, would recommend

I have been to the Double Wide a few times.  It really is hot or miss.  I have loved the ribs at times and sometimes deemed them barely adequate.  Their wings are solid.  Peanut butter pie is also tasty.  They have a descent beer selection.  They are a textbook 3 star.

I came here a number of times years ago and recently returned for dinner on a Wednesday night. It seems that they have expanded the menu over the past few years and one good thing is that they have a TON of vegetarian/vegan options. 

The atmosphere is nice. There is ample opportunity for good people watching and the outside area is shaded and breezy for when you want to sit outside on a hot day. They also have a separated dog patio which is a nice accommodation for those with dogs and for those who would rather not sit next to a dog while eating. 

Our waitress was attentive but not overly personable -- which is totally fine by me. I had the hawaiian burger with fries. The food was fine but not memorable. The sandwiches and burgers seemed fairly priced but the entrees looked over priced to me. 

I'd come back if someone invited me but probably wouldn't go out of my way.

Surprised about all of the bad reviews here i thought the food was good and just the fact that it is on carson st in such a cool setting a convered car garage with a full size car.above the bar i enjoyed my experience here.

Decent food--they have a nice selection of vegetarian options.

A little pricey for what they serve though.

If you order the AYCE BBQ ribs or just BBQ ribs in general ask for the tender pieces. We did the AYCE ribs, the first plates were good, the 2nd plates were hard, and the third was ooh so good and tender. I loved the good ribs and I've had a lot of them from all over and its also a very good deal.

They charge extra for sauce for the ribs however if they give you the tender pieces no extra sauce is needed.

I like this place lots of outdoor and indoor seating and they have a garage theme. It's was very busy when we were there but they have lots of room for everyone. They also have couches which if you don't mine eating on a couch is just like eating at home cause they have tv all over the place.  It's also the perfect place to watch the game.

I have waited to rate this place, we have been here about 10 times now. I feel we have given them plenty of opportunity and the food just is not very good. The nachos were kinda good in the beginning but the last few times they have been burnt to the point of not being edible.. the only thing that you could say is good is the cornbread.. we won't be back.. 
this is just a side note.. the t-shirts that they sell of the 3 legged dog is in very poor taste..

Torn

The staff, burger, brunch, and atmosphere is really great.

Unfortunately the BBQ they tout is absolutely horrible... The TV dinner gimmick is great, but the food arrived cold and the brisket was downright bland ... 

If you want a great burger or brunch this is a great place and they even have a section for canine friends, but I can't stress how bad the BBQ is 

I'll be back for lunch all the time... But dinner... Just avoid

Bar none, Double Wide Grill is the best place to spend a summer night in Pittsburgh. The restaurant is housed in a converted gas station, and its former parking lot is now covered with picnic tables. Globe lights twinkle overhead and a corn hole pit beckons patrons from the corner of the outdoor seating area. There's no bad seat on the patio, with gorgeous public art murals bookending the restaurant and a parade of Carson Street humanity constantly marching by. 

Because it is housed in a converted gas station, Double Wide has adopted a white trash theme. (Hence the 'Double Wide' moniker.) Customers can order a six-pack of beer delivered to their table in a cooler, or a custom-made TV dinner on a tray. As a recent Tennessee transplant I am constantly on the lookout for good barbecue, and Double Wide has that as well. Although not up to Knoxville standards, my pulled pork platter was juicy and tender, and the cornbread was incredibly sweet and delicious. I do, however, take issue with the restaurant's coleslaw, which isn't the creamy, homestyle mixture that I adore, but a bizarre tangy concoction full of cherries. Cherries? Seriously? If Double Wide truly wants to make a name as an arbiter of great southern fare, they will have to remedy the coleslaw situation.

That having been said, pretty much everything I've ordered at the restaurant has been excellent. This includes crab, black bean and corn fritters, a portabella mushroom stuffed with spinach and brie, the barbecue chicken ranch salad, and several types of tacos. Surprisingly a full page of the menu is devoted to vegetarian and vegan options, so something is truly available to satisfy every member of your group. And that includes canines! Not only is Double Wide's patio dog friendly, but they boast an entire menu devoted to the beasts. My pup, Radar, loves coming to Double Wide, where he plays in the mulch around the shrubbery, receives tons of love and attention, and gets to eat a piece of grilled chicken or beef made just for him! 

Sitting outside on a warm summer night, drinking with your friends and watching the city move past is one of the best feelings in the world, and in Pittsburgh, Double Wide Grill is the place to do it.

I work on the South Side and I've been really curious about this place.  And I've had a BBQ craving lately.  So, despite the poor reviews about the service and food that my coworkers had given me, I decided to try it out.  I ordered a BBQ combo of brisket and ribs.  It was awful.  The brisket was chopped instead of sliced and it was lying in a pile under a quarter rack of ribs.  The brisket was dry as a desert with no sauce served at all, not even on the side.  And this dried up meat desperately needed sauce.  It had no flavor and no spice.  Icky!  The ribs looks good, but they were served as a quarter rack and the knife I had was just a dinner knife and would not cut through the ribs so I could separate them.  They had a little more flavor with some kind of slightly sweet sauce brushed on the outside.  But the best I could do was scrape a little meat off the bone. I took the ribs back to work and gave them to the office food scavenger.  If figured if he could find a way to cut them apart, more power to him.  

The service was actually pretty good.  But that's not enough to get me back into this place.  I'm sure there's better BBQ somewhere in Pittsburgh.
Great place for loud, relaxed times.  Food is what you would expect from a converted garage, we love it - bring your dog.
The pulled porky sandwich and fries ever very good. I would recommend this sandwich if you like sweet BBQ. The outdoor seating was lovely and the waiter was attentive

The toddler and I stopped here for lunch on a Monday. The decor immediately made the toddler happy with old trucks, car parts, fuel pumps and other garage knic knacs.  The host was not friendly and rushed to the table way ahead of us. He also gave me a drink menu which was weird considering I'm 38 weeks prego. He never spoke, even when I tried to engage. Hopefully it was a bad day for him and he wasn't meaning to be so rude.
Our server rocked however. She was on top of everything. I had a bbq pulled seitain with cornbread. The sauce was sweet and spicy. The toddler had some Kraft Mac n cheese with some delicious fries. His meal also included a scoop of ice cream. Besides the Donnie Downer host, this place rocked!

Only been here once, and I would have given it two stars if not to give it the benefit of the doubt that the restaurant was in recovery-mode from Saint Patrick's day weekend. We went on a Sunday night, and we had difficulty placing an order because they were out of a lot of menu items/beers.

The hot seitan wings were pretty good, I liked that they actually had some kick to them and enough sauce to make them satisfyingly moist. The whole order though was pretty pricey for the small portion size, especially compared to seitan wings offered elsewhere in Pittsburgh (OTB, Spak bros, etc), and the wing sizes were really mis-proportioned which made splitting the order as an appetizer awkward.

They were out of vegan rolls for burgers, but I was craving a one, so I ordered the vegan lentil burger anyway on the multigrain bread. When it arrived, it had no toppings (lettuce, tomato, onion, pickle) so I had to call back the waitress to ask for them and for some mustard. The lentil patty was good, but the meal tasted like a sandwich rather than a burger. The vegetable side of zucchini and squash was pretty watery and mild, though not terrible, I regretted not ordering a different side.

I'd be willing to give this place another try, since I've heard the veggyro and vegan fries are good!
Probably one of the most disgusting places I have ever eaten!! The place was filthy and the terrible food was way overpriced! How does this place stay in business??

This place has great burgers and salads. I especially enjoy that you can get a burger with a side of vegetables - a rarity in this town. The only downer? The new remodel that changed the interior from a cozy, quirky place to an ugly sports bar complete with way too many big screen tv's.

I've visited this restaurant 4 times in 6 weeks.  The first time was lunch and I had crispy wings and my friend had nachos.  We both loved our food and were treated royally.  We did the same experience 2 days later.,  I've had dinner twice with my son and grandchildren.  The first trip, they brought my wings drenched in sauce, when I asked for sauce on the side.  The manager insisted on making this right, bringing me another order or unsauced wings and letting me keep the sauced wings to take home.  She further adjusted the bill, which I did NOT request, nor did I make a fuss about the wrong type or wings.  My son enjoyed his chipolte meatloaf dinner.   Server was tipped $20.00

Noo, let's visit last night's experience.  We asked for unsweetened iced tea, waited at least 10 minutes for it, and it came sweetened.  I added sweetener without tasting, so the tea was undrinkable.  It was an additional 10 minutes before we caught our server's eye to ask for different tea.  We had not been offered water.  It was a full 25 minutes before we got our food.  I had wings with sauce.  They were very dry.  My son said the chili was flavorless with little meat, and he took one bite and set it aside.  I set my empty glass to the edge of the table and had to stop eating until I got tea ( full ten minutes) because the sauce was hot.  Son and grandson ordered dessert and I was still eating wings.  My empty glass was sitting there, and she never offered a refill until I finally asked her to bring me more tea.  She got an $8.00 tip.  Miserable meal experience.

Never again.  This place just keeps getting worse.

This may have had the BEST onion rings I've ever eaten. Not heavily battered like most places and definitely not frozen. They were crispy and hot and I wish I had ordered two baskets for myself instead of sharing one. 

The corn bread was delicious as well. You could tell it was made with actual corn and not just from a box.

My meal was just ok. I ordered the bbq brisket.  I wasn't feeling the bbq sauce (too sweet) and my meat was a little dry. All was forgiven though since they did provide me with those delicious onion rings.

I could sit here and drink beer after beer from their fairly extensive beer menu and just eat onion rings and corn bread. In fact if I'm ever back here, I might have to do just that.

Great causal place for vegetarians and vegans.   Veggygyro was tasty with right amount of spice.   Coleslaw with cherries was different and very good,   Fabulous staff especially Kea (Kia?).  Attentive. Made sure all orders were right.  Very personable and knowledgeable about the foods.   Efficient, pleasant service.   Good choices of beers.

Food tasted ok but was cold.  Our waitress didn't  even ask how the food was,  so we told her it was cold and and like rubber.   Manager took care of the meal.   Unlikely to return.  A little pricey and not great quality

Our Birthday lunch will be remembered for the long wait to get seated and the twice as long wait (1hr) to get our order and it was not all brought to the table at one time. The first served were done eating by the time the last 2 people in our party were served. Poor management. We had to ask for drink refills while we waited. Maybe they need to hire more waitresses/waiters. We couldn't understand why tables seated after us were served and gone by the time we got our meals. The burgers were okay but the French fries were soggy.
Vegetarian or not, you have to come here for the seitan wings. They're fantastic. My entire family (two young kids, included) loves them. The wait staff is also incredibly friendly.

I'm not quite sure how you can tell someone to their face that there are no seats available when half the restaurant has open seats. And also tell them that service will be ending shortly. (And service is scheduled to end in 40 minutes?)

2 stars for beer.
No stars for douche-baggery.

While in general I am not the biggest fan of the venues in the South Side this one is a nice spot to hang out and have some drinks and a grab.  There is a lot of outdoor sitting, which makes it ideal for the summer time.  The service was fast and helpful. The drinks were solid and the food even better! Two of us order the pulled pork sandwich and it was as good as it gets, while their vegetarian selection is huge and great (based on the vegetarians of our group).  All in all, I think it is worth a try if you have not visited the place and I am sure you will like it.  Only negative point, is that they could use some more care in the facility - it looks dirty and old (which of course does not necessarily mean that it is, but it could use some more care).

I came here with my family, as it was one of the few places we could find that catered to both carnivores and vegans.

Our server - let's call him Alex - was a little odd.  First he introduced himself and took our drink orders.  He came back with our drinks a few minutes later and asked us if we were ready to order.  We were ready to order, but before waiting for our answer he turned to my father and started talking to him about the baseball game playing on the television.  My parents don't speak very good English and it was obvious that my father wasn't able to follow what Alex was saying.  Alex seemed to suddenly realize this, and then inexplicably walked away without saying anything.  We were confused, to say the least.  

He came back ten minutes later and introduced himself...again.  He took our orders.  I ordered the full order of seitan wings with vegan barbecue sauce with some vegan shoestring fries.  My brother ordered a sandwich.  My parents ordered something or other - I can't remember.  A while later, he appeared with our food.  He put down a small plate of cubed seitan in front of me.  He then asked, "You ordered the half order right?"  I said no, I ordered the full order.  He said, "Crap, I'll be right back with your full order."  

He came back shortly with a second plate.  I noticed that everyone but me had a little plastic cup filled with sauce.  There was a pitiful amount of drizzled hot sauce on my seitan blocks.  I reminded Alex that I had ordered barbecue sauce and asked him to bring me a cup of it.  He said, "No, you ordered hot sauce.  I KNOW you ordered hot sauce.  I would have remembered if you ordered barbecue sauce.  Do you want to add barbecue sauce as well?"  I insisted that no, I'd ordered barbecue sauce and he insisted that no, I hadn't, I'd ordered hot sauce.  I didn't want to ruin what was supposed to be a pleasant evening out with my family so I let it go.  I was extremely annoyed.  Borderline furious.

He came back later on to check on us and asked us where we were from.  We could see that he had no idea that it existed, nor that he cared.  He said, "Oh, I was wondering why you didn't understand the baseball thing," and then immediately left again at a half-trot.  Soooooo weird.

My brother noticed that his "sandwich" lacked a piece of bread.  Last I heard, two slices of bread are the required criteria for a sandwich.  My family members' meals were so-so.  My vegan seitan wings were actually really good and tasted exactly how I remembered chicken wings to taste like.  However, the hot sauce which I hadn't ordered or wanted gave me an upset stomach.  I was definitely peeved.

The atmosphere was great.  You can eat outside or inside.  It was too humid to eat outside so we chose inside.  It's set up like an old mechanic's shop, which I'm assuming it used to be.  Real cool set up.  There's only one huge TV instead of a thousand small ones, and normally with a more professional/attentive server and food served the way I'd ordered it, I'm sure I would have had a great time.

I wouldn't really recommend this place if you have other options available.  We all left dissatisfied with the food and service.

I've been here for the regular lunch/dinner menu and it's been good every time. The brunch, however, is out if this world. I've been meaning to try it for awhile, but an about-to-expire Groupon finally got me there early on a Sunday. I've heard great things about the brunch but was also told he can get busy and crowded so I made sure to be there when they opened at 10am. Definitely worth the wait. 

It was a tough decision, but I rightly chose the beef chili omelet. It will definitely get me back. The menu has tons of options, including several vegetarian choices.  Service was also good and friendly.

Lots of outdoor seating and huge portions of BBQ!

I would recommend the reuben egg rolls with the thousand island dip. These we're surprisingly good and its not too heavy of an appetizer. You'll have plenty of room for your entree!

Go for their tv dinner combos and you'll have plenty of food and a good variety! I especially liked their cornbread! Yum!

Be careful as usually the weekend crowd rolls through and depletes their beer selection so you should try getting here later in the week. There were a couple of beers I wanted to try but they were all out on a Monday. 

I would come back here for their bbq and drinks! Just was annoyed by all the bugs while I was sitting outside.

What can I say that hasn't already been said? I seriously don't know why I keep going back here. I want to rave about the food because their menu is interesting, but everything I've ever had has just been okay. The servers have always come off as somewhat rude. On numerous occasions, I've had to wait when there are plenty of open tables as they are always understaffed. As everyone has already pointed out, their outdoor seating is great, but if you come at a busy time, be prepared to wait for it.

Their prices aren't outrageously bad, but you can get much, much better for your money elsewhere in Southside. Bottom line, unless you're from out of town and want this experience, go somewhere else.

The food and service were just okay -- kind of meh. I ordered the vegetarian chili and I needed to ask for Tabasco sauce -- there was no spicing and the vegetables were somewhat raw. The wife ordered a sandwich and said it was fine. The kids had pizzas and again they were nothing to write home about. Not a great place especially when the service and food are sub par.

Haven't had anything I didn't like off the menu. Go to is the TV dinner. Best draft beer selection in the area! 40+ taps with lots of local stuff too. Perfect place to watch any sports game. Tv's everywhere at the bar.
They have lots of vegetarian options here and in my humble opinion, have the best seitan wings anywhere. Good variety of beers on tap as well.

I had alot of trouble using the Groupon here. First they weren't going to let me use it because they failed to tell me that you can't use it on happy hour appetizer purchases, meanwhile I told the waitress we had a Groupon before we ordered. 
Then they decided we were not able to use the groupon because the manager said they needed me to pull it up on my phone because they have to click used when you reedem it. (I have never had anywhere tell me that before and I have used many, many groupons). I had printed it out since Groupon states you may print the Groupon and use it and I was out of data. Well, apparently that rule does not apply here.
On top of that, the Seitan was not good... at all. My burger was also terrible. The nachos were the only thing I would order again.
So all in all we had a pricey and disappointing meal and a leftover Groupon I'm probably never going to use.

I love the outdoor seating, and I especially like the brunches.  I also think their specials, such as their "all you can eat ribs," are a very good deal.  The food is pretty good, the people watching is excellent.  The Gingerbread Pancakes are excellent.  The service varies, but I generally get pretty good service at the Double Wide.  It's a fun place to go eat, almost everything is down home.

I am a total fan of this place.  To be honest the best time to go is happy hour!  Their boneless wings are half off and they are hands down amazing. Most days I can't get past them on the menu. My next favorite dish which I have had numerous times is the double wide salad with blackened chicken.  The chicken has tons of flavor and is always juicy!  

On top of the great food the beer selection is always awesome too. There is always something good no matter what ur beer preference is :)
Always am happy with DWG's veg options! Have been there recently for brunch and lunch. Thank you for great, quick service and good food!

I was seated outside with a cigar. I just wanted a beer. Later I was treated very rudely because the hostess didn't realize I had a cigar and was told to move. The food here is not good at all. Also, if you are white DO NOT come here with black people and order food.

Good bar for a lively crowd and a decent beer selection.  I didn't try the food, so I can only judge the place strictly on liquid refreshments and the bar area. 

Friendly service and very accommodating...just wish they offered a beer special or two.

That said, it's a fun, colorful atmosphere with plenty of easily visible TVs to take in a sporting event. 

I'll definitely return.  Until then...cheers!
Updating previous review food was good. Server was great glad we came back.  Everything was exactly as ordered.

Went on a Saturday around 1:15 PM.  Brunch menu was given to us.  We Since we already had breakfast, we asked for a lunch menu.  No problem -- got the lunch menu but was told certain things were not available yet (lunch doesn't start until 2:00 PM); i.e., brisket, and other items that still needed to roast.  Ok.  There were 4 of us.  One wanted chicken tenders but was told they are only served to children under 10!  Ok then.  Someone else ordered the buffalo chicken dip and chips.  Got about a handful of chips; and when asked for more was told they would be charged for another entire order.  Ok..............  Waitress was more than unemotional -- cold -- and unfriendly.  I would say, food is good; but it's best to go later in the day.

Had the tv dinner and loved it. Tried the coconut rum tilapia and it was on point. I will have to go back for the brisket after 5pm since they slow roast it all day. I enjoyed the alcohol beverages and the service was great. Costco has gift cards so you can get more bang for your buck. I saw mixed reviews on this place but I'm glad I tried it. I really enjoyed it and look forward to returning soon.

Food was terrible and service was worse... Also, not very sanitary as we had 5 flies flying around us, the food, and other people. Going outside wasn't any better, as there was a HUGE cricket that followed me, or maybe he just had it with the place too and walked out... Very disappointed.

Rude when we ask how long for a party of 13. She laugh and said when today???. I answered we called earlier  and were told you didn't take rsvp, and she said we dont, so i said then yes today why would you ask me today then??? Very rude not accommodating.

My boyfriend and I wanted to go out for dinner on Memorial Day and decided to take a drive to Southside to see what was open. After driving past tons of closed bars, we saw that Double Wide was open and decided to check it out. We weren't super impressed last time we visited, but figured we would give them another chance.

There was one hostess working and we were told it would be 10 minutes. I was super hungry and therefore didn't stray too far away from the hostess stand, in order to be able to best hear our name, as soon as our table was ready. Their system did not make sense to me at all. There were a decent amount of empty tables, but it appeared they didn't have enough bussers to clean them quick enough. Waiting 10 minutes is not a big deal at all- it is just frustrating, when there are open tables the entire time and no one there to clean them. 

We were sat on the patio, which I was happy about (their patio is pretty awesome). Our server was friendly and attentive to our table the entire time. I decided on the California salad- which was described as a bed of romaine/iceberg mix with half an avocado, grilled portabellas, grapes, sunflower seeds, sprouts and grape tomatoes. The menu suggested their cilantro lime vinaigrette, so that is what I chose. It also came with one single piece of cornbread. My boyfriend ordered their Hawaiian burger- which appeared to be packed with flavor, according to the menu and photo. My salad ended up being made of entirely iceberg lettuce, which was really disappointing. The grilled portabellas were odd and were marinated in some type of balsamic, which really didn't compliment the cilantro lime vinaigrette. The best part of the salad was the grapes and the cornbread.. which isn't saying much. My boyfriend was disappointed in his burger as well. Although it was rather large, it was tasteless. 

Although their location and patio is ideal for Southside, the food is tasteless and just overall disappointing.

This place is kinda becoming a make-shift reunion spot with my friends every time I visit Pittsburgh. It satisfies (well, more than satisfies) everyone from the hardcore carnivores, broccoli chomping vegetarians, grass fed bisons and vegans such as myself.

I got the "Vegyro" (sounds so sexual) the last time I stopped in topped off with some tangy Margaritas... really good! Our waitress was cool as hell!

(Can't remember her name :/ but... it was Friday night, March 22, 2013 about 7:30pm, back corner booth. 5 adults and one bad-ass baby boy!)  Ehem... management,.. she should be commended / given a monetary prize if you can figure out who it was.

The whole back side of the menu is for vegans... this place is in "french-fries-and-fried-eggs-on-everything-pierogi-happy" Pittsburgh?! 

Terrific beer selections, really friendly staff, and a comfortable atmosphere in my favorite section of town, South Side.

Why 4/5 stars? I'm strictly basing it on deliciousness I've had every time I've been in there. Not over the top "You SOOO need to go!", but definitely recommended.

Brought a team out for the Tuesday rib special. Long wait and once the guys ate their first round of ribs (after waiting an hour), the waitress said it would be a longer wait for the next round. That and a rib eye steak that was paper thin did not make it a good experience.
Ribs, brisket, corn bread was amazing.   No reservation we were seated within 15 minutes.   Parking can be a challenge as the lot was full when we got there.

Today was our first time at DW. It took 3 different servers to tell the hostess we were at the door. Service from there was fine. Food took 40 minutes to receive and was barely passable. Don't waste your time or money.

The only reason I'm knocking this down to four stars is because of the length of time it took for the food to come out.  

I'm told this place has been dressed down considerably, but if you like old auto body themes, maybe it's for you.  The place was absolutely packed for the Saturday lunchtime rush, but a table was free after a few minutes.  The waitress took our drink orders, returning promptly with a raspberry iced tea that "looked lighter than usual" and recommending a taste test to make sure it was ok.  It was.  

I didn't find anything on the menu noting the availability of gluten-free sandwich buns, but it turns out they have both buns and bread!  The waitress didn't have a clue what gluten-free was, and admitted it was the first time anyone had asked her about it (probably because it's not on the menu?).  After something like a 40 minute wait, a salmon avocado sandwich arrived that was really good, on one of the better gluten-free buns I've had.  The French fries were just ok, nothing to go wild about.  

For this style of burger joint, they do a pretty good job.  They just need to work on the wait time for food during a rush.

I have never been disappointed at the double wide Grill. I have given up eating red meat and pork. Still they have a great selection of fish dishes. I had to dry rubbed Mahi Mahi. 
They also have an excellent selection of vegetarian dishes.

I have never had a bad experience at Double Wide. This place really shines in the summer, as there is outdoor seating with a great atmosphere. I've been here for brunch as well as lunch/dinner.

Recommendations: 

Brunch -- DOUBLE WIDE BENEDICT. Quite possibly one of my favorite brunch dishes ever. Sweet, savory, DELICIOUS! A must try!

Lunch/ Dinner -- BBQ Pulled Porky - A great pulled pork sandwich, melt in your mouth good!

I've always thought that the prices here are a little high, but the food is good so if you have some extra cash to shell out, put this on your list of things to visit in the southside

Never disappointed with Double Wide. Food is delicious. Beer selection is plentiful. Service is good. It gets a bit crowded here during their busy hours. I guess you just have to time it right. I love going for Breakfast, Lunch, Dinner. Hell, I guess I just love going.

Double Wide Grill is the kind of place you want to be good, but never is. The only reason I am giving them two stars is because I have had experiences where the food was good (Brunch, Seitan Wings, various awesome vegetarian items that are available), however, more than often to the food is not great. I love the huge out door seating and the fact that there are so many great healthy but still enticing options to choose from on the menu, yet I only really enjoy the food probably half the time.

One thing you can count on being awful is the service. Waiting forever for a table, getting to a table and waiting forever to have someone come serve you, bad attitudes and bad service are all regular occurrences at Double Wide. I think I am a pretty low maintenance customer, and I certainly can be patient and understanding. Yet I have given Double Wide so many chances and am usually disappointed or offended. I would much rather go to OTB or Library, which both have way better food and are a block away.

Who knew such a place that just screams "huge baskets of wings and double burgers" would be so vegetarian friendly? Around my 21st birthday I had a hard time finding a mojito, so we stopped in here and got appetizers. Junk yard nachos and crab, black bean, and corn fritters were fantastic. I also discovered that mojito's aren't as good as they sound, but atleast they used real mint leaves!

DONT EAT HERE. Unless you like waiting for HOURS to eat when the establishment is empty and staffed. Oh and if you want to deal with people who obviously don't like their job. Let me start by saying I only came here because the person I was with wanted to eat here for a couple months now. We approach the host stand only to see a miserable looking straight faced girl say "there's a wait it will be 35 minutes" ok no big deal we grabbed a seat. It's 5pm on a Sunday, Pens just won. Apparently this is what a "35 minute wait" looks like (see pics) Empty tables everywhere. Hostesses waiters and waitresses just standing around gossiping. That 35 minute wait quickly turned into a 45 minute wait. As we're waiting at a table we can hear people approach the host stand and the hostess girl is telling them there's a 45 minute wait, they can't sit and wait at a table but they can sit and wait at the bar. THE WHOLE PLACE IS EMPTY WHY CANT THEY SIT AT A TABLE???? Ok long story short by the time we're asked what we'd like to order 45 minutes have gone by, by the time we get our food we were sitting down long over 2 hours waiting. It took everything not to just get up and leave but the person I was with really wanted to try it out. He wasn't happy about the service whatsoever. Just not a good way to run a restaurant. Atrocious. Horribly run business and poorly managed, if there was a manager there tonight they should be reassessed.

I would give this place 5 stars, but their soda is weird and some off brand that tastes like crap and the hostess with the bad perm and blue eyeshadow is incredibly rude. So sorry to disrupt your important text conversation and make it so that you actually had to seat someone. That being said, the food is amazing. The seitan wings are the best that I've ever had, the potato tacos are delicious and the BBQ pulled seitan is soooo good. I will definitely be back the next time that I am in town!

I love the hip atmosphere and food. it's a cool place to hang out in the summer. You get to eat outside in the parking lot and there are always cool people there in the evenings.
The waiters dress in mechanic clothes with their name patch on their shirt and look like hicks.

I probably would have never chosen to go to this place as a new resident of Pittsburgh but when I saw it on Groupon and read the reviews stating that it had a good vegetarian selection, I thought I would give it a try. 

The aesthetic of this place is like a sports bar with decor such as beer bottles made into lamp covers and hubcaps all over the roof, but the vegetarian cuisine was as dead on as some run down hipster vegetarian joint. The seitan wings with parmesan garlic sauce were incredibly delicious. My girlfriend had this coconut fried tofu dish that had great potato sides that was pretty tasty as well. I personally had this dish called a potato taco. This was quite a unique and delicious dish.

All in all, the seitan wings were definitely the highlight and I would go back for that alone. The bar seems to have a good beer selection so this is probably a good place to take beer snob friends. Also looks like they have a good creative mixed drink selection that I would be interested in tapping into next time. I recommend.
I was here when the owner of the establishment showed up.  I got better service then.   Not a tribute to what usually happens.

Hmmm OK, I've been wanting to try their brunch for a very long time..so perhaps I built up my expectations...I'll start with that....

I started off with a bellini, and was very confused when it came out with a red color to it and a cherry at the bottom. It seemed like a rose/fruit wine, not peach purée and sparkling wine. I was willing to look past it and enjoy the brunch with a friend that I had not seen in awhile, except one of the waitresses kept yelling all over the restaurant to the rest of the staff. She was not yelling in a mean way, but in a conversation way, but she was the ONLY one yelling, why not walk up to the people...she made the whole restaurant comfortable with her very loud talking. 

Now on to my, Double Wide Benedict. I had such high expectations for this..but after the first bite I knew I made the wrong choice. The corn bread, bacon and eggs complimented each other so well, but as soon as the spinach came into play it went downhill fast. It just didn't taste great all together, unfortunately IMO. 

All around the food was good, and my friend and I had fun, but I now know not to order when I go back. :)

Ok people, how is it that the last time I visited here was nearly four years ago and I forgot about it?  But subconsciously I somehow remembered what I ordered.  How?  Is?  That?  Possible?

I don't know what it is about a burger that has an egg and bacon on it that attracts me like bees to pollen (no, it's not bees to the honey, but that is another rant for another time).  I'm thinking that it's the appeal of breakfast, but the satisfaction of dinner that does it.  To say that this burger is big does not do it justice, to describe this you should use gut-buster.  This amount of food that you are holding in your two hands is enough to send you into a food coma.  Two thick slices of toasted to perfection Texas toast try their best to keep your hands grease free for as long as they can, but in all honesty, you should just accept the fact that there is no way you are getting out of there without using a stack of napkins.  The burger patty itself is cooked to your liking with the right amount of spices.  The egg is your basic fired egg, nothing special about it, but somehow definitely belongs on this burger.  The bacon people, my god, what is our obsession with bacon, I'm not complaining, but why in the world does it makes EVERYTHING better!  This bacon just crumbled once it hit the tongue.  Crumbled into salty goodness that makes your heart smile.  Yes it was that good!

It took me so long to eat this monster that I was lucky that my friend had gotten one of their TV dinners.  The side was nothing more that fresh cut fries.  I'm not going to go much into that as if you read my previous review how upset I was at that change.

Our server needed a little work.  Very monotone and kind of reminded me of Sam the Eagle from the Muppets.

All in all, it was a good experience.  Hopefully one I won't forget the next time around.

I want to love this place, I really do, and I usually don't give bad reviews. With that being said, however, our visit to double wide was not a returning worthy one.

First things first: Service= terrible. I work in a coffee shop and never should you ever let your customers just sit there for ten minutes without even asking if they want water...especially if it's slow! One of the waitresses walked past us four times, got the people in front and behind is, and didn't even say hello to us or be right with you. Service like this is really unacceptable. I would understand if it were busy, but the fact is that it wasn't. 

Food: now the only reason I would ever return is the food. It's so good...and that's what makes me want to love the place. We both had seitan wings which were cooked to perfection and tasted wonderful. We also ordered a basket of fries, not worth it. They charge you 4 dollars for literally one potato worth of fries...and they weren't even good looking fries. They were soggy and cold. 

So just beware going here. Good food. Bad service.

Double Wide Grill is one of those places you go to when you just want to have a fun, enjoyable meal.   And for those of you from Chicago, I don't mean the "fun-crammed-down-your-throat-with-a-toilet-plunger" atmosphere of Ed Debevics.  It's a place to simply go an enjoy yourself.

So I was out with my girl posse on Friday night.  We were going to the movies nearby at South Side Works, so we wanted a place nearby to have a casual meal.  We started our meal with some wood grilled veggies, which were delicious.  They have an interesting concept here called "TV Dinner On Trays" in which you can build your own platter by choosing 1 "On Tray" and 3 sides for $15.99.  Marla tried that and wimped out 1/2 way through it, so she took some home.  Sherry tried the barbecue chicken ranch salad.  Maryann went for the wood-grilled chicken burrito.

And then there was Susan.  Sometimes Susan gets really hungry.  Sometimes Susan wants just a plain ole good cheeseburger.  And there's only one type of meat that Susan acknowledges as a burger--beef!  No turkeyburgers, no ostrich burgers, and certainly no veggie burgers will do.  Besides, veggies are a side dish, not a main dish.  Oh, and Susan's cheeseburger?  Yummy medium well with grilled onions.

I've been to the Double Wide several times - it definitely has it's pluses, but also has minuses (hence, the middle of the road rating).

Pluses:

The cornbread:  It's good. It has a sugary crust on it that is a delightful surprise. I love corn bread and the Double Wide has gooood cornbread!

The drinks: Fantastic, in general. The beer selection is great and they will bring you a sample of anything they have on tap to make sure you like it before you order a full draft.  The mixed drinks are generally pretty good too. They have a great mixed drink/cocktail menu that has a lot of fun stuff on it. That said, I've been there for brunch and what they serve as their bellini is NOT a bellini, which is really disappointing.

The seating: It's big. You likely won't have to wait for a table. The outdoor seating is awesome when the weather is nice. It's a good place to watch sports (hockey!) because they have two huge TVs in the dining room and several other smaller ones.

Minuses:

The service: I've never had great service there. It's always slow and spotty. So frustrating.  

The food: It's hit or miss, really. It's a shame because the menu is super varied and has a ton of options for everyone - carnivores, vegetarians, vegans, gluten-free, etc. It's just NOT consistent. I've had really good food there, but I've also had really bad food there. I've had great pulled pork and horrible ribs. Great fries one time, crappy, cold fries the next. But the cornbread! The cornbread is always good!

Sooo. Bottom line: I never go out of my way to go to the Double Wide, but it's a good place to go to if I want to watch a hockey game w/ a group of people or every place else is packed.

A bbq steakhouse with a menu for vegetarians that goes beyond boring salads! Of course I had to try it. The decor's interesting, friendly and casual. I can see this place being fun on a summer afternoon. I only focused on their vegetarian menu because I don't eat meat and I was absolutely lost for choice which NEVER happens..and at a bbq place too! I settled with the seitan wings and their new aloha burger with a pineapple salsa sauce which was excellent! The meatless stroganoff was ok.. tasty, just not what I was expecting. The portion sizes are large. I have to go back to try their cheeseburger and cheesesteak and veggyros!! OMG! Everything I wanted to eat but couldn't! Needless to say I'm going back. Also, it helps that they make super stiff cocktails (nothing fancy, think sweet and potent!) and politely put up with my requests of "a little less this" and "can I add that" to my cocktail gives them an extra star!

So going back since this last review and things have turned around completely. The last few meals have been great, servers are nice and times have sped up. Maybe there's some new management but I can't complain. We go there a lot. One of the best places in the summer too!

They just opened two weeks ago. With that being said the service is still below par. The wait for our food (ticket time) was +35 minutes. The server did not understand the difference between vegan and gluten free even when we attempted to explain it. The food... I ordered a portobello Ruben which was surprisingly really good. The portobello was cooked perfectly. The serving size of the sweet potato fries was very skimpy though. I am looking forward to going back in the spring when it is warm and I can take my puppy with me for outdoor seating.

Very cool place with great beer selection. Our server was very friendly and prompt. I didn't love my sandwich but I didn't hate it. It just kinda was. 
The fried rice balls were delicious, though!  I'd eat a bucket of those with some good beer any day!

Update: we've been here many times since moving to the neighborhood and I'm starting to wonder why we keep returning. The food is mediocre at best but the servers were always so friendly and quick it normally made up for it. This last time the service was awful and when the service is bad it makes you realize all of the things you've overlooked before.

Not the same as the one in Pittsburgh's Southside. Here the atmosphere is much different (I suppose you would expect that since this is in a suburban location). The concept of the place is however similar. It is setup like an old garage and they have a bunch of different beers on tap. Their food is ok but there are better places you can go if you are looking for something to eat. What this place has to offer is the good craft beer selection in a somewhat unique atmosphere.

Came here late on a Thursday night, and our server was SO attentive (granted we were the only party there). Only beer on tap and food from the deep frier were available - but um, what else would I want late at night in South Side?? So bring it on!

We got hot and also barbecue seitan "wings" with blue cheese dressing, and loads of raw veggies. The seitan plates were pretty small, but clearly delicious, because we devoured all of it. Even the obligatory celery sticks.

They have a pretty solid beer menu, and the wait staff wear the most charming grease-monkey one-piece suits. It sounds like I'll have to return in summer to get some of that outdoor seating.

This was my first visit and I was looking forward to it. Our server was good. Large vegan/vegetarian menu. We started with the Reuben egg roll which was pricey, but delicious. I ordered the Meatless Stroganoff and he ordered a Billy BBQ Burger. He loved his and I wasn't impressed. 

Atmosphere was loud and crowded, which is to be expected for a new place. For this area it needs to be more affordable. I might go back, or not.

Decent beer selection. Above average barbecue for a restaurant in Pittsburgh. The Rueben Rolls are really good but I wish they gave you more than three. Great outdoor seating area. There isn't anything awful about this place but there is also nothing exceptional.

Ok so in all fairness I have to admit that I was not there to eat but for karaoke and booze filled bachelorette party fun.
I can't say anything about the food, but the menu looks great, and it's nice to see such a large vegetarian/vegan selection for those who prefer that type of cuisine.
This review mainly concerns our waiter, Mike. 
Mike was about as awesome as a party of 11 revelers could ask for. He took every drink order, remembered it properly,even though we moved around the table,  and never blinked an eye at us when someone ordered 11 shots for the table...more than once. He also went above and beyond when one of the bridesmaids had a "wardrobe malfunction" with the strap on her tank top and brought us a pair of pliers to help fix it. 
Mike is the kind of employee any establishment would be proud to have!!

(and I'm totally coming back here to try some pulled pork or brisket!)

Let me paint the picture of my evening spent here. 

Like most nights it began with a single thought "I want to get drunk." This thought usually turns into action and within an hour I have found myself a cozy watering hole. BUT, this night was different. Not only was I thirsty, I was also HUNGRY. Eating out isn't something I do often, I like to save what little money I have for libations. 

I've always been intrigued by this place. It kinda has this late 50's service station look to it. Has some sweet lights and even some corn hole boards in the corner. Since I was the East Cayahoga state champ of cornhole back in '83 I figured it was reason enough to check out the place. Outside seating is a plus especially since the weather was actually nice. 

The biggest plus was that I coordinated my visit with 35c wing night. I consider myself an amateur coniseour of wing and wing like foods (basically anything you fry) and let me tell you, these guys blew my socks off. They were fried perfectly with just the right amount of crispiness, they were pretty good size and the sauce was orgasm worthy. 

So in conclusion roll on in to the double wide grill and let em lube ya up with the sauce and some frosty brews.

One of the few places in south side that offers vegetarian or vegan options. Unfortunately those are always bland and mediocre at best. I've had their vegetarian chili, which was more of a bean soup with no flavor and no kick. Thank god it came with corn bread or I'd have starved.Their seitan wings are probably their best vegetarian option. Their potato tacos are also bland and flavorless. Vegetarian/vegan shouldn't mean flavorless. Decent service, although there's almost always a wait.

Extremely disappointed and unimpressed. My boyfriend and I were visiting our friends in Pittsburgh last weekend and we were really excited to try this place, due to their many options for herbivores. We ordered delivery and discovered the restaurant was out of the ingredients needed for our desired order...whatever, it happens. What really annoyed us was the quality of the food or lack thereof. The seitan "wings" were both tiny and so salty that we ended up just throwing them out. (Apparently, DWG equates "Cajun" with "nauseating/dehydrating dose of Lawry's Seasoned Salt.") 
We also ordered the lentil Nekkid Burgers. These are, evidently, just a patty and a bun, hence their name. Unfortunately, no amount of condiments compensated for the simplicity of these pathetically dry, cold patties. These too, were thrown into the trash.
Bottom line: I literally haven't written a review in years but severe disappointment prompts one to warn others.

I found out about Double Wide Grill on the search for great restaurants with plenty of vegetarian options, which they certainly have!

I've come here for dinner and drinks a couple times and it's been fairly decent both times. Their service and location are both unfortunate, seeing as the hostesses do a good job of ignoring guests and it's located smack-dab in the middle of the Southside (womp womppp). I will say, however, those veg chicken wings (make sure you get the garlic parmesan) are the BEST veg wings I've ever had! Spak Brothers is definitely a close second.
