My main entree for both instances was pretty good, but not outstanding. I had a crispy tofu dish with lime and cilantro and rice. While it was yummy, it was one of those situations where it wasn't tasty enough for me to want to eat the leftovers for lunch the next day.

All in all, Double Wide has a wide variety of O.K. vegetarian options, though there isn't a whole lot that really stands out (aside from the seitan wings). Be wary of the service! They can tend to be a bit on the unfriendly side.

When I first saw a Double Wide location near my in laws I got pretty excited. I've been to the South Side and Mars locations numerous times and have really enjoyed the food and beer selections.

But the choice for this local chain's third location seems a bit off the mark. It replaces a longtime restaurant that older folks seemed to love called Teddy's, so I think that's one aspect that would make locals want to pass on this place. The little turn off at the light to Double Wide is still called Teddy Drive.

We came here at dinnertime on a Saturday -- it was oddly desolate. I think there were two other families there in the dining area around 5 p.m.? It looked a little busier in the bar. Decor is a little more bare than the other places.

I had the brisket, and it was as good as ordering it at any other location. It's moist, tender, practically melt-in-your-mouth and the sauce is mild but complements it well. I also had a few bites from the hubby's plate; he got the TV dinner meal so it was a sampling of all kinds of things. The pulled pork was very good, but the sauce was much hotter than I remember it being. I like spicy, but this was borderline over the top. I felt bad for my MIL, who ordered the pulled pork and couldn't even touch the sauce. Fries, traditional or vegan shoestring, are both very good.

On the other hand, I don't think the vegetarian menu translates very well in this market. Double Wide has an impressive vegetarian selection. It's arguably one of the best vegetarian restaurants in the city, but the server told us not to bother looking at the last two pages of the menu unless we're vegetarian. I thought that was kind of a shame, since their veggie menu is very good too, regardless of diet.

Overall, I love Double Wide, but will probably opt to go to one of their other locations over coming back here again.

So gooooood!! My bf and I are vegan and we're struggling to find any good vegan restaraunts - this place caters to vegans/vegetarian/meat eaters.

Their seitan wings are to die for and I'm in love with the vegan philly cheese steak .. highly reccomend for all types of diets!

The best bbq I have ever had in a restaurant, hands down. And this includes the Carolinas. I have been to alot of places folks rave about bbq, but Double Wide has a great menu for vegans and meatlovers alike! So it is perfect for a mixed crowd. The atmosphere is fantastic.

I want to like this restaurant and I keep going back bc I keep thinking its going to get better and it just never does.

The atmosphere is fun and the outdoor seating is great.  The atmosphere is the only reason to go here.

Well, their beer list is pretty good too.  That's why they get 2 stars.  Also, they do have a lot of vegetarian and vegan options so if you've got a veg friend and they want some mediocre food, take them here.

Do not get hte cilantro lime dressing unless you want to have wretched breath all night.

I've always had good service here.  I know a lot of people say they've had some problems but the service has always been great.  Considering the amount of really beligerent drunks this place gets, they staff is always nice!

Save you money and your tastebuds from this place. From the Lucky Diet soda that tasted like medicine to the supposedly smoked for hours AYCE ribs that don't even have a hint of smoke flavor or a smoke ring that you would get with smoked meat. IMHO it's really not all you can eat when they make a product so bad you can't eat all you can eat and I have eaten at many places in my travels that served smoked ribs as advertised here at double wide grille but there is no smoke flavor in their what I considered at best over baked oven cooked ribs foil wrapped in the final stages to make them fall off the bone. Since I was paying for AYCE I figured I would get at least one reorder after my initial serving. After placing my reorder it took exactly 16 minutes yes I timed it because I was already so unhappy with this place that resides on the once famous Teddys Resturant that spent years at this location after Howard Johnsons went under many many years ago. So after getting what was equivalent to 3 or 4 more bones of ribs on the 16 min refill that arrived cold I could not even eat another bite asked for my check and left. I don't see this place being in the township to much longer. It was mostly empty when I was there and I guess there is a reason it's not that busy for food. I did notice that they are still getting a younger crowd of sorts that's resorting to alcohol more than expecting decent food here. If your from out of town or a local I would keep driving past this place. The food $uck$ and is very pricey. Your welcome in advance and for those who don't heed to my warning I'm sure I will see your unbiased review along with mine.

My dad and I stopped in here on a Tuesday night for dinner a few weeks ago, and we both felt this place was just ok.  There was nothing wrong with the food when we ate it, but it was about $50 for two of us with a tip.  Too steep for non-memorable food.

I ordered a shrimp burrito ($12) that was ok.  The amount of shrimp was decent for the price, but it was just beans, rice, and shrimp.  My dad ordered a burger that was also fine.  We then ordered 2 slices of cake.  A chocolate cake, that was supposed to be super chocolate-y, was flavorless.  The red velvet was slightly better, but at $6.95/slice, neither was worth it.  My dad ordered a beer that was ok, but overall, most of the food was something you could make at home.

I wouldn't come back here except for the Vegan options, which bumps this place up to a 3 star rating.

We had a great time. Although it was a big menu, it offered a fantastic selection of food and beer for whatever mood you were in. The bar staff was friendly and helpful and we enjoyed ourselves for a quick bite and brew. A definite fun spot and we loved the three legged dog t-shirts!

I have been twice.  Both times service was HORRIBLE (I was a server for years).  They were mean, inattentive, and didn't care that my chicken sandwich came out RAW!  The second time the server never checked on us and as soon as we were done eating brought us our checks.  We wanted more drinks and told her that.  She never came back with our order and when we asked her about it she said she was waiting for us to pay.  Doesn't make any sense.  I will never go back.

I'm writing this based purely on the dog park section. I'm not sure what the full restaurant is nice. The only reason we ever go here is because we can take the pups. They have a small doggie friendly menu and offer lots of bowls with water pitchers. The people food, however, is always lacking. Tiny portions and always feels half-assed. I've heard nothing but excellent things about the inside restaurant, though!

Well. I realized that I am LONG overdue for my first-ever review update, and what better place than Double Wide, a place that I went from loathing to loving. (Okay, not *loathing* so much as *being kind of weirded out by and disappointed in*. But definitely to *loving*!)

Every year, I help run the Pittsburgh chapter of National Novel Writing Month. We are an unruly bunch of writers, some of us meat eaters, some vegan, some of us gluten free, and all of us really really hungry before the month begins in November. So, we gather at the end of each October to get together and eat and chat before the stress of the month turns us into a bunch of crazy sleepless writers.

Our old spot was no longer working out, so a friend recommended we try Double Wide a few years back. I was skeptical - my initial visit in 2011 was less than enthralling - but I agreed to try. A small group of us went in for brunch to eat and chat with the staff about hosting our event. 

I have never once regretted our decision to start using Double Wide as our Kick-Off Party headquarters, and we have been back three years in a row now.

Our group ranges from 25-40 people, and each year, the staff has handled us with ease. Lots of menu options to choose from? No problem. Separate checks? They don't bat an eye. Special menu items for our friends with dietary restrictions? They are ON IT.

I really can't say enough good things about the staff. They are just fantastic, from the management, to the servers, to the chefs who put out all sorts of tasty snacks.

Seeing as how I can't teleport back to my experience in 2011 and check myself, I'm going to assume that we just visited on an off-night, because it's been nothing but awesome on our last several visits to Double Wide.

#1. The salads are huge and terrific and come with CORNBREAD. A+++++

#2. In the summer, you can come mid-bike ride on the GAP and they don't care if you are smelly as heck!

#3. YOUR DOG CAN COME HAVE DINNER WITH YOU IN THE SUMMER. (Haven't tried this one out yet, but the first nice day of 2017, Miss Layla Grace is hitting up the Double Wide patio!)

#4. Drinks are cheap and yummy.

#5. Seriously the service is the best. Every server is amazing.

#6. They are not scared off by your massively large unruly group, and they are easy to get in touch with, easy to schedule, and they follow up and everything is heaven for scheduling.

#7. They will refill your water ten billion times during dinner, and I know this seems like a minor detail, but it is actually very important. Because, you know, hydration for your health and all that. ::love::

So yes. I'm still not huge on the trailer park decor, but WHATEVER I'm a convert and I love this place. Thank you, Double Wide, for welcoming me back after a not-very-impressed first visit and showing me that there is beauty in the South Side after dark. :)
Best mussels I've ever had. Great food, great prices, great staff, and awesome atmosphere!!! We'll be back.

I've had lunch here several times and was pretty impressed. I was there for dinner last night and ended up leaving after sitting for 2 hours and never getting service. I had to practically tackle the bar tender to get an iced tea. A little more organized table management needs to be incorporated. I was the only one who sat for a long time without service. I saw another guy chase a server down to get food after sitting for 40 minutes.

Good food, terrible service.

This place is great! The staff is friendly and incredibly helpful. The decor is a fun nod at its original roots of being a full service gas staion/garage. 

They definitely cater to a large crowd. Anyone can find something to eat here whether your vegetarian, omnivore, or even vegan! I highly recommend their Bloody Mary's. Their a perfect blend of kick with a little bit of heat without any of the crazy fad nonsense garnishes. You also can't go wrong with their Seitan Wings, even if you an omnivore! The breading and sauce are just too good to be true.

Family member brought me here a few days ago (friday night).  The place wasn't packed, and it was easy to find a table.  Good selection of beers, and the decor was rad (there's a CAR?!)  Place looks like an old garage, and the old advertisements are also awesome.  

There's something called the Polar Bear Club, where if you consume all of your food/drink outside, your bill is half off.  Coming from San Diego, I have no idea why ANYONE would want to do that (esp. since there's plenty of room inside).  Needless to say the table and chairs were covered in snow, as if to say that they wouldn't be expecting anyone anytime soon.

It is hard for me to rate a place that I frequent simply because I live right by it, so I am trying to look at this from the perspective of me not living so close.  

I like the general atmosphere especially the patio which  is always awesome on a beautiful day... however, I do not know about the service.  I always feel like I am putting my server or bartender out when I am asking for something.  Why be in the service industry if you do not want to be even slightly attentive to your tables?  I can understand if they are short staffed, but it never seems that way.  If you are in a hurry, I do not suggest coming here when they are remotely busy as even something simple can take quite awhile.  

The food is average... nothing to write home about, but not bad either.  Good beer selection and some unique good drinks too.

Double Wide is a good bet if you're looking for plentiful portions of decent food.  The menu is pretty broad and can suite a diverse crowed. Service is fine. The beer selection is also good with plenty of selections.  The bar area also gives a good place to watch games on their large screens and the bigger booths give room to meet with friends.  Based on a recent experience if you're looking for a really good salad while watching your intake - the double wide salad with flank steak was really good. Pic included.
Between three and four stars. Fun atmosphere in the summer. Food is unique. I love spicy food - so I got the Cajun pasta. It was beyond spicy. Prices are reasonable and staff is friendly.

My boyfriend and I were in Pittsburgh for the NHL Bridgestone Winter Classic.  On gameday, we drove to the Double Wide Grill for a late lunch before finding parking to get to the game.  My boyfriend is vegetarian and I am vegan, so I picked this spot because it has options for us.  It was a little tricky finding it--we were surprised to see 2341 before 2339, but once we found the right place, we walked in and were seated quickly. There is a separate vegetarian/vegan page on the menu, and items are clearly marked.  My boyfriend and I started with the seitan "wings" in the BBQ sauce, but they were really hunks of seitan, deliciously seasoned, and almost crispy.  For an entree, he got the Potato Tacos while I got the Tofu Skewers.  The skewers came out slathered in BBQ sauce with rice and a green bean melange.  Sadly the vegetable was forgettable, but the skewers and rice were utterly delicious.  I give them extra points for not putting broccoli, a vegetable I despise, on the skewers.  On my one visit, I found the service rather friendly (and we were wearing our Washington Capitals jerseys in Pittsburgh Penguins country), if a bit slow.

I will certainly recommend it to friends traveling to Pittsburgh and I will go back if I am ever in Pittsburgh again.

My wife and I regularly take our dog here to the outdoor patio area.  It is one of the very few places near the south hills where we can eat and have a drink with our dog.  They even have a separate dog menu.  They are very careful to avoid contact with the dogs and the area is set off by itself away from the rest of the customers.  

The food can be hit or miss.  I have had their burgers, wings, sandwiches, and many of their appetizers.  However, few things have ever stood out.  The one appetizer I would highly recommend are their Reuben egg rolls.  Very unique dish that is filling and has a great taste.  Other than these however, nothing has ever been memorable.

The service is always extremely slow.  No matter how busy it is, it always seems that we can never get in and out the place in under an hour.  The staff are always very friendly I will say though.

Overall I love that you can take your dog here and that alone will keep me coming back.  However I would definitely like to see some better food options.
Seitan wings and junkyard nachos were pretty good. Service was great but somewhat slow for a non-busy night

I like to talk about an appetizer that is sheer ingenious and so delicious! A Reuben Roll! When I saw this on the Menu! I was so curious! When it came out I was like..... Great choice! You have to try this! It's enough for a meal if you  include some fries!

Ordered the get er' done ribs (fall of the bone) and cornbread were fantastic, pulled pork and brisket were very good...really liked the Memphis sauce and creamy coleslaw the portion size was big enough to feed 2 of us.

they do offer specials but the server didn't tell us about them so make sure you ask (I overheard when someone asked...had we waited a few minutes to order our app it would have been 1/2 off...literally less than 5 minutes) 

The atmosphere is festive and clean, they offer places to recharge your cell/iPad you need to ask for the wifi password 

I really liked the food and atmosphere, definitely will be back!

I've been to their Pittsburgh location many times and the food is always perfect.  First time at their new Irwin location and the food was just ok. Went for a late lunch and ordered the crab fritters which seemed slightly burnt and/or fried in old oil.  Enjoyed the pork and pineapple wrap just wish I had pineapple in every bite.  Mother had the chicken avocado blt she said was flavorful but the lightly grilled bread it came on was a tad too greasy.  Young female staff and our server was very nice and knowledgeable.  Will be back.
Excellent food. Atmosphere is that of a garage. We went expecting more of a diner. It is closer to gormet. Parking can be a problem.

Stopped by today for brunch. I haven't been to double wide in almost a year. This was my first brunch with them. I found their brunch menu large and full of options.. Same as their dinner.

I went with stuffed French toast (stuffed w. cream cheese) which came with a side of potatoes. My bf ordered the double wide Benedict. My French toast was ok, but idk it sounded better in the menu. The cream cheese was off. Idk if it was fat free or vegan or whatever. The French toast itself was great. The side of potatoes were lacking in quantity, but still were good. My bfs Benedict was (to his surprise, lol) served on cornbread. He substituted cheesy grits for his potatoes. He enjoyed it but said the eggs were cold. He's extremely picky on grits and didn't like it either (i tried it as well. Again, the taste was off) he said the meal would've been better if the eggs and corn bread were hot.

Service was good. Our server was new but still did a great job.

I've experienced double wides ribs and other comfort food dishes. The menu and food are good, as well as the service. We live nearby and come by seldom, but we still do visit. I just personally feel that its a little overrated and sometimes the food isn't as great as expected. today's meal proved the same. It is a cool spot though in the summer with the patio and dog patio. The food and drink menu are great.

My husband and I were visiting the city and someone recommended this place. We went with a taste for barbecue. Double Wide delivered! I got a platter with some pulled pork and brisket. So tasty and tender. It came with two small cups of sauces and I enjoyed mixing each meat with each sauce, to find the best combo. They also had the best cornbread I have ever had! There were two choices for coleslaw, and I got the vinegar and garlic option, which I didn't care for so much for. It wasn't creamy at all. Overall, I did feel like it was slightly pricey, but maybe that's just that area. Service was satisfactory.

I was so excited to come here after reading the great reviews. Since we had both vegetarians and meatatarians the menu really looked great It was mostly a let down. The food was okay. A bit overpriced for what you actually got. I wanted to get my son tofu only to find out you can only get it covered in a bbq sauce apparently? I couldn't just order plain tofu. It was weird. I got the crab, black bean, and corn fritters and they were very bland. I couldn't taste any crab and seriously where were the seasonings? We did enjoy a chilli cheese fries vegetarian style. The veggie chilli was the highlight of the whole meal. Also, someone got their cherry coleslaw and really liked that. Other than that nothing impressive. 
Also a previous reviewer had mentioned the scantily clad servers but I figured it couldn't be too bad since I hadn't seen it in other reviews, but I gotta say I wouldn't consider this a family restaurant. All the women were wearing low cut tanks with their bra straps and the bras themselves on some girls showing. Some were wearing shorts others tight jeans. Our server was very spacey and we kept having to repeat ourselves cause she just kept getting this dumb look on her face and not saying anything. The bathrooms were also super filthy. I don't see us coming back here.

I remember now why I was questioning going back to this dump, if you're looking for the cement floor warehouse look your in, otherwise I choose not to eat at the Home Depot, 2nd the waitress & mgr gave us a hassle about groupon, the food if you call it that is garbage bar food, if you're a drunk & don't care what you put in your gut, then this craphole is for you, please take this dumpster of a burger stand back to the confines of the south side w/ all the misfits ! TRASH, PURE TRASH ! FROZEN DEEP FRIED GARBAGE !

I will start by saying the hostess was genuinely nice and my server did a good job. That being said, it was nearly empty and our food took 38 minutes to reach the table (I wasn't counting. I sent an email after the order was taken and after a while I checked)  we were sat in a table without a light with the patio door behind us ans a waitress station two feet away (literally)I was cold the entire time. The vegan fries were good...hot and you can tell the oil was fresh. Other than that, the food was subpar and way overpriced. 18$ I received a few rubbery shrimp, some dry  tilapia in a sweet sauce, grits they raved about and they were cold and old and some coleslaw....not a fan of cherries in.my slaw.  I won't go back.  There are too many places to eat at, that cost significantly less. The prices would be fine in Pittsburgh...not in a suburban neighborhood.  Disappointing!  I see why all the other reviews were bad.

The Pros:
GREAT comfort food
Strong drinks
Delicious brunch menu
Endless vegan and vegetarian options - EVEN FOR BRUNCH!  Yay!
Huge outdoor patio space
Nice women's restrooms
Expansive cocktail list
Adorable, kitschy atmosphere
Flo, the waitress in the bar, is the best

The Cons:
You can't make reservations
They can get pretty packed
Food is reasonably priced, but the cocktails hit the wallet a little harder than the atmosphere makes it seem like they should.

Fun times in the South Side!

I decided to have a get together here for a birthday.  I called ahead to see if they take reservation...they don't, not even for a party of over 20.  I called once and the hostess said that someone would call me back.  They didn't.  I attempted to call again and they just said they don't take reservations.  I think this is a mistake on their part.  If you have more than 20 people you essentially need one server dedicated to your table.  I don't think they can properly plan for the evening.  

Moving on...I arrived early, 5:30 ish to drop off balloons and determine if they would be able to accomodate us.  The hostess looks me dead in the face and asked if I had a reservation or if I called ahead!!  WTF!!  Seriously!!  I looked at her and said did you jsut ask me what I think you asked me?  She repeated herself and I laughed.  I mentioned I tried to call several times and was told they don't take reservations.  LOL!!

I mentioned that we would be back in about an hour and that guests would start arriving around 7:30pm.  They kept trying to seat me inside but I kept mentioning that we chose to go to this restaurant because you could sit outside!  

They truly have a great outside seating area and it is right on East Carson street!  

They added some tables to an area and provided us with great service.  I honestly couldn't have been happier with our waiter, MIKE!!  Super nice guy with a great attitidee.  He was very accomodating.  He remembered what everyone was drinking even as we moved around our little area.  I can't say enough great things about the service we received from him.

I gave them 3 stars because they don't take reservations and make it difficult to accomodate large groups.  They also give you alot of hassle and don't seem to want to be real accomodating.
Had the Caribbean coconut tofu...totally bland and unseasoned! I was really hoping for great vegetarian food and will probably not be back!
Awesome choice to end out day in Pittsburgh before heading home. All four in our group left full and happy. Food was great and out server was very friendly and attentive. Happy we stopped here.

I did not enjoy my visit to Double Wide Grill.  They have a dog patio which seems like a good idea in theory.  I brought my gigantic 7 lb dog who i kept in my lap the whole time because this place was packed with dogs that people were not paying attention to.
Also, if you have to sit in the dog section, expect the worst dining experience of your life. You are treated like you have the plague. 
No one cleans the tables between customers, there is garbage on the ground everywhere.  You have to eat off Styrofoam plates and use disposable cutlery.  

The icing on the cake... the waiter cannot come into the seating area so you have to go up and wait until they come back out or hope to be able to catch them as you run up there bounding over dogs.You also have to get your food when it comes out.  

BUT they do not bring your food out in any particular order.  I was there with my friend and his entree came before our appetizer did. Then my dinner came out dead last after he was done eating and pretty much ready to go.

The food sounded good, but I honestly cannot say anything stood out. it was all kind of "meh".

I have been to many dog friendly eateries and this one may be dog friendly, but it certainly isn't people friendly. I probably won't ever come here again.

This was the first time I have ever had seitan wings. What a great substitute!! 

The coconut tofu was very bland and the rice and veggies were soaked in oil so
I didn't try them.

Service was very slow and forgot things like water and refills were rare.

Vegetarian menu was very impressive.

I came here with the hopes of having some quality BBQ. I was disappointed from the moment they brought out the food. We ordered a sampler that came with ribs, pork, and brisket. The pork tasted of nothing but vinegar. The brisket was tough and chewy. The ribs were not satisfying. Couldn't even finish this very expensive meal. Will never be returning.

This was our families 1st time here. This place is WAY overpriced for what you get. We paid $75 w tip for meatloaf, kids pizza, 2 chicken wraps, and a burger. We did upgrade a  few sides to soup.  The kids wanted wraps but not what came on them. Instead of substituting toppings, we got charged $.50 for tiny pico, .50 for tiny sour cream and $1.00 for ranch. Let me tell you that Dairy Queen snack wraps are about as big as these $12 wraps. Totally not worth it at all for any of this food. We will not be back and sure to tell others not to waste their time or money. We could of had a nicer meal at Applebee's or really anywhere. This was a $35 meal not $75.

My girlfriend and I were wondering around on the Southside while visiting Pittsburgh. I had heard that this place served BBQ seitan wings and was pretty excited to check this place out.

The decor is a kind of cheesy but retro in the same respect. I liked that they didn't clutter their wall too much like some restaurants. Our waitress came over to us and was sooo friendly but not in the annoying fake way. She was vegetarian and gave us the low down on what she really liked.

I ended up getting a Lentil Southwest burger with a side of mashed sweet potatoes and my girl got the BBQ tofu skewers with regular mashed potatoes. Everything was delicious and really hit the spot, especially after wondering around the city all day.

The waitress checked on us often and gave us some other restaurant suggestions while we were in town. I'm from Pgh but a lot has changed in the past four years. I can't wait to go back to this place.

No option for 0 stars, but the grits made me comfortable with 1 star. Here is the bullet points of our visit:

1- 15 minutes, no greeting.
2- waiter had the personality of a chalk board
3- 30 minutes for food
4- EVERYTHING was cold
5- the worst eggs Benedict presentation in history
6- more sauce, less paprika
7- no empathy
8- second round of eggs Benedict was terrible too
9- ran out of home fries, and without warning everyone got fries.

What a terrible experience. Just terrible. We both said on the way home "we should of just got whoppers".
Food is great with a ton of selections!! They also have opened back up the dog friendly outdoor section. They had to section off from the rest of the area and they did a great job.

I've been to this location many times. Our server this day was very nice. She told us it was wing night and so I moved away from my usual vegan gyro and got the BBQ  Seiten wings. They were delicious and 50 cents a piece or about half off for 5. 

It was my mom's birthday so we came because she had her birthday coupon. Make sure you sign up for their birthday club. You get essentially a free meal. Can't beat that. 

The menu here is extensive and there is sure to be something that you will enjoy on the menu. 

The decor is based off an old garage. So it gives it a gritty feel that for me almost ensures a good meal.

Reached the decision to give this place a try today even though I have driven past here numerous times and never felt drawn in enough to do so before. My friend and I agreed to meet for drinks and dinner, but since neither one of us likes to do the choosing, our on-going discussions eventually led us to come here.

I was prepared for an unpleasant experience since most of the reviews I read were not very favorable.  We planned to dine outside, but by the time our meeting rolled around it was raining pretty steadily. Besides the outside patio, there is seating in the expansive bar area or in a larger dining room on the opposite side. If you plan to take advantage of the Happy Hour specials be sure to sit in the bar area as they will not be offered in the dining room.  I never understood the reasoning behind this practice , but other establishments do the same thing.  If you order an appetizer seated on the left side of the room, you will pay more than the patrons seated on the right side of the room. Confusing.

The menu was much larger than I ever expected.  Strangely, for as big as the menu listings were, I really didn't seem to gravitate towards anything listed. I must have flipped through it several times before I decided.  Since I generally like brisket, I thought I would give their version a try.  The menu stated that it is only available after 5, so I was good to go. 

Our food arrived in a reasonable amount of time, and I found the brisket to be very tender and flavorful. However, it was a bit pricey for the portion size at $13.99 with a side of vegetables.

My first experience went better than expected, and I do like the concept and surroundings of this place well enough to go again to see if my ratings are any different.

Fast service

  I was in town and decided on brunch.  The original pick had a hour and a half wait so double wide was the backup choice.  I was seated immediately and the waitress was really fast.  I went with the carnivore omelet and it seemed like it came out in 5 minutes.  Unfortunately the carnivore omelet was lacking in the meat department.  I expected a lot more meat toppings than what came on it.  The taste was okay.  It came with breakfast potatoes and they were enjoyable, not special however.

I would give the food 5 stars and the service 3 so I decided 4 stars was fair. Given the fact that we sat as a table of 5 at 7pm on Friday night on the southside, I was expecting the kitchen to be backed up. But then again I got my food at 9pm. 2 HOURS LATER. That is just slightly crazy. Especially since the tables next to us were served a ton faster and left before we even got our food.

There was a bit of a mix up with the servers I think. There were two in the section we were seated in and nobody came over for about 45 minutes. We finally went up and asked the hostess and she sent one over to us. 

We ordered two of the full orders of seitan wings with sweet bbq and garlic parm. I absolutely love these! So good and definitely shareable for a table. The bbq ones were my favorite. On the side of the garlic parm ones was a dish of the garlic parm sauce that you had to pour over, but a lot kf the garlic oil came out first, kinda drenching the wings. Spoons for that are recommended!

I ordered the shroom and swiss lentil burger with fries. The fries were SO good. Chewy and crunchy and perfectly shaped with no sogginess. The burger was really tasty, especially the mushrooms. Lots of flavor! It was huge and super messy but I loved it.

I would love to come again when it is less busy and try some more vegetarian menu items! Maybe one of the seitan sandwiches next.

Really great service, great food, fun atmosphere, great vegetarian options, reasonable prices.

Had some of the best service I've had in recent memory, left the place full.

Okay--here I am nearly 5 years later back in the city.  I used to love this place and it has grown pretty well.  I like their vegan menu.  I like their beer.  The wait staff could be a bit more attentive, but overall I really like it there.

Food is a hit or miss here. My favorite thing I had was the cheesy grits. The side that used to be teddys old bar gets extremely loud because of the way the room is with high ceilings. Waitresses aren't very attentive either. We never got drink refills once and only saw our waitress when we ordered and then when she gave us our check. It doesn't matter if you have great food, if your staff stinks then no one will want to come back.

I recently became a Pescatarian so their aren't as many options as I had before  at certain restaurants I loved going to so it was refreshing to see that they had a whole menu dedicated to vegetarian/vegans/Pescatarians. This particular visit I tried the Seitan wings which taste wings, but on the other hand does taste a little "substitutish", but they are good. They are made out of a wheat protein and you can have any wing sauce that they have for their regular wings and the vegetarian wings are fried up and delicious. Also had a side salad with a cilantro lime vinaigrette thats really good too. My main dish I had the Jamaican Jerk pasta with added salmon. This is spicy but really good. it comes with a like creamy sauce with jerk spice. There are little onions, peas and peppers in it as well. Its a nice size portion.

Solid, greasy, comfort food whether you come here for lunch, dinner or breakfast. Lots of their menu items can be or are vegetarian or vegan. Big drink menu including some frozen concoctions such as blended mojitos and mudslides.

Huge TVs and lots of them, so I can imagine this place will be great to watch a game at. We'll see how they look during NBA playoffs!

We come here way often! The food is delish,  the team divine! Many options that don't include meat! Our server today, Desiree, was exceptionally patient and helpful, guiding us through the newer menu! The price is always right especially with coupons Groupons and  discounted gift cards from Costco!!
Nice to have somewhere local to stop in for something healthy (or not - depending on mood) whenever the feeling strikes!!

Tired to meet with manager Dave to schedule a party of 20+ people
He was TOO BUSY to stop out at the bar for
5 minutes
Take the party to Rodney's instead
Great business move
Place will be outta business unless the management changes there really soon

We have been here twice, and most likely will not be back. Food is ok but takes forever and isn't really hot when you get it. The bar side is much more eye pleasing and has a more comfortable feel. I do love the fact that in the hallway they pay tribute to the 2 places that had been there before. I have been to both double wide grills and this one is not up to par with the other. I think with some changes this could be a great place, but sadly it only seems to be getting worse.

I like the concept of a garage-turned restaurant, I like the ample outdoor seating, I like that there is an area that I can take my dog to chill with us while we dine. I've just never really been thrilled by the food.  Most recently, we had burgers that were all over-cooked, dry, and a little difficult to finish.  The fries were ok, but nothing special.  Similar feedback for my hubby's buffalo chicken salad. 

If I find myself there again...lets face it, I probably will as its a cool spot to hang out...I think I will opt for the vegan/vegetarian choices, which always get good reviews, to see if these are more pleasing to the palate.

Terrible service and mediocre food. When 5 things on the order were wrong, waitress was combative. Both burgers were wildly over cooked. Vegetable of the day - snap peas and red peppers - were basically a burnt pile of oil with little flavor other than grease. Cuban sandwich was good but bread was a bit too oily. Prices were low is the only other positive.

Came here for some late nite food after barhopping down East Carson.

What else to get at a gas station-turned-bar than some cheap beer (Yuengling) and a big ol' order of 30 wings--both of which hit the spot. The beef chili was also delicious, with big chunks of peppers, onions and tomatoes.

Overall, I'd say this was one of the best places I ate at on my recent trip to the 'Burgh, and was a perfect way to cap off a night out with friends. I will be back.
Got the grilled veggie and Brie salad w/ grilled chicken. It was delicious and hit the spot! Came with corn bread which was moist and tasted great. I love when I get a good meal away from home!

I don't understand the negative reviews. Just stopped in while in town. Vegan Bloody Mary?! Ok yes please! It was spicy and tasty. Also had a variety of sides (we have a three year old and a five year old) - the seitan wings were divine, the vegan sausage tasted good but was more reminiscent of meatloaf, the shoestring fries and the rosemary potatoes were very yummy and the avocado club was monstrous and delicious, ooh the garlic slaw too. I'd go back just to get that. We ate in the patio and the weather was perfect, inside did feel a little chilly to me. So vegans -- if you're in the area pay a visit!!

This is a Great addition to the neighborhood. 
If you are vegetarian or vegan this is the only place in the hood that offers good GOOD variety of choices for this. On top of this it original deco ambiance good service and reasonable prices. Thank you double wide for opening this location. I used to go to the south side now it's close to home and for sure my top choice in casual dining!

Really nice and a GREAT option. 

Really funky and crest menu which will bring a smile to your face HOWEVER when the food shows up you will be really pleased with the presentation, creativity, quality and taste!!! 

Home run. 

Great vibe overall. 

Would ABSOLUTELY GIVE IT A TRY.

My first experience of Double Wide grill did NOT leave me wanting more. When we first walked in the girl at the front was on her cell phone. Another girl saw this and said that the girl on the phone would be with us In a min. When the girl got off the phone she said " I love you too" so I'm gunna assume she was talking to a boyfriend or family. Completely inappropriate. The service was very slow and our waitress was nice but very quiet especially when they had a live band playing music, we could barely here her and had to ask her to speak up each time she came over. The food took a while to get served to us. My fiance got the breakfast burger which the meat was delicious and I felt seasoned well, it came on toast which became completely soggy from the grease so he was literally holding meat in between his fingers. I got the mac and cheese. It was OK but I wouldn't order it again. I felt the prices were too high in my opinion. I don't think we will be going back anytime soon

Mediocre food at best and Very Rude. Our first time here was a couple of Summers ago on a visit from Florida. The food wasn't that great, but tolerable. 
 This past July, we were one again visiting the area as we do often and decided to go here because we had our small 8lb dog with us. The web site said they were pet friendly so we decided the mediocre food would be ok as a solution. 
  I walked onto the deck while my friend went inside to let someone know we were there. Keep in mind, no one was on the deck during dinner that evening. The girl he spoke with inside was very rude and demanded that we take the dog off the deck and around to a small section of deck enclosed by cheap lattice fence that felt like a kernel. Two girls come out who clearly did not want to wait on us and start handing us menus and silverware over this 4 ft fence. When asked if this was how we were going to be served, we were told that they couldn't get dog hair on them and take it back inside. My dog is 8 lbs, short hair, and laying down. All of this may have been acceptable except for the fact that the only three people involved in our experience made us feel extremely unwelcome by their words, facial expressions, and tone.
    My point is, please don't advertise a place as pet friendly if you are anything but friendly. Any dog owner will tell you that a dog is a family member. Traveling with a pet is not an easy task, but sometimes necessary. Being right off the PA Turnpike, I would think this might be a common thing. I have never been treated so poorly in a restaurant.

Went to the Pittsburgh VegFest 2016 today. 

Got a few *Hail Seitan* bbq wings from their food truck a tasty snack with a lil kick. On my list to try Veggyro the only downfall is I will bring my own tzatziki sauce, they use tofo to make theirs. Also want to try the stroganoff w/ red pepper rice. Can't wait to go back and try new snackies after some new tats.

I had no idea what to expect, and was pleasantly surprised.  My Uncle and Aunt were in town, and he is decidedly a "Meat & Potatoes man" while my significant other is vegetarian... Double Wide is much more than just a compromise, they were both well satisfied.

The outdoor seating and atmosphere is great, especially if you get such beautiful weather as we did...  once you get used to the (sometimes ludicrous) rumble of Harleys as they leave on east carson.  I had a Border Patrol burger (avocado, peppers and cilantro) which was well grilled... nothing to go too crazy over but well done.  My significant other had a lentil burger version of the same and left very happy.

That said, who else in Pittsburgh serves SEITAN and TOFU and attracts bikers on harleys in the masses?  Granted, it was hard to tell if these were the authentic biker types or the Sewickley harley types but they weren't wearing helmets so I doubt they were from that uppity of a suburb.  I had my mind on a tasty burger but I can't wait to go back and try some of the vegan and vegetarian options (Seitan wings, seitan ribs, seitan pulled pork sandwich and salad and probably 3-4 other tofu/veggie options).

Oh, and prices were extremely reasonable.  Sandwiches and burgers were $5-8 with only things like steaks and ribs venturing into the teens.

We stopped in here for a drink based on the recommendation of our shuttle driver. It is a tastefully decorated themed restaurant and bar. Although we did not eat, they had some really interesting and unique menu choices. Everyone that was eating seemed pleased with their food. The staff was all friendly. I am guessing that most of the patrons were tourists because there was no vibe of them being regulars or even locals. Since there wasn't much going on in the way of conversation or interaction at the bar, we just had one drink and left. We will have to go back in the future to try the foods.

Double Wide Grill has a pretty laid back, chill atmosphere. I had Sunday brunch here and was pretty satisfied with my meal. I ordered the Double Wide Benedict and devoured it quickly, mostly because I was starving at the time. The order was nothing spectacular, but it was a solid plate. The poached eggs were nicely done, and the hollandaise was good. They have a regular Eggs Benedict, but the Double Wide is unique because it is on corn bread rather than the English muffin. The salty sweet combo made it different and rather enjoyable. 

If you're looking for some outdoor dining, they have a nice area outside, which they call their patio - good for daytime brunch in the sun, or getting some fresh air with your beer during happy hour. 

Also look for their specials - ribs night and happy hour/night specials. I haven't been here for drinks yet, but they do have a nice draft selection. I'll be sure to check it out soon!

I visited the Double Wide for one reason only: the vegetarian seitan wings, and they didn't disappoint. The seitan isn't that rubbery stuff you are in danger of getting anytime you order seitan at a new restaurant. In fact, to my delight it is almost a seitan-tempeh hybrid with just a hint more texture that really serves its special purpose of being turned into wings. With three choices for sauce (BBQ, spicy, or honey garlic), you can bet I've been back for seconds, and I don't even live in Pennsylvania. 

And how can you have wings without beer? They have a pretty respectable list and a patient staff who helped my wife and I get exactly what we were looking for on more than one visit. We even ventured into the food menu once and enjoyed almost everything we tried. If you're like me, the heavy-handed theme of the restaurant may be a bit of a turn off, but give it a chance. As it turns out, it is not one of those chains your parents dragged you to as a kid.

I don't know how many times I passed by this place before realizing it was actually an eatery and not some old shut-down gas station.  I am glad that I finally found it, though.  My only issue on this trip was that I had Sophie with me.  Oh well, into the jacket she went, and into the restaurant we went.  

Amazingly tchotchky interior, but amazingly appropriate for the location, the history, and surprisingly not overdone.  Not a lot of other customers, but we were in at around 3pm -- a time when most other people are not eating.  Looking through the menu, I was surprised to find "Tear Jerker" flavor for the hot wings.  My first thought was, "BAH!  People in Pittsburgh don't know what piquant is and that is what I will be getting."  I then ruffled through the rest of the menu and we ordered the following items:

5 regular wings
5 tearjerker wings
split pea soup with ham
potato soup
DW Cheeseburger (plain/medium) with fries
Pepsi (x2)

I am uncertain about the full gamut of the menu, but they appeared to be fairly hospitable to those that were looking for gluten-free food as well as having many vegetarian and vegan options that were clearly marked on the menu.  

Our soups and drinks came out right after we ordered.  I didn't like the Split Pea soup.  It was grainy and tasted like it had just come out of a package.  I had a few bites and then just set it to the side.  I used my soda to wash the flavor from my mouth.  I didn't even bother to try the potato soup.  Not to long after I aborted soup consumption, the wings arrived.  My nose immediately caught the fragrance.  Oh...the smell was good.   My friend made it clear that I was not to have any of the regular since he was not going to eat any of the tear jerkers.

After having finished my scoffing at him, I went right for my wings.  The flavor was good.  They didn't burn.  I knew it; I continued on eating them leisurely while drinking my soda.  On the third wing, my nose, eyes and mouth burst into flames.  I couldn't believe it.  My complacency had caused me to be unprepared for the piquancy.  The delayed ignition only hurt my pride a little compared to my friend laughing at my running nose and the tears coming out of my eyes.

As I finished the fourth wing, the hamburger arrived.  I abandoned my last wing while I cut the burger in half.  It appeared to be more a medium-well than a medium temperature; this is a heads up to order a temperature lower.  The flavor was good and the meat wasn't overly dry.  I will order a medium-rare next time so that I get the proper temperature.  When I finished the burger, I ate the last wing.

I will return here.  There is no question about it.  I enjoyed the flavor of the wings, but next time I will not be unprepared.

Had lunch on Saturday afternoon around 2:30 pm. 

The good - 

outdoor patio seating and our wait staff.  Wait staff seemed knowledgeable about the menu and the beer list. The rice balls was tasty. Pull pork sandwich was okay but nothing  special. Overall service was excellent 

Bad - 

Beet salad wasn't good at all. Beets looks like it came from the can.

I wish I had gotten to eat here, but my friends and I went for post-happy-hour, pre-serious-college-drinker hours.   A perfect place for a drink on the rambling patio/porch/outdoor area with the doors open and the warm breeze wafting around.  

Highly recommend for drinks.  Can't comment on the food.  A total shitshow when the kids come out for the drinking, but that's when it's time for this old lady to go home.

This was a nice place to grab lunch. We sat outside on the patio, in what used to be a service bay. The atmosphere is pretty cool, if you're into "early gas station." I can work with it. 

I wanted a Bloody Mary and it was pretty good. Not the best ever, but decent. My salad was honestly underwhelming...the goodies I ordered on top - avocado, steak, and cheese - were in very short supply, and since you pay extra for each, that didn't go over well with me. Vinaigrette dressing way really good, though. 

I appreciate the attempt at vegetarian versions of traditional barbecue and appetizer options. I don't need them, but I think it's cool to offer these options for people who do. 

This was the last place I ate in Pittsburgh and it left me with a good impression of the city's dining scene. At least it was a little different from the norm.

I'm a vegetarian slowly trying to reduce my animal product intake so I guess it's safe to say I prefer more of a Vegan diet. I used the Happy Cow app on my phone to find the restaurant as I am in town from Philadelphia. I ordered the BBQ seitan wings and let me tell you, they were better than I could've hoped for. My boyfriend got actual bone-in wings and said they left a little to be desired as far as taste goes (he got a spicy flavor. Forgot the name). We shared the Veggyro and it was just ok. The sauce it was cooked in was very heavily salted...and the cucumber sauce it came with left a little to be desired. Overall, I would 100% come back for the seitan wings, the good atmosphere and the location.

What's the definition of crazy - doing the same thing over and over again and expecting different results.  Well I can honestly say I've gone crazy b/c of Double Wide.  I keep going back, thinking and hoping that this will be the time it's good, this will be the time it's great, but then reality slaps me in the face and reminds me of why I avoid it here.

Besides the outdoor seating which is awesome, DWG doesn't have much going for it.  I've tried so many things on the menu and nothing sticks out as being "good".  But at the same time, nothing really screams "bad".  It's a totally forgettable dining experience.  

I refuse to be DWG crazy - I've reached the end of our journey together and hope that we don't have the unfortunate pleasure of meeting again.
Pretty decent bbq spot with many options on the menu. Not your hood bbq joint but its clean and nice for a good meal with family and friends.
I love it here! Their food is great, the staff is friendly, the menu options are splendid, and the atmosphere is terrific.

DWG frustration. 

Again...went to the Double Wide Grill on 4/11/15 around 6:45 PM. There were seven (7!) tables open in the bar area alone (seats at the bar were 100% occupied but all the booths and small tables were vacant) and at least 1/3 of the tables outside were vacant...and on a nice evening, too (clear skies and slightly chilly in low 60s as the sun was setting). Went in to get a table and was told it'd be 30 minutes. 

Yes...that's right, 30 minutes to get a table!! It's frickin Saturday evening...seat people. Either DWG cannot appropriately staff this restaurant or they have too many tables for their capacity. Either way, poor management. 

I won't visit this place again even though I like the food and staff. If I have to wait 30 minutes for an available table (of many tables already available), I'll go somewhere else where I feel wanted. 

Too frustrating.

Yea. Had massive stomach pains at 2:30 AM after eating here. 

I hate this place.

I seriously hate this place.

This place is what's wrong with the Pittsburgh dining scene.

I have been here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.  Each time the experience is beyond mediocre.  It's a shame, b/c I really like the concept.  The bar here is really nice and I think that is it's biggest feature.  Service is OK on the restaurant side and good on the bar side.  I would just return to have a drink here and maybe an appetizer.  Don't expect much, and you'll enjoy!

I love bringing out of town friends here, but it's not the only time I get here, I come in for lunch a few times a month. I love the "white trash" theme of this place, it even spills out into the menu.

I've been here three times and each time I tried a different item. On my last visit I had the vegan chilling. It wasn't overly spicy, nice flavor, the smokiness of the vegetables came through the chilli spices. Nice dish!

Over the summer I came in with friends to imbibe the beer selections. I found a nice IPA that went well with the seitan wings, corn and crab fritters and regular wings we shared under the big green truck at the bar.

Speaking of corn and crab fritters, this is the best thing on the app menu, you get a dozen of these tiny gems. Sweet corn and tasty pieces of lump crab together in a not too "cakey" batter fried to a golden fried goodness. A Cajun mayo comes with it that compliments these morsels of shellfish and maze wonderfully.

I have to say this place is as original as it gets. Back in the eighties Bob's auto bar downtown invoked a theme where you sat in gutted cars, but Double Wide Grill is much more inviting with a great location. My only wish was a parking lot, I wish I could have the time back I've spent trying to find a place to park. I subtract one star for being so busy at times I've driven away  with visions of corn and crab fritters dancing on my taste buds.

Editors Note: On 01-04-2012 I went to the Double Wide and had dinner with my mother who won a fifty dollar gift card at her Christmas party. She'd never been there and invited me to go. I told her she was in for quite a treat. So we sat down at 6pm, we never saw our waitress until about 6:10. It really wasn't that busy although they were waiting on a group of 32 which seemed to have everyone in a tizzy. Our waitress finally showed up and we were able to order. She had the pulled pork sandwich with fries and cherry slaw and I had the meatless Stroganoff with beans and rice and "crusty whole grain bread. we didn't see our food for 25 minutes, it finally showed. My mother's pulled pork looked great, but, the first bite produced a bone. The cherry slaw was tasteless even after she added salt and pepper. My Stroganoff was delicious, but the rice and beans were cold and had gotten hard from sitting under the lights. My whole grain bread was missing, in it's place was corn bread, not a good pairing with Stroganoff. I rarely complain but i had to, the waitress was very nice and took the bill to the manager and we were comped the most expensive meal and my mother's drink was comped. This was the very first time in ten or eleven visits that i'd had less than satisfactory meals. I tip my hat to management for trying to make things better.

Was visiting a friend in town and they suggested this place. We parked a little far down for free street parking.

The pros of this place is definitely our sever being attentive as well as the variety of vegan options!

I ordered the BBQ brisket since it seemed like a bbq joint. The brisket was dry and the sauce helped but it couldn't mask all of the dryness.

The bbq sauce was freaking fantastic though! It had a great sweet tangy taste and the texture was more jammy, but definitely enjoyable! 

The bread roll they used on my sandwich was also tasty. It was soft, chewy, and slightly sweet.

Location, location, location...

My husband and I decided to stop in here last night for dinner. We asked for a booth and were seated on the "dining room" side, as opposed to the bar area. First mistake. The place is cold and just feels unfinished. There are several booths along the wall and we were seated at the last one, by the old exit door, when the place used to be Teddy's. Only one other booth was taken, why seat us way by the door. Oh, and take a gander at my pics, there are a ton of high chairs and regular chairs stacked - awkwardly - behind our booth. Second mistake; should have asked to move.

The place was freezing! I made a comment to our waitress, who stated that there was a gas line break earlier in the day and that's why it was so cold. Okay... They were supposed to open at 11am, didn't open until 3pm. Every waitress had on either a hoodie or an actual coat, that's how cold it was. Oh, and no brisket due to the gas line break.

After a short while, like 5 teenagers, I mean staff, came over and start moving tables together. Alas, they needed more chairs and high chairs! They kept going behind our booth and getting chairs, and at least 5 times actually hit the back of the booth with the chair. Extremely aggravating and rude. There was a table directly to the left of us put together for a big family with several little ones. Meanwhile, there is this huge, vast empty dining area where you could have set up these tables. At one point, one of the women got up and, since she had a purse and an extremely big diaper bag dangling from her chair, fell backwards, hitting our booth. That's how stinkin close it was to us. (again, location?)

The menu itself is way too big and busy. You simply can't have that extensive of a menu and it all be good. Or, maybe any of it. My husband got the BBQ Pulled Pork sandwich with fries and I had the Border Patrol Chicken sandwich, which came with sautéed peppers, avocado, basil pesto and swiss. I asked for no avocado, but was allowed to add lettuce, tomato, and onion "for no charge" (gee thanks). Sandwich comes out with avocado. I know, shocker. We agreed that the food was good, definitely not great. 

I'm guessing that this is most of the staff's first job, just a guess. Definitely needs some fine tuning. Definitely not satisfied. Most likely not returning. 

Note: 2 stars only because our waitress was friendly and efficient. Otherwise, it would have been 1 star.

Good beer, burgers, and BBQ. The menu is pretty ambitious at first glance; they have like 4 different "whole meal" options, but I would recommend the TV Dinner option. Your choice of two mains, three sides, and cornbread. I've had all the BBQ and it's all good. The sweet potato fries are great too: they come out crispy and not too soggy. The reuben egg rolls are another good unique Pittsburgh item. I'd go back to this place.
A waiter said to my 8 yr old "you almost made me fucking drop my glass" when he bonked in to her. And they had no french toast at 1130am.
Delicious vegan dishes! Fun decor, but pretty noisy. Would be nearly perfect if they had vegan desserts too.

This is a pretty informal meeting space.  Excellent beer selection, usually good bartenders and waitstaff, but man when you get a bad one, it's going to be painful for everyone involved.  The food is actually pretty gross, and you will seriously be burping up your sins for the next 6 hours if you even look at a fucking hubcap fry.  But, when this place is not packed, it's really fun to just sit and relax.  Also, bonus for starting Karaoke on Saturdays, though judging by the crowd, that might not be around for very long.

Great service and tasty food choices! Wait staff is very kind and welcoming. Fresh cornbread is out of this world. Mom's meatloaf was moist and full of flavor! Eclectic atmosphere. Beth was a great waitress: helpful, funny and extremely sweet.

Was wandering around the South Side and decided to give this place a try.  I ordered the "hot" seitan wings, and they were very good but a bit spendy at $8.99 for 6 chunks of vegan protein and some soggy carrots.

There is a full bar here with a good selection of craft beer.

Bonus points for the dog-friendly patio.  I may come back with my pup for "wing" night wednesdays in the summer!

I am giving this place 5 stars for a few reasons: excellent service, fun atmosphere, and good bar/pub food. We had my boyfriend's 40th birthday party here on karaoke night (great party idea!)...I was able to reserve a spot for 25 in the karaoke room and put up decorations, they even played happy birthday on the big screen. The manger Justin was super accommodating and our waiter Alec was perfect, he really made the night!! This place is a super fun night out, highly recommended.

We frequent the Double Wide, for both food and drink. My go-to dish is always the chili, with their delicious cornbread (and I have been known to order cornbread just as my meal, there!). We also really enjoy the Junkyard Nachos. If you are there during lunch, the grilled cheese with bacon and pears is fantastic, and I am a huge fan of their weekend brunch! We love the staff (especially at the bar), and they are always fun and attentive!  Definitely a "regular" spot for us!

I've been in here quite a few times and I really do enjoy this spot.  I've had a couple things that were so-so, but the things that are great are reaallly great! They've got some of the best nachos I've ever had; the cheese has a good kick to it and the chicken I add is always hot.  I also like the build your own tv dinner.  I get mashed potatoes, fruit, and the ribs [whomever I'm with picks the other stuff].  Soo good! The ribs are always tender and moist with a good amount of bbq sauce.

I'm typically a carnivore but my vegetarian and vegan friends swear by their vegan menu!

As for drinking, I typically get the Blue's Bathtub Tea which I believe is like a long island but with raspberry things instead of tea. Delicious!  Booze is a pretty reasonable price and they've got a lengthy list of beers on tap and bottle.

Everyone has their off nights, but most of the time the service is spot on, friendly and attentive. 

Overall, I would recommend.

I've been to the Double Wide Grill several times and have had mixed experiences, however, I went this past Saturday with my parents and it was a home run.  We started with the crab black bean fritters - very tasty appetizer.  
The draft selection was decent with a good list of seasonal craft brews.  For dinner, I had the meatloaf special with a side of mashed potatoes and a fantastic large piece of broccoli cooked to perfection.  My mom had the brie and portabella mushroom and my dad opted from the pulled pork sandwich.  No complaint from either of them.
Service was fast and attentive.  We were there at an off time - around 4:30 PM on a Saturday so it wasn't crowded, however, the staff was all great.

I went to DWG this past summer with my wife and two sons, we were visiting Pittsburgh and I knew of this spot thru previous internet research of the city. We went on a Sunday afternoon (around 5-6pm). Not being from Pittsburgh the area wasn't the most touristy but I've lived in bad neighborhoods so I was fine. We entered and were promptly seated. I ordered my older son a grilled cheese with fries and my younger one a peanut butter & jelly sandwich with fries. Me and my wife both ordered jailhouse TV dinners. Food arrived fairly quickly and the ribs were GREAT!, very meaty and saucy. But the highlight of the meal was those potato hubcaps, I would of been content with just eating a big plate of those. When I come back to the Burgh' I will definately get a few orders of those hubcap fries. In my TV dinner I did also have the coconut rum tilipia which was gross. The TV dinner is a huge meal, I actually left some food on my plate which I normally don't do b/c I am greedy but that is testament to how much food they give you. You get to pic item item from tray one and two and then 3 sides. The sandwiches my kids got were huge, they were kind of like texas toast in thickness. They were actually able to take half the meal home and eat it later. I will definately come back for lunch so that it is nice and sunny out and we can take our orders to go and enjoy them elsewhere in Pittsburgh as this is not a family restaurant as there was a lot of cursing and smoking going on at the bar which we were seated right across from

I have been going to Double Wide Grill for many years, especially during the time I was living in South Side a few blocks from the restaurant. I would say about 50% of my experiences have been good. I decided it was finally time to write a review.

Double Wide Grill has a great atmosphere and  great selection of food. The restaurant is in a converted auto service station. They have a decent size dining room and offer a lot of outdoor seating when it is warm out. It is primarily a Barbecue joint that also has a large selection of sandwiches, burgers and vegan meals. The Barbecue is good. Probably a little too heavy on the pepper. I usually get ribs or brisket there. Both are good, but a little on the drier side than I would prefer. Mixed with sauce, the dryness isn't as noticeable. Their burgers aren't too bad. They also serve brunch on weekends. The brunch is good, but doesn't blow me away. Double Wide probably has the best barbecue in South Side, but certainly not the best in Pittsburgh. Double Wide also has a large selection of regular domestic beers and microbrews on tap. Their prices are reasonable considering you get a full plate of food.

My issues with Double Wide have primarily been with service and misleading advertising. There have been multiple times I have eaten at Double Wide when our server has only taken one person's drink order and leaves or just disappeared for long periods of time and didn't check on our table or offer us the check when the table was cleared. We used to leave long comments on receipts complaining about the servers, but stopped after we noticed they never would fire the ones which everyone had issues. My recent experience, and why I decided to write the review, was after trying to use a Groupon. Every year or so Double Wide Grill offers a Groupon to attract more business. The Groupon lists no exclusions other than not valid on alcohol and the other regular Groupon terms. I was very disappointed when they told me in the restaurant their daily specials such as all you can eat ribs and wing night are excluded from Groupon use. This is not listed on the Groupon anywhere. Double Wide insisted these daily specials count as 'other offers' part of the Groupon. They even told me multiple people had tried that night to use the Groupon on the daily specials. It is disappointing they use the Groupon to bring you in, knowing most people will try to use it on the days with a special, only to have to order something else.

I can't say I won't ever be back since I know friends will want to go there, and I know I am a sucker for all you can eat anything. However, I can say it will be a little while before this experience wears off and I return.

Double Wide always seems like a good option but I've never had it where everything was as good as I hoped it would be. My most recent experience there was after an exhausting bike trip and me and a few girlfriends stopped to fuel up. I ordered a shrimp salad that was awesome. The shrimp was blackened and cooked perfectly. The corn and avocado were great and the dressing was tasty. This was the first time I was excited about something I have ordered from Double Wide. Unfortunately, we had met one of the husbands who brought a dog. Double Wide has a dog area, which is wonderful, but I just don't understand the service. You are supposed to walk up to a counter area and order, which is fine, but it's almost impossible to get someone's attention to order.  I will probably go again but i will sit somewhere  where the waitress actually comes up to the table.

I only gave this two stars because of the decent vegetarian/vegan menu (I liked the seitan wings). I came back with my boyfriend and puppy because it was a beautiful day and we had known this restaurant for having a dog friendly patio (which we were looking forward to). As we approached the hostess stand I was immediately told to go to the new segregated dog friendly area of the patio which was sectioned off with a small wooden fence. This came as a surprise due to the fact that the reason we had previously liked this restaurant was for it's laid back dog-friendly atmosphere. As we approached a table we were disgusted by how filthy this area was- trash all over the ground, the tables hadn't been bussed... We sat and waited for a few minutes before a server yelled across the fence to tell us that menus and silverware were available on a plastic table for us to help ourselves to. The menus were small paper take-out quality and the silverware was in a tangled mess. We felt like we were uninvited guests at a trashy house party. Needless to say we left without notice. We ended up going to Aladdin's Eatery in Mt. Lebanon where we were promptly greeted by the manager with a bowl of water for our puppy.

I've been to the Double-Wide twice for brunch now. Twice, they've mixed up the side dish for one of the plates at our table. 

But their fun atmosphere and innovative breakfast items makes up for it. The huevos rancheros and the double wide benedict are both big winners - with special emphasis on the big. Their omelets are huge. Some of their items weren't as punchy with flavor as hoped, such as the breakfast burrito, but there are lots more items on the menu that I want to try. 

As a vegetarian-friendly customer, I'm super-happy to see interesting veggie items like the seitan wings, lentil veggie burger, tofu scramble and avocado club.

Overall, the double wide is a good brunch location - laid back, no lines out the door, and good food. It's probably even better in the summer with their large outdoor patio area.

I've been here twice now.  The first time was for dinner, the second for brunch/lunch.

I enjoyed my first visit here; I ordered the peanut tofu and found it to be delicious.  You don't see many places in Irwin offering vegan/vegetarian food, so while I'm not either, I love tofu.  I am overall disappointed in the menu because although they have a lot of great things for vegan/vegetarians, a lot of the food I simply can't eat because of other diet restrictions.  But the tofu worked all considering!  I enjoyed it a lot.  My boyfriend had their ribs and also enjoyed them.

My second visit there was very disappointing.  Apparently we came in during brunch, but our waitress didn't give indication of us being able to order brunch items so we didn't.  And were disappointed when we saw all these yummy dishes coming out that were brunch-inspired.

The food took a good 45 minutes to come out.  We were more than antsy to just eat.

I ordered the Mexican chicken salad, or something like that, and it was a big let down.  The cilantro lime dressing had way too much lime in it.  The salad was quite literally just bagged lettuce mix.  It was just overall disappointing.  My companions likewise were let down by their dishes (a pineapple chicken wrap and another salad).

After a "pretty good" experience and a downright negative one, I'm not sure I'd go back.
Great food and atmosphere with a ton of vegan/vegetarian options. Ask for Bilyta as your server - she is amazing and goes above and beyond!

We went on Saturday night to satiate my craving for good karaoke. 

For food I ordered the "TV dinner" which is a huge metal tray of two entrees and three sides. I tried the pulled pork, half rack of ribs, cornbread, mashed potatoes, rice, and veggie of the day. The ribs were falling off the bone and tender, but could have used extra sauce. The pulled pork was dry and really needed extra sauce, and the texture seemed off. The sides were all pretty much awful. You could tell they make a big batch in the morning and it sits there all day. In addition they were all vastly underseasoned. My husband had the black and blue burger, which strangely enough he said was OVERseasoned. So the food was pretty much disappointing, but you do get a lot for the price, and I'll give them the benefit of the doubt since they stop serving food at 11pm and we came at about 10:40. Next time we will try eating there earlier. 

The service was fine; the waitress checked on us frequently and promptly. They do have a good beer list and the beer prices are okay, although the mixed drink prices are a teensy bit high for my tastes (although probably comparatively low for some South Side venues). The restrooms were cleaned and fully stocked, which is a plus for such a busy bar. Speaking of busy, the place was packed when we came, and they do boast an awesome patio that probably more than doubles their seating capacity.

The karaoke was AWESOME. It really saved this place from getting a two star review. They had a great, lively crowd doing some really zany and entertaining performances. The host has the best karaoke setup I've seen: live video background of you singing, playback clips of your performance, and a VERY up to date computerized catalog. If anything, I'll be back for his karaoke! We'll give the food a second shot another day.

Double Wide on Carson St is probably the best outdoor eating establishment in Pittsburgh area. I know my way around Allegheny, Westmoreland, Butler and Beaver counties and choose to eat at DWG about once every 2 weeks. 

The outdoor patio area is huge, easily tripling total seating capacity. On sunny, warm days the number of customers rises sharply which can lead to some extra wait time for seating and food. It can also lead to certain slow-cooked barbequed entree's selling out before the evening is over. Hey, I'm OK with that, it's totally understandable. The menu has broad coverage with lots of healthy & tasty options. I'd rate the portions and cost as average but quality is very good. I find it impressive that they can please both vegan and meat-eating customers. This makes DWG good for larger parties with picky eaters. For meat-eaters, the brisket, ribs, chicken, cajun fish and pulled pork is all really tasty. The vegetable side dishes are equally good with interesting combos you don't often see. I'm not into vegan entree's so I can't comment on that.

The bar is really nice and has a wide range of craft beers. We were so delighted to see former employee "Lisa the bartender" return to DWG. I'm betting the owners & mgmt are also thankful she's back. Lisa is super upbeat, interacts with patrons and serves to liven up the establishment.

Had brunch on a Saturday morning. Atmosphere and service were great! The menu had a huge selection of great looking breakfast choices. I enjoyed the double wide eggs Benedict with a bowl of cheesy grits. Excellent. We will be returning!

First time here..unbelievably good food....almost everything made from scratch...Jessica the server and Maria the manager were so welcoming and nice..lots of different foods you don't get at other restaurants...can't wait to bring my friends

One of my favorite places in the Southside!  All around good food! Outdoor seating and plenty of drafts.  They have awesome mild wings, the BRIKET is great (if they have any left) in the summer.

+ cornhole outside when the wether is nice

Pretty cool place to get wood fired BBQ. A converted gas station that offers inside and outside seating. Crowd is a great mix of locals and those traveling to the South Side for the evening.

I recommend the beef brisket. The coleslaw is tops and the spicy BBQ sauce is excellent.  Good wait staff, but hit and miss on their knowledge of beers, which can be disappointing as they have a very nice selection.

Great casual place to eat lunch on the weekends or hit it up before walking the streets of SS.

Stopped in for a late lunch today. I had the 1/2 rack of ribs, cheesey grits, cherry slaw, and corn bread. Everything was delicious. I took half of everything home the potions were so big. Staff was friendly and competent, decor is cool. What's not to like.

7Up pancakes review: light fluffy delicious. However, the pancakes come with no sides like whipped cream like the other pancake options do. I had to pay $1.5 for whipped cream (was on the check after) and another $1 to get canned fruit. So getting regular pancakes with your standard whipped cream cost $10. Pretty ridiculous considering. If you're not rolling with cash and don't mind paying a lot for pancakes, by all means get it because it is tasty.

Service is slow and the food was cold. Nice vibe. Probably a good place for drinks, but I don't recommend eating here. I had the tilapia tacos and my fiancé had the ribs. Took a while and came out cold.

Working in the Southside I get to frequent a lot of these establishments for lunch, so I do understand that the Double Wide caters more to the dinner and drinking crowd, at least I'm assuming this because the smell of beer still resonates when I eat there for lunch.  

If you want to have lunch in the Southside and you want to sit outside there aren't many options, so Double Wide might be your only choice.  If so stick to the salads as they are above average.  Everything I've ever tried apart from salads though has been a disappointment, and salads aren't what I'm normally trying to order (even though it probably should be).  If you sit inside though you will be greeted with a nice smell of stale beer that seems to have infested every inch of the place.  It's a shame too, because I do enjoy the layout and atmosphere.  If they just focused a little more on the quality and taste of the food I think this place would be amazing.  

My recommendation is to avoid unless you really want to sit outside.

Had a great supper experience at this relatively new (to Irwin) restaurant.  We loved the one on the Pgh South side, and this is no different.  Fast, friendly service and yummy food.  Had the pulled pork sandwich and unique sweet coleslaw with cherries.  Food was delicious, and the iced tea was perfect.  We'll definitely go back.

Not the kind of place I would really be crazy about coming back to.  We were walking around and decided to come in here just cause we were hungry and needed food or else we would probably die.  

Their menu is vast, there are lots of veggie options which is pretty cool if you're into that kind of thing.  I couldn't decide on a few items so I gave our server a choice and ordered what she suggested.  Wasn't super impressed, but it did it's job.
