The mixed drink I got was SUPER sweet, but I guess that was to be expected.  Not bad if you're looking for the diner food experience.

Gets one star because I was actually seated. After that, no one approached me after I had been sitting there for 10 minutes. Got up and left and the same hostess told me to have a nice day. Don't plan on returning.

So, while I really, really do appreciate that DWG have more than a couple vegan options, I just haven't had anything great here. Nothing about this place is great and on top of that, it's kind of expensive! I did here that they opened up a section of their deck where you can bring dogs again, and because I love to bring my two furkids out into the world, I might give this place a fourth try... But it really is only so-so.

The Doublewide embodies a lot of conflicting emotions for me. 

PRO: I believe they have the greatest seitan wings & pulled seitan sandwiches in town - this can go a long way for a vegetarian. 
CON: I am decidedly uncomfortable with their version of "Southern garage" culture. Section 8 meals? Oh god. I'm actually from a place with Southern "hick" mechanics, and it is a little excruciating to see realities be turned into themes. 

PRO: Their beer draft lift is exciting, with a nice balance between old friends and new adventures. 
CON: The brunch is gross. Veggie menu options are slim and everything we ordered was just gross. Brunch is very important to me, almost sacred. 


The service is almost always fantastic, though, the servers are quick and knowledgeable. The food is solid & portions are manageable yet filling, but the seitan wings are a-mazing. I think the price point is a little high, but I guess it's alright to indulge in dressed-up down-home faves occasionally. The chairs and tables are big & sturdy, and the decor is some creative mash-up of a service station and a shiny corporate restaurant. 

Good place to take a date: It's not so loud you can't talk, and I've never been gay-bashed there or anything.

I came in here with my boyfriend during the Pinburgh tournament. We sat at the bar. It was relatively busy (dinner rush).

Our bartender, Lisa, is why I'm giving 5 stars. In spite of how busy it was, she repeatedly made it a point to let us know that she hadn't forgotten us. She served our drinks and food in a timely fashion, but was so mindful of our presence, and apologetic for what she felt was a long wait. In addition to that, once things calmed down a bit, she was very personable and went the extra mile to engage us in conversation.

The rest of the staff was also extraordinarily friendly!

Huge selection of food for fair prices, and the Chardonnay was satisfying. Crisp, with a nice bite.

I got the nachos, which were abundant and contained loads of fresh toppings. My boyfriend got a burger, which he describes as "no frills, straightforward, exactly what I expected".

I would come here again, because the food was of sizeable portions and tasty, and because the service felt personalized and friendly!

Double wide in south side Pittsburgh should be ashamed to have their good name and reputation associated with this Irwin disaster. There's nothing about this location that is even somewhat acceptable for food service or dining. The staff that serves, seats, and interacts with customers is atrocious. The only way a staff could be this bad is from appalling management who is either too inexperienced to know how bad it really is, or is so arrogant that they don't even care.  The food came out luke warm, and sloppily put together. The servers can't remember any of your requests, and somehow they feel it's acceptable for a restaurant to charge you for dressings.  The prices for their menu items is outrageous, more so than the insipid taste. I could not recommend this place to anyone. Save your money, eat somewhere else. The experience was so bad I couldn't wait to get our of there, and I don't plan on coming back...

Neat restaurant located in an old gas station/auto garage. The four of us sat outside under an umbrella for brunch. We ordered a black and blue burger, a trucker breakfast, the porker pancakes, the double wide eggs Benedict, ic d tea, and a bloody Mary. The portions were generous but not obscene. There were no survivors. Service was decent, and prices were fair.

I like coming to Double Wide on Tuesdays for all-you-can-eat pork ribs. It costs only $14.99 and comes with a side of fries. You can choose from the Carolina or Memphis sauce. Overall, tasty and a great value.

Not the typical place you'd expect to find lots of veggie options. By the looks of it, you'd expect at best to have a veggie burger as the lone non-meat option. But out of nowhere, Double Wide has an entire vegetarian and vegan menu! 

It's a unique mix of people there, but I guess that's to be expected when you're part sports bar, part biker bar, and part hipster vegetarian restaurant.

Lots of outdoor seating with picnic tables, delicious vegetarian options, and a huge beer menu. The Double Wide would be right at home in Austin, but it's on Carson Street. 

Five stars for sure.

Since I couldn't find the double-wide trailer that served food, I decided to stop here and was happy to discover that this converted body shop was not an actual double-wide but a restaurant. More to my enjoyment was that they served vegan food. I decided to have the Seitan Barbeque wings and my entrée was the TV Dinner (Barbeque sandwich, mixed veggies, French fries, veggie kabobs, and cole slaw). Yes, this was all vegan and I was drooling thinking about it. But as I've experience in the past looks and thoughts of a delicious meal can be deceiving--this meal was not the case. Everything was delicious and was the best TV dinner I've ever had, even when I was a bachelor and this was my nightly meal. 

Outside of the meal, the ambiance and service was great. We sat outside on the patio and experienced an amazing night of beautiful weather.

Would I go back? Heck to the veggie yes, and encourage any vegan, or vegetarian, to support this trendy establishment.

As a food critic from New York, I was excited to try some of the food my friends from Pittsburgh have been raving about. The first of many on my agenda was this place of business. Besides the fact that it took 23 minutes before a woman finally asked "If we've been helped yet", the service in general was shotty at best. I am from New York, so I am pretty desensitized to bad service, so that was not my issue. As someone whom consumes alcohol, maybe twice every 6 months, I can smell it from a mile away and it takes just a little, to make me feel hammered. I ordered a Pina Colada, with alcohol. My drink obviously had 0 alcohol in the beverage. I did not taste, smell nor feel a thing. When I NICELY asked the server about it, I was rebutted with an accusatory tone and a major attitude, with NO RESOLUTION. That ruined my entire meal. I was very nice about it, because I did not want to cause a scene, but I really wish I had not been so courteous to that uncouth maggot, you hire to serve hard working people, a meal they paid for. She did not deserve my respect, because she gave me, the patron, NONE. I have no clue how your food taste. My order was given to a buddy's 8 year old nephew. I'm sure his young palate enjoyed the ribs. I won't disclose the young serves name, because she clearly does not know any better and with that attitude, she'll need this gig for as long as she can keep it. She SUCKS and ruined my entire experience. I so regret being so nice. I will be back, but I'll be coming with buddies who have actual power in their pen, in this town. Thanks for the great introduction to Pittsburgh.

I'd been craving barbecue for weeks, so with a Groupon in tow, we headed out to Double Wide Grill on Saturday night to feed our bellies.

We got there around 7, and waited 10-15 minutes for a table.  It was nice weather, so we ambled up and down the block.  You can give the host your cell number so they call when your table is ready - it was very convenient and allowed us to take a walk instead of having to hover around the host stand.

We were seated inside at a booth, and we both got a kick out of the old-service-station decor.  Maybe "decor" isn't the right word, since this place actually WAS an old service station, it doesn't just look like one.  Several TVs were around the room, but the volume was quiet until the Penguins started playing.

They had a pretty cool selection of draft beer - my boyfriend was very impressed and got some unusual beer.  Can't remember what it was called but it was 9% alcohol, served in a smaller glass, and he enjoyed it immensely.  They were out of Blue Moon Pumpkin so I tried something from their Wheat section - I want to say it was Southampton something or other?  It was light and refreshing.

The boy got a full rack of ribs, and I got the brisket and pulled pork platter.  Both came with cornbread, slaw, a pickle, and fries - but I got their "hub cap potatoes" instead.  It was a TON of food!  We could not finish it between the two of us.  We took a whole half rack of ribs home because we were simply too stuffed to proceed.  Makes you wonder how the guy on "Man vs. Food" can do it.

So everything was pretty much "okay" in my book, although my boyfriend enjoyed everything a bit more than I did.  I found everything to be too salty - I was continually going to the coleslaw and my water glass to drown out the saltiness.  I wasn't a fan of the pulled pork - the barbecue sauce used was very vinegary and tangy in a somewhat unpleasant way. The brisket was better - juicy, and with a sauce that was more sweet.  Still, it didn't blow me away - pretty standard.  The ribs were just okay too, salty and without a lot of sauce.  The best part of ribs is licking sauce off your fingers, but there wasn't much to lick!  Also, the meat separated from the bones as soon as you pulled on them - the meat slipped off before we could even take a bite, so we didn't get the fun experience of holding up a meaty rib and nomming the meat off the bone.  We were left with just a plate of meat, which wasn't quite as fun to eat.  Cornbread was good, fries were addictive, and the "hubcap potatoes" were okay - nice garlic flavor.  Nothing was very hot (temperature), seemed like maybe the food had been sitting for a while.

Speaking of "a while," service is very slow like everyone else says.  Our waiter was certainly friendly and pleasant, but we waited a long time to be greeted, a long time for our beers, and a very long time for our food.  Sounds like that's just the way it is here.

I was feeling sort of "2 1/2 stars" about the whole thing, but my boyfriend was so enthusiastic about the meal that I'll go ahead and give it a 3.  If you're craving barbecue it's a fine place to go to take the edge off, but it isn't the real deal.

We have tried double wide a few times and have finally given up. We have sat at the bar each time in and the service is awful. The bartenders act like they are doing us a favor to wait on us. They have their "click" that they wait on and talk to. If you are not in it you are lucky to get a drink.  We had a similar experience to another review when asking for a menu- they basically threw it at us. Menu was covered in some type of sludge similar to the slime from ghostbusters. Food was decent although overpriced. 1 star is mainly for consistent horrible service and filthy bar area.

Really nice atmosphere and friendly staff. Had the coconut chicken and fresh veggies. The chicken was grilled perfectly and the coconut sauce was light and not at all overpowering. I'd like to try the BBQ next time as I think this is their real specially. Overall a fun place with good food.

The separate vegetarian and vegan menu is awesome. I have tried almost everything vegan and it is delicious. I am obsessed with the lentil burger. The service is amazing and I am never waiting long for my food even during the busiest hours. Must try!!!
Crazy friendly service, TONS of outdoor seating and the BEST breakfast burrito. WHOA. Everything good.

Incredible. Plenty of choices for vegans and vegetarians. Even choices for carnivores. I had the veggie Philly cheesesteak sandwich. Great and filling. They even have a separate fryer just for vegans.
Service? Never had better. A must when visiting Pittsburgh, only wish there was one in a Southern California.

Went for Sunday Brunch. Walked in around 1:40 and they said they stopped serving brunch for the day already, meanwhile the table next to us ordered it after we arrived. The waiter seemed to have little to no personality. I had to ask for a water around 6 times before I got one. He also knew very little about the menu and cocktails. It seemed like a great environment but sadly didn't get to experience it.

I ate here a second time when I was in town. It's just so good! Those hubcap potatoes are amazing. I would eat those all the time if I lived in Pittsburgh. AND they have Lindemann's Lambic Framboise on tap!? $6 a glass, but still, that's awesome! Our waitress was one of the managers. What a trip! :)

I've been here 2 times now and really haven't been impressed with this place at all. I tried really hard to like it since it's my friend's favorite restaurant, but just haven't enjoyed any of the food. I tried a fish dish here the first time (wish I could remember exactly what it was) and the most recent trip I had the BBQ pulled pork sandwich which was decent but definitely not impressive. If it were up to me I wouldn't choose to go back, but my friends love it.

Why they love it - a couple reasons, it does have a good vegan/vegetarian menu (clearly I don't fall in that category based on my menu choices above) but they said its really good for vegans/vegetarians. Also, they have the outside patio which is nice for dogs!

Overall it's a good atmosphere, but I just don't like the food.

I will start with saying I am a little biased of Double Wide because they have a specific outdoor patio where you can bring your dog. Not only can you bring your dog but they even have a Doggy menu for your fur baby! How cute! You can pretty much guarantee when it is nice out your furry friend will be having as much fun as you are while making other buddies on the patio.

Next, they have THE BEST drinks ever. The frozen mojito is honestly the best alcoholic beverage I have ever had. Get one and forever have your life changed.

Now onto the food. This can be hit or miss. I luckily have always had very good food, but my husbands choices have struggled. They are known for having a ton of vegan/vegetarian options which is awesome. I personally love their chicken dishes. The wood fired chicken options are just SO GOOD. Usually I go with the wood fire chicken sandwich, but today I opted with a different option and wow am I glad I did. I had a pineapple salsa chicken wrap with hot sauce. The flavors complimented each other perfectly. They also have homemade fries and about 10 different side options. Today I had the fruit cup.

Double wide will be a place I continue to go to on a normal basis in the summer with my husband & pup and you should to!

LOVED Double Wide.

My grandfather passed away last April, but I know that as a car mechanic he would have loved this place, as it was a car garage turned restaurant. The atmosphere is fantastic, with great memorabilia on the walls, and even garage doors that open into the outdoor seating area when it's nice out!

The food was fantastic and the portions were great, in my opinion. Lots of food for a reasonable price, but not so much that I felt too full afterwards. I got the pulled pork (on one of their "trays" I believe) and it tasted great. Definitely a great place to come with family and friends. I really want to eat outside sometime when the weather is warmer.

Let me start by saying that there are a lot of chairs. This is the sole reason for a four star review instead of a five star review. They were slightly too tall and a shorter person may not have been able to have their feet touch the floor. I am not short, and my feet firmly touched the floor, but I worry for my short friends and family who may have their legs dangling while they eat. This could be quite a displeasure. What I do like about the chairs is that you can use the posts for a temporary cup holster in an emergency situation. Very handy! The padding on the chairs are mediocre at best and left my buttocks slightly asleep during and shortly after my meal. Along with these minor grievances the chairs are too heavy for the average human, which leads me to believe these chairs quite possibly weren't made for human beings. Just a thought. All in all, good food. Horrible chairs. Great atmosphere.

(P.S. The booths looks more comfortable)
Yum yum yum. So glad to see a vegetarian friendly restaurant in this area. Try the seitan wings!  Staff are friendly and attentive and wait times low.

I've eaten here a few times and I want to like it more than I do. I like the patio seating which is nice but I think that is all I really like. They even have a special patio area where you can bring your dog and eat! Service, prices and overall experience is adequate but not spectacular. The food is average but I've never had a fabulous meal here. I'd come here again if someone wanted to because you can get a decent meal but I would likely not choose it on my own.

Excellent food and attentive service!  First time here but I will be back.  Tried the wings, the ribs, the pulled pork - all excellent, especially the ribs! They fall off the bone, not fatty, tender, flavorful!! I LOVE the Carolina BBQ sauce!!! The sides were great too.  I had the creamy cherry cole slaw, cheesy grits, sweet potato fries and yummy cornbread - all delicious.  It is a fun automotive theme atmosphere.   We came here with about 20 people and they did a great job for us!  Thanks guys!!

If it's a nice night and you don't have enough wait staff.  Don't seat every table.  We waited 15 minutes before someone said is anyone helping you and said would be back.  5 minutes later we leave the table. 

Ok go to bar.  Maybe get service there. Yes we're hungry and already there.   Wrong.  Bar tender only serving wait staff.  Only when we get up to leave at 5 minutes he says do we want something.  Nope not anymore.

We came here for brunch on a Saturday morning and the place was deserted. Which I actually liked because we basically had the place to ourselves. Good food, large space and a very relaxed atmosphere. We had the typical brunch food - omelettes and pancakes - services was fast and good! It's nice knowing you can go in sweatpants and not be judged. We'll def be back!

We chose this on a whim. Should have kept driving! Fun atmosphere, enticing menu. Too bad the food did not impress us. I ordered the salmon tacos. The menu said it came with red pepper rice and  garlic Cole slaw. I was asked if I wanted sour cream or Pico di Gallo . I said yes to the Pico. If there was 3 oz of salmon in two tacos, I would be surprised. There was no rice or Cole slaw, but I did get fries. The price was 12 or 13 dollars and not worth it. They could have easily doubled the salmon they gave and still made money on this dish. Extra charge for  about 2 tablespoons of Pico too. The only good thing was the wheat beer. My friend ordered the pulled pork sandwich. Her fries were cold. The waitress did bring hot ones when we told her about them. Overall, just middle of the road. Paying for the cool factor here and not for good food. Waitress was nice and efficient, however.

This is the review of the dog patio. Yes, they have a dog patio. There's a few basic rules, but the awesomeness of having lunch with your pooch far outshines it. Nice patio and ADORABLE doggy menu. Our dog prefers the chicken breast. All in all, our best double wide experience yet. Oh, and the people food is delicious!

This is a great place to grab a bite; particularly when you can sit outside.  The food would be best described, to me anyway, as an upscale bar menu.  The Vegitarian and Vegan items are a nice option as my daughter is a vegitarian and it allows us to all have good food in a great atmosphere.

I met a friend and her family for lunch at Double Wide. They got their first and decided to sit outside. . It was almost 90 degrees. Our waitress was great and kept refilling our drinks. I kept it simple and ordered a cheeseburger and a cup of fruit. I ordered the burger medium. When my burger cam there was a very thin line of pink and it was only a degree or two from being well done. If you've read my reviews you know my belief is basic menu items should be cooked perfectly. That's the foundation of every plate you make. I was very bummed that my burger was overcooked. It is rare that I send food back. I usually just cross it off my list of places to go. Consider this one 'd off.

One word describes this experience-DRY!  The ribs, chicken, and brisket were all very dry. It took a lot of sauce to get them to go down. The cornbread was almost burnt on the bottom and it was also dry. Save time & money and skip this place.

We always enjoy what Double Wide has to offer.  Endless rib night, good beers, a section to sit with your dog...they have it all!  In the summer the outside seating is perfect for people watching while you dine and the inside is cozy when it's a tad too chilly to be in the elements.
Tilapia tacos rule

Double wide is a southside staple! I ate here when I first moved to the city in 2010 and I continue to come here regularly for happy hour and simmer day drinking. There is always available outdoor seating and there are healthy options on the menu so it's not just "bar food". Karaoke night is also a huge plus. That and the fact that people are allowed to bring their dogs to the outside patio.

Haven't been so disappointed in quite some time.  Including tip, meal for four about 100.00.  Banana Pancakes good, but 10.00 for pancakes?  C'Mon...  Eggs Benedict, weird...served on toast instead of muffin, with regular bacon instead of Canadian...and where did the Hollandaise go, it certainly wasn't on the eggs.  Dinner orders, UGH.  1st, out of Delmonicos, settled for New York Strips.  Ordered med rare...received rare...very rare.  I'm good with rare, but not for that particular cut of meat....especially since at least half of it was fat and gr
istle.  Two types of Cole slaw, cherry and garlic/vinegar.  Cherry was very bland, but inoffensive.  Garlic was WAY too vinegary...pucker up buttercup...wow.  Even the Iced Tea was watery and flavorless.  Staff was friendly and attentive, not their fault.  All in all, best thing we had was the Reuben Roll appetizer...THOSE were very good.  Crossed this one off the list of places to try....won't be back.

This place has a good vibe and a large outside seating area.  Our server was really nice and service was fast. The problem is with the food. The server told us the veggie of the day was broccoli and carrots that were cooked in wine and very flavorful. They were not that at all. Very bland and soggy. The rest of the food our table had was not that good either. Pulled pork was dry and flavorless. The onion rings and wings were good at least.

The prices blew me away...The service is OK, the cost to eat the simplest things was truly too much. I appreciate the selections of craft beers but the prices are the highest per glass than anyplace locally at the moment. The food was "OK" the Git Er Done plate was the choice...I dont know if something else would have been better. I know we spent A LOT of money on mediocre meals.

Had a pretty mediocre breakfast here today. The 'side' of home fry potatoes on my plate and my son's consisted of 6 pieces of new potatoes. I thought it was just a garnish. The eggs Benedict were pretty good though. 

I brought it to the attention of the server who said I could go talk to the manager. If the server actually cared, she'd bring the manager to me.

I have had a few good meals at the south side location, but felt the last few were not so great. Tried the one here in Irwin today, and was even less impressed. Ordered a burger when the place was empty. Took over 20 minutes. I ordered in done medium, it came out cooked grey all the way trough and crispy, well done. Asked for another, it came out rare and red. 

Not impressed at all. They have good menu, but they are dropping their game...

Groupon is bad news when all is said and done. The manager made me whole monetarily but the experience made me angry, and that ruined the evening.  I responded to an ad for a $20 groupon and wound up buying a $40 Groupon accidentally. I didn't even realize it was an option until it was too late. Well, a $40 groupon will work when I take my family but tonight it'll just be us two so I went ahead and also bought the $20.  Turns out, three of us went so I expected to use the $40 Groupon after all. When I went to redeem it, the waitress said oh the fine print says for four people and you only have three.  Nevermind that we had over $50 in food between the three of us (and adding alcohol we were just shy of $80.) I didn't want the $40 Groupon to begin with and felt tricked into purchasing it, and now the waitress is telling me I am violating the small print, but I could use a $20 groupon. (Now, why would she think I might have both?). And she kept going on and on about it and finally I told her to stop! Just stop talking. I was angry now, the night was ruined at this point feeling that I had been swindled and I simply wanted to leave.  By this time they had both of my groupon numbers and I clicked redeem on the $20 one. Apparently she let the manager know I was not happy and he said they can use the $40 groupon after all.  But now both groupons show redeemed so to make up for it they gave me a $20 gift card. (And I tipped based on the $80 sale even though the waitress could have prevented the whole episode.)  So ok, yeah, I am not out anything moneywise.  But the experience was infuriating and not one I want to repeat.  I won't remember my meal in a couple months but I will always remember this terrible Groupon experience at Double Wide.  
Groupon just isn't worth it.

I've been a longtime fan of Double Wide, and have eaten at the Southside and Mars locations for years.  When I saw a location was opening in at the old Teddy's location, I was really excited.  Greensburg/Irwin is littered with sub-par national chains and there aren't a lot of good local dining options in the area.

I took my parents to Double Wide on a visit, and it quickly became clear that Double Wide just wasn't a good fit for the area.  The two things I love the most about Double Wide - the playful irony of the menu and the wide selection of vegetarian options - were completely lost on this customer base.  Within seconds of being seated, the waitress came over and almost apologetically told us not to even worry about the last two pages of the menu because those were vegetarian.  She seemed a little shocked when I explained that I came to Double Wide BECAUSE of the vegetarian menu.

The food was good, though maybe a slight tick below the quality I've come to expect from the other locations.  But the overall charm and tone that Double Wide has at the other locations wasn't there.  It just felt flat, and like they were trying too hard to be like Texas Roadhouse or Applebee's, when the appeal has always been that Double Wide is quite the opposite in a tongue in cheek way.

I am not really sure why this place has such high reviews. 

So a few years ago we tried this place - it looks great from the outside and as we quickly discovered - terrible for the food. Fast forward to 2013 and my husband suggests we try it out again... I protest and he wins out. The food... again... not so awesome. 

the good: the service is great. Our waitress was just the right amount of attentive, friendly and efficient. Lacey is why this review has two stars instead of one. I also liked how the kids menu offered a mix and match of items and included fresh, raw carrots in addition to the veggie of the day and the usual suspects of fries. My daughter had the carrots and the grilled cheese and then a cookie we decided to wrap up fro later... she was happy. 

My husband was content his grilled cheese with bacon sandwich - with a side of fries. 

The bad: I had the pulled pork sandwich with the lug nuts (upcharge) on the side. First, the sandwich was served open face with no sauce on the pork. There was a strange serving of something that looked suspiciously like duck sauce on the side and was very spicy... not something I would pair with pulled pork. I decided not to use it and took a bite of the naked pork - it had like zero seasoning on it. yuck. we asked for BBQ sauce which - when added -  improved the flavor but it was pretty meh.. I have made much better in a crockpot at home. Plus... mixed in with the tender bits were a number of pieces that were not braised enough - chewy and tough - sinewy even. I picked those pieces out since I decided to eat it with a knife and fork instead of as a sandwich. 

Now the lug nuts looked interesting on the menu - garlic and herb potatoes... yeah, garlic - I can totally get behind that! um, the reality was what appeared to be deep fried chunks of potatoes that were fried in grease that does not taste like it was changed in quite some time. it had an off flavor to it and the garlic and herb sauce was terrible - strong flavor that ruined you for really any thing else. After a second bite with the sauce scraped off I asked for fries instead - again, Lacy was gracious and took care of me... the fries were ok - again, tasted like they were fried in old grease but it was tolerable. 

I think this is it for me with the Double Wide Grill. I don't care how great it looks from the outside or how popular it seems to be. It really makes me question how discerning people can be to think it is great food and go back again and again. about 10 minutes after leaving heartburn set in and now a couple of hours later I still feel slightly sick to my stomach. No third chances... avoid at all costs. but should you decide to try it out - hopefully Lacy is your waitress.

SO MANY VEGAN/VEGETARIAN OPTIONS!! I love this place so much because they have FULL PAGES dedicated to meatless food and a lot of it is soul food, which isn't easy to find for plant based eaters. I usually go on Wednesdays & get seitan wings. My favorite are the garlic parmesan wings, but I like the honey garlic ones too. I'm always weary about ordering anything with Portobello mushrooms because a lot of times they marinate them too long or something & they end up tasting like straight vinegar. It's just really nice to go to a homestyle restaurant & not have to get a simple salad or side dishes.

My boyfriend and I ate there last Friday night, around 8:30pm. After reading the reviews, wasn't expecting much from the waiters, but was expecting a good meal.
We started out with the chicken egg rolls. I absolutely did not like them. Tasted like spicy mush inside of an egg roll shell. The sauce was the look and consistency of duck sauce, but pretty tasteless to me. My boyfriend really liked them, though. 
I ordered the tilapia, cajun style, with broccoli and mashed potatoes. What I got was a small, over-cooked piece of fish and undercooked vegetables. The mashed potatoes were decent (how can you mess that up?).  I left feeling hungry and cheated. $15 for a piece of fish that was smaller than my palm?
My boyfriend ordered a steak and veggies. The veggies were also undercooked, and the steak was gristly. The middle of his mashed potatoes were cold. 
For a $50 meal, we were expecting a lot more. Definitely will not be back.

This review is on the service (or lack there of) received Saturday. Double (why)ide on Earth would i ever come back? My boyfriend and I drove to the Southside after a long day of hiking, specifically for this establishment; we heard the food was good, though we've never been. We show up at 3:40 PM, in between lunch and dinner hours, not busy, no reason for the service we were dealt. We walk up to the host stand, wait around for a few minutes as 2 employees walk past- not a single word, nor smile, no "someone will be right with you". Someone finally comes along to seat us. Menus were filthy, seat had left over food on it, but it was okay we we're starving and excited anyways. 

After looking over the menu, and seeing about 3 servers walk past, amongst other employees fiddling their thumbs, we looked at the clock and realized it was 4 pm. That it's been 20 minutes of absolutely NO service. No greeting, no drinks, not even water...0 acknowledgement whatsoever. We said what the heck? We decided to wait 5 more minutes, because we've both worked in the restaurant business before, we understand stuff happens. So 5 more minutes...Nothing. I saw another table seated near us get up and ask for the check because they never even got their drinks.. they were already sitting when we arrived 25 minutes ago. I really hate to give negative reviews but this was the poorest excuse of restaurant service I've ever experienced. 

We went to Fat Heads instead, got seated right away and greeted/fed right away. Who knows how long we would have been sitting before even being greeted? Sad I didn't get to try your turkey burger, probably won't be back.

After a couple of visits, I have to say I do enjoy this place!  The first time we went it was blazing hot and we were there with a largish group.....including a very well-behaved puppy.  They actually have a special outdoor place for the pooches to hang with their owners, but (and I'm sure this is for sanitary reasons) the servers can't actually enter that area so it makes the service a little disjointed.  That, and it was blazing hot, made it a little awkward.  But then the food, oooooh, the food!  They have an impressive vegan offering, and so many fun combinations....I ended up with a yummy chicken sandwich and the cheesy rice balls, and sweet potato fries.  It was one of those times I ate so much it was uncomfortable....but oh so worth it!  Plus, for the gluten free they do take care of you, too, so definitely stop by.

Sunday brunch. Hungover, sitting at the bar. I figured I'd trudge through the meal and then make my way back home to relax. 

However, our bartender Lisa brightened the day. She herself was coming off a rough night as well, but had us laughing the entire time. She jokingly harassed the two of us for being camels and drinking all their water, but quickly wised up and gave us a pitcher of water. At one point, there were ice balls being made in the blender and being tossed around the bar. 

For food I got a Carnivore Omelet, which was good, but nothing to rave about. Our experience was completely made by our bartender Lisa (and the 3 great Bloody Mary's she made each of us). We headed out refreshed and much happier than we went in.

Just in Pittsburgh for about 24 hours for work. Helped vegan and decided to give this place a try. Main reason why we decided to try it was because it not only had vegan options for me, but also "normal" options for me meat eating boyfriend. We walked up and the place was PACKED, which only gave us a good sign that it was worth it. The wait was about 45-55 minutes, but the food came out so fast that it evened out. I got the vegan BBQ saitan bites and I should have gotten like 3 orders they were AMAZING and I was very happy with them. My boyfriend said his pulled pork sandwich was also very very good. If I'm ever back, this place is where I'm going!

The menu has a nice variety. Plenty of BBQ, burgers, sandwiches, and pasta. We asked for some hot wings. Delicious. Good seasoned flavor with some kick. On to the main courses. Ribs were way overcooked. Seared all over and crunchy around the ends. Centers dried out. The burger was lost on the bun. If you're charging more than $10 on a burger at least make a patty big enough to fit the bun. Pulled pork and the corn bread was average. 
Service started out great with the waitress checking frequently. However, halfway through the meal our glasses sat empty. The service was good enough to bring me back, the food definitely was not.

Four stars for one reason: vegetarian selection. This is not great food, if you're a foodie or used to more selection offered in metropolitan areas. However, if you find yourself in Western PA and you don't eat meat, this will be your favorite place. Two full pages of vegan and vegetarian options, plus seafood, its the best selection you're going to get around this area without driving into Pittsburgh.
Will not be going back. Too expensive and had cold unseasoned pull pork. Wish there was actually a good barbecue around here.

On our way out of town we stopped by Doublewide to check out their brunch. I can sum up our experience in one word- "overrated". This place wasn't terrible and the service was pretty good but I can't say the food was that delicious or memorable. It was quite pricey for the amount you received and when the food doesn't taste that good it is hard to justify a $40 breakfast for 2.

This place rocks!  The food is great, and the beer selection is very good.  It tends to get a little pricey, and given its South Side location it's not uncommon to have a bunch of somewhat rowdy college kids here and there.  Double Wide is great for groups with a wide range of dietary preferences, including vegan food and traditional (i.e. meat) BBQ.  There's something for everyone here!

My first visit to the Double Wide.  Simple Friday night - Steak, Pepper & Bacon Salad with a side of Sweet Potato Fries.

Two strikes on the salad:  Grasshopper pee on the lettuce (what we thought dead, wilted, brown leaves were when we were kids); and balsamic dressing that looks like brown gravy.  Um, yuk.  I will say that the steak, peppers and bacon were fine.

Sweet potato fries were angel-singing fabulous.  I requested bleu cheese, but the server suggested their sugar-cinammon dip and it was terrific.  She was so right.  Loved it.

The service was excellent: happy, helpful & quick.

I might go back for the outdoor opportunity, but otherwise there's just no draw.

Another thing that made me chuckle - they weren't really busy but there were two guys handling the greeting and seating chart.  It looked like they were studying for an exam.  ...maybe they were and I'm being harsh...

Awful food, awful service. 
After having a bad experience at their location in South Side, we opted to give the new Irwin location a try. It was no better...in fact, it was worse.
My meal was fine - I ordered a cheeseburger and fries. Simple, easy, nearly impossible to mess up.
My boyfriend ordered a steak medium-rare, with rice and beans for sides. This is where the problem arose.
A charred piece of meat that looked as though it had been run over by a car (it was that flattened) was placed in front of him, and before he could cut into it our server was off to another table. After cutting into the middle and seeing what he already knew, that it was well done, he attempted to flag our server down. When she made it over 5 minutes later, she offered to have a new steak cooked, but advised that it may take awhile since they were busy. He's fairly easy to please, so he said he would just eat the steak that he had and asked for some steak sauce.
15 minutes later, as we watched our server bring beers to our neighboring table and no steak sauce to us, he finally ate his overly done steak, with no sauce. Our server finally came back around...still no steak sauce. She had seemingly forgotten that he had even asked for it. She dropped the bill and was again gone in an instant.
After waiting for 10 minutes for her to come back to take our payment, we got frustrated and went to the bar to pay. 
All in all, both experiences we've had at DWG have been a let down. The food is below sub-par, and the service at both locations was lacking.
As much as we wanted to love this place, we'll leave it.
This place was aggressively medium. The vegan wings were fine, the vegan "cheesesteak" was fine but way too sweet. The non vegans I ate with all said their food was bad to average.

Love, love , LOVE the lentil burger! I suggest that you get with a mayo or some other sauce and tomato and lettuce however as it has a tendency to be a bit dry,especially if you plan on taking some home for leftovers. Another 4-5 star choice is the vegetarian chili. I immediately ordered it with sour cream and cheddar cheese and it was delicious (only because I have a very delicate stomach for spicy foods). My goal in life is to hunt down these recipes! The fries are delicious, I always ask for them to be done well done, it's a habit of mine every where I go, especially at Eat 'n Park (my pet peeve there) and they do not disappoint.

I've been here three times and have been impressed each time. As others have remarked, the Seitan wings are out of this world. We split the sauces - barbeque and hot - both really extraordinary and the texture of the Seitan is, well, like meat. The onion rings are also amazing. They got the breading just right - it sticks to the onion so you don't end up pulling the onion out of the breading by accident. The rings come with a really tasty  chipotle ranch sauce with a lot of flavor and a little kick.

And then there's the beer. They rotate their selection frequently so you never know what you're going to get. That ends up being half the fun. The staff have been reliable at providing advice in this realm. But with a name like Uppity Jag Off IPA, ya have to try it, right? I loved it. Not too hoppy as IPA's go....very tasty with the added benefit that it's difficult to forget the name.

Great place!

When the weather's nice and I visit the bros in PGH, Double Wide is my bar of choice. It's a great place to just kick back and relax, sit outside, play some cornhole, and enjoy some adult beverages. 

The food was very forgettable but that's really not why you we went there. We actually ended up ordering a pizza to be delivered there and they let us eat it which I thought was pretty cool. 

And there are a lot of dollar drink specials on the SS but this is not one of them. Over the course of a day I think I spent the equivalent of an actual double wide but I had such a good time there that I didn't really mind. 

With some upcoming events in the Burgh this summer I'm sure we'll be hitting up the Double Wide for the clean Burgh air and some Iron Citys'.

I was excited to try this place for its vegan options: kudos,  Irwin, PA! I got a starter of the seitan wings with the sweet and tangy sauce and it was very yummy! However, my main course of the lentil burger was a bit dry, and I didn't make it all the way through. My husband had the ribs, which he said were very well smoked and tender, though a bit fatty. Great fries (sweet potato and shoe string). Good and speedy service, despite the reviews I read, though I wish the wait staff would be a little more eco friendly, and just refill your glass, rather than bring you an entire new glass with each refill. So mostly good review, but a bit disappointed with the burger.

We came here for brunch and I really wanted to like this place - the online menu sounded great! What we got was mediocre at best and disappointing at worst: small portions, lack of flavor and overpriced. The eggs Benedict barely had any hollandaise on it, the eggs were overcooked and the potatoes were a mix of overdone and underdone. The "fruit wedge" was a sad sliver of flavorless cantaloupe. The burrito came 3/4 full with barely any meat or veggies and topped with "pico de gallo" which, in reality, is clearly bottled salsa. Once again the potatoes ranged from "still crunchy" to "this is going to need dental records to identify".  Wouldn't recommend this place, and the fact that there were only four people here on a Saturday morning is testament to this.

Double Wide Grill is a surprising place to find vegan options, but I was more than happy with my findings. I went in and tried the lentil burger and fries as well as an order of seitan buffalo wings. My two friends ordered what I believe were vegetarian dishes - a portobello burger and some type of hearty chili. 

For a place that sells bar-like junk food, my lentil burger was certainly healthy. It tasted healthy. I wouldn't order it again because it was too healthy for a restaurant meal, and when I eat out, I like to indulge a little. Either way, I recognize its value as a good menu option and it is definitely a great choice for someone who wants to eat healthier when they eat out. 

The seitan wings were interesting. The restaurant obviously doesn't specialize in vegan food, but they had a unique texture and flavor I have never experienced with seitan before. That's a GOOD thing. 

The chili my friend had was also amazing. It was filling, nutritious and flavorful. 

Prices are great for the portion sizes, and our server was incredible. She was very helpful in helping us choose items, and she brought refills promptly. 

I look forward to returning to Double Wide Grill and trying some of the other vegan items on the menu. It's a fun atmosphere even though we went while it was quiet. I would love to go here again during the night and have drinks.

Tried a sizzler steak with veggies and fruit. Steak tasted like propane. Like they just started the grill. Horrible. My wife had the tired mahi mahi it was dried out. Realize this isn't a 4 star restaurant but food quality was still a zero

Don't bother with this place

Loved the frozen mojito and the frozen margarita as well. Special Philly cheesesteak with nacho cheese was pretty damn good too. Great seating on a sunny day and a wide variety of selections on the menu. Plenty of veggie and vegan options as well. Nice that it's a little farther down the line on Carson than some of the other busy restaurants.

As I was in town strictly to imbibe, I didn't have chance to try the food at the Double Wide, but the restaurant was a spectacle by itself. The renovated service station motif was executed brilliantly, with no detail spared. Drinks were awesome, and we were happy to have the opportunity to enjoy the sunshine a little as there were many other places within walking distance that weren't able to offer outdoor seating. We went up and down the cocktail menu and thoroughly enjoyed everything that we were fortunate enough to sample. Some of the signatures, such as the highly advertised frozen mojito, didn't pack too much of a punch, but whatever. The wait staff was very attentive and kind, and prices weren't out of control. Great spot at which to waste an afternoon.

Double Wide Grill is like an abusive relationship: you keep telling yourself that the last time will indeed be the last time. The last time you eat their terrible food, the last time you put up with their absolutely atrocious service, the last time you put up with their usuals, who they only pay attention to, that may be brain damaged and do nothing but scream the same three things across the bar. Well I'm wising up. No more, Double Wide Grill. No more.
Awesome Vegan options. 2 whole pages to choose from. Separate frier for fries. In an old Texaco station. Great scenery.

Stopped in on a Saturday night and had a 20 minute wait for a table so we had a drink at the bar. Beer selection was good. Once seated we ordered and unfortunately waited 40 minutes for our food. The waitress did check on us a couple times and apologized for the delay saying the kitchen was really backed up. Food was okay but nothing outstanding.

Was really looking forward to eating their vegetarian food.  Unfortunately the food was bland and tasteless.  White bean taco was nothing and the sides of red beans/rice and white beans (mashed to look like mashed potatoes) were disappointing in every way.  My friend had a portabello mushroom reuben which was only saved by the marble rye bread.  Wouldn't go back.

Ok, I was at Vegan fest out of town and had Seitan wings from these guys and was hooked. Also, the rep at the event told us about the dog patio and we had to go see for ourselves. 

I would say the dog patio is great if your dog isn't a total little jerk..we have a couple dogs that did ok but it IS a bit stressful. You also have to kind of serve yourself but it's worth it to keep the fur babies along. Everyone on the patio was super friendly too. 

Great happy staff etc...

We went back to try out another meal inside at night but unfortunately it was a little sloppy/bleh. I think there are just too many items on the menu to keep them perfected. 

It is a huge option for vegans though so we will not write it off, just hope that the quality improves because I could see us being regulars if it did.

I go here for lunch often. Every time we go we get great service and have good food. The atmosphere is really cool and the prices are great. I don't think it's amazing but I've never had a bad experience. Sometimes some of the food doesn't measure up, I would avoid the mashed potatoes. The burgers and sandwiches are great.

What a blessed weekend of wrong-turns this was! A birthday dinner with my parents and sister was due to close out the weekend...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gTCi0InNH7w

Once again, I was having difficulty choosing a restaurant. Dad doesn't like to go out to eat and insisted on getting takeout from a place relatively close to home. After mulling it over all day, I chose Double Wide Grill for 3 reasons 1) It's controversial, and I just hadda see what the hub-bub was about. 2) I'd been craving BBQ, and it became too late to order from Yinzburgh, my original choice, and Bloomfield would have been too far; Dad didn't wanna cross the Monongahela. 

Riding with Dad to and from DWG was harrowing, particularly when we got onto the PJ McArdle Roadway...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zUID-39p0oM

DWG's rustic trailer park motif was in full effect, so much so that I forgot I was within the city limits as I awaited the large sack of food...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0J3Fod7809s

Yet the clientage was diverse. Tattooed punksters dined and drank alongside elderly folk and families. It was surprisingly quiet despite Carson Street's usual... 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_adqQRTeiww

A burly, bald fella of my father's age with a Roaring 20's moustache and arms like an ironworker rang me up and sent me on my way...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xns8KFLx1X8

Before long 'twas...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=MMM0O86WivI

I started out with a cup of their mess hall-greasy chili, and based on my picture, you can see the oil rising to the top. Despite that fattiness of the broth, this chili was chock full of supple pork, onions, and other vegetables, and beans were at a minimum. This is the manner of chili one would expect at a place called the Double Wide Grill, and for the most part, I found it to be a richly flavorful pot of...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=maMCAmj5gh8

My dinner consisted of a beef brisket sandwich and something DWG calls "lug nuts"...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=glIEwEcfLWI

If homefries knocked up tater tots, you'd get this tuber bastard child, a shotgun weddin' happenin' beforehand no doubt. And I relished these golden, crispy, starchy spud nuggets. 

Also flaxen 'n flaky was Mum's dessert-ish cornbread that I was half-tempted to bury in whipped cream, vanilla ice cream, and strawberries after sampling. 

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZMdUy8-NpaY

Bessie's Best Bar-B-Q Brisket was a dream, and I wanted to take her for a cruise in a...

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Jl3R6O2mJeQ

The brisket itself was steakhouse-prime. Juicy and thickly-cut, I drizzled the sugary liquid smoke of DWG's Memphis Sauce underneath Bessie's hot-buttered onion roll...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QfnmhRgeUns

She was such the epitome of Southern goodness, I was doing the...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AYIqQAHDCFk

Also filched from Mum was a few spoonfuls of her Creamy Cherry Cole Slaw that was as tasty, tangy, and toothsome as any I've ever had, the novel inclusion of cherries only furthering the picnic/cookout theme in the face of February's icy blues...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=o7vFIm3qTo8

Dad allowed me a bite of his St. Louis Ribs. Wood-grilled, dry-rubbed, cooked low 'n slow, and slathered-then-cauterized with a zesty Carolina sauce, one has to wonder if any of the depressed BBQ devotees in the area have honestly given DWG's pig a try...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=KIXEzmIBpHw

Frankly, it has me...
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IeeleWV6B7U

The bones almost slid out of the meat itself which was so tender, my late grandfather could have eaten these sans dentures! Regardless, this yankee thought they were damn fine. I could also say the same about the pulled pork my mother allowed to me to inspect with my teeth and palate. I'll probably be told that I need to visit the South someday, which I'd like to do, and I doubt I'd be disappointed, but damn it if we don't have some very good BBQ up North, DWG serving as a fine example...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Y4pOIndfTzI

If Kinky Friedman were to be reincarnated as an appetizer, he'd be the Reuben Egg Rolls. Like Gullifty's Crispy Reuben, this is a fun, cracklin', and delectable deep-fried take on an urban deli standard with its insulated, steamed corned beef, Swiss cheese, and sauerkraut almost evaporating on your tongue. Tell ya what, parboiled fat does somethin' to a Reuben, especially when its served with a dynamite chipotle-infused ranch dressing...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iKv_YYzdI2w

I dunno gang, I see no reason why I shouldn't give Double Wide Grill a 5. The grub was mouthwatering, the ambience and decor is a blast, the service was smooth, and they have a vegan menu, shattering stereotypes by injecting Bohemia with a beneficial dose of...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3OhkNh0HRHo

I almost didn't stop in and what tragedy that would have been. The "make your own TV dinner was one of the best meals I've ever had. Brisket (that sauce!!!), Carolina style pulled pork, grits, cherry coleslaw (loved it!), and the cornbread? It could have been dessert. A business trip to Pitt will not be complete for me again without a stop at one of my new favorite restaurants. BTW: the menu is overwhelming with choices and the vegan selections are phenom.
Dbl Wide is a great hangout due to their food and drinks but also because they are in the heart of South Side. Been going there for years and I always have a great meal and enjoyable time.

Fun place for a group.  Stopped to watch some football and fill the belly.
Couldn't wait to get the Brisket Sandwich.  Oh, not available till after 4...eh on a weekend with people watching football...how come so late.  

Asked if any beer specials.  No!  How come, everyone else on Carson St. have beer specials during the game...just left a place with a special.  Proceed to order and when we were almost done the waitress said do you want that or the all U can eat, it is less $'s and more to eat.  If you have it a special, why not tell us before we order?

Anyway, the ribs and nachos and corn bread were enjoyable.
The food looks promising. It never seems to deliver on taste though. The staff always seems to be confused too. It's a great location though, and the people viewing is unmatched on the Southside.
Food Was just ok. Salt and pepper, perhaps the kitchen manager could introduce the cooks to these two kitchen items. Omg the noise from clanging plates was so loud. The waiter was kind and effective.

Terrible service, came here on a Sunday and the staff was so unhelpful it was almost unreal they literally had 50 tables available didn't want to seat us told us to get a seat at the bar which had no seats purely don't like this place for the staff and their lack of customer service.

Brunch starts at 10 AM on the weekends. I had cream cheese stuffed French toast. Wonderfully delicious and a great portion size. Served with hot syrup and potatoes. My husband had the Black and Bleu Burger that was seasoned with blackening spices and covered with melted Bleu cheese crumbles. Had I not been in a breakfast mood, I definitely would have tried one of their make-your-own TV dinners.

Not that it appealed to me, but they have a lot of vegan/vegetarian options here. 

Minus one star for incorrect operating hours posted on their website... Unless I missed them. I will check again and update to 5 stars if I'm mistaken.

Ordered their Monday special, chicken quesadilla which comes with a side salad for $10.99.
VERY well done dish!  Compliments to the chef, I must admit I come here often because of meetings and never really know what to order because its all been "ok" but not "GOOD".  This is the first dish I have ordered that I felt was good enough to go out of my way to come back for!!!

Please put it on the regular menu!  The quesadilla had just the right amount of crispiness and was fully of flavor.  I had a side of BBQ sauce which made it just right for me.  Be warned, its a BIG portion which was awesome but it can be finished.  For two lighter eaters, could easily share it and still both be full.
I love this place for a casual dinner or a brunch door to hit every pallet, my friends love burgers and i love the vegan options!

Absolutely the WORST service and food I have ever had. No one greets you, you wait 15-20 min before they even give you a menu. Had brunch today and that's the last time I'll ever go, I gave them multiple chances. Got double wide eggs Benedict, and the eggs were not even remotely cooked. The yolk turned my plate into soup, and ruined everything else on the plate. Bartender admitted to being very hungover. Didn't prepare Bloody Mary properly. Don't waste your time here when there are so many other good places to eat on carson.

If you crave beer in a warm glass , food devoid of flavor and service without notice this is your new spot.   Bartenders are a mess and their questionable friends don't pay for drinks .  Live entertainment was a supposed to be music and was more of a comedy.  Manager came out twice and took no notice of situation and had slight nod to the dealer at bar to meet him out back.  I'm going to say over and under of this place is Easter.

This was the first real meal sit down meal on our recent trip to Pittsburgh. We were thrilled to discover that Double Wide Grill had lots of vegetarian/vegan options and was just a short walk from the Holiday Inn Express we were staying at.

Double Wide Grill is a fun diner style restaurant with a car/gas station theme. There was a beer chandelier directly above our table. I didn't get a photo of the outside of the restaurant, but it had a nice outdoor area where dogs can hang out too!

We ordered a full order of the seitan wings ($9.79) with Cletus' signature hot sauce. It also came with ranch dressing and some veggies. This was quality seitan. Very tender. We gobbled it up really quickly. I'm not one to shy away from junk food, especially when I'm on vacation. 

We also shared the BBQ Pulled Seitan ($9.29), which was delicious! The multi grain vegan bread was perfect with the seitan. It wasn't stringy like pulled pork, but was sliced into thin, tender strips and had a good texture. Good stuff.

For beer, I got the Thirsty Dog Old Leghumper. It was a tasty American Porter that paired well with all the seitan, but let's be honest, I clearly ordered it just so I could say that I've had a beer called Leghumper!

The outdoor seating is great, really get to see all the sights of the South Side. I ordered a cheese burger which was excellent, 1 of the best burgers I ever had. Came with a side of fries which were pretty good but wish they would of gave me more.  My wife had the cooked vegetable and Brie salad and added grilled BBQ chicken.  She said it was also really good. Other than not getting enough fries the 6 blue moon beers we had were a bit expensive ($33). They have a huge extensive menu and can't wait to go back and try something different.

The Double Wide Grill is another iteration of your typical American restaurant. It was a good stop for our large group on a Saturday afternoon for lunch. I looked like they had a bar area that was somewhat separated from the more family friendly dining area we were at. They also have outdoor seating for the warmer months. It sounds like one of their locations is pretty neat and has some camper trailers integrated into the restaurant to give it a unique theme, but we didn't see any of that here.

The menu isn't anything too special, but is very large and has something for everybody. When we were there, they had their regular lunch menu on top of a special brunch menu. Both were large on their own, but the options seemed to run the entire gamut when you combined them. I can't help but think of how long food items sit in a freezer before they are cooked for a place with that many options, so I usually just stick with something simple and got the wings. They fall pretty low on the hierarchy of wings I have had at places like this, and aren't something I would get again. I don't think anybody was too impressed with their meals, but there was a lot of food for a relatively good price.

The thing that stood out to me here was their large draft list. They had a great list of local craft beers, including some special seasonal choices. That beer list is probably what would get me back in here. Our waitress was good, especially with our large group all splitting up checks. The restaurant side that we were seated on had a kid's play area, which while I'm sure is awesome for parents, wasn't great for those of us not interested in kids running around and yelling during lunch. Sitting on the bar side would have solved that problem for me though.  

Overall, it was a good stop for a large group. Nothing warranted any significant complaints, but there also wasn't anything that made me want to come back. It is what it is.
Food , service , bartenders and drink .. all 3rd level

A couple of things I liked right away: Outdoor seating, open-air bar, automobile-related decor, huge TVs with sports, and getting seating as soon as we walked in. Also, as soon as I picked up the menu, I noticed that, in addition to the huge variety of regular diner/pub fare, DWG also has options for kid's, gluten-free, vegan, and vegetarian. Pretty impressive.

I started with an order of the Tijuana Rice Balls (Arborio rice, sun-dried tomatoes, black beans, melted cheddar cheese, chili pepper seasoning; Panko breaded and deep fried; Served with chipotle ranch). Although they were some of my favorite ingredients, they were also fairly bland on the seasoning and a little greasy. The dipping sauce was decent.

For my entree, I had a pulled pork, bacon, black beans, and pineapple salsa wrap. The Carolina vinegar-based BBQ sauce was tangy - and the pork was moist - but, on the whole, I didn't think the burrito was that special.

Unfortunately, our service was really slow (though friendly); and, I thought the bill was a bit much for the quality of food. Also, on a side note, my son's chicken tenders were little more than soggy breading and frozen chicken - and his fruit was old melon and pineapple...not really the kind of fruit most kids enjoy.

Overall, I'd say if you're stuck in the South Side with your kids or a large group, then you might consider the DWG. Otherwise, I don't think it's worth the visit.

The food was delish. Seitan wings are so awesome. So many vegetarian options but also lots for carnivores too. 

I have been organizing a regular monthly event for two years and needed a new location. The Double not only reserved a table for 20+ people but were really flexible when more people than usual showed up. The wait staff was AmAZinG! Seriously. So friendly and attentive and never made us feel like we were a pain. 

Great place, lowkey atmosphere. Definitely recommend it!
Good drink selection with some interesting cocktails and was pretty empty when I was there in the afternoon. I didn't try any food but it looked pretty good.

I can honestly sum up my experience at the Double Wide Grill as "not impressed".  I visited the place for a group get together.  Unfortunately, the "party room" they have is so small that the 20-30 of us were unable to really mingle much.  The company at my table was great, but other then that, there is nothing about the menu that makes me want to rush back to the Double Wide.

Now the rest of the restaurant with its inside and outside openness I have to admit is pretty cool - as an environment to eat in, sure why not. On the other hand, its not so appealing to me to sit outside on a corner lot directly across from a co-go to consume my food.

Now, I know it is a lot to handle a big group of people. However, I am pretty sure the coordinator of this event called in advance. There was only one waiter serving us - which is not an easy task. On the other hand, I ordered a diet coke at the same time the five people on my table requested refills.  They all got their beers, teas, water, whatever. Me - I had to request diet coke again when she came out to take our orders 15 minutes later. 

Visiting on a Sunday, we had the brunch menu. I was disappointed that there was not as much lunch food offered as there was breakfast. It was one in the afternoon and I was well past wanting to eat french toast or eggs.  They have a small handful of burgers - where the primary variety is choose the meet and then choose the options. OK - fine - if I hadn't had hamburgers that were SO GOOD at my own house.  The only other option other then wings or soup was an avocado club sandwich. So I went with that. It sounds like it has potential in the menu. It was the closest to a turkey club (something I would figure would be standard on a brunch menu) I could get. The waitress came back later and asked me what I wanted as my side, I said fries. I also ordered up a bowl of chili - my favorite food of all time.

The avocado club came out first. Essentially what sounded good in the menu turned out to be two slices of toast with sliced avocado and a sprinkling of jalapenos. There was supposed to be some sort of pesto on this as well, but I sure as heck couldn't taste it or see it. In fact, the overwhelming thought I had was - wow, um, why not just give me a plate of avocado.  Instead of fries, they gave me a side of fruit salad. **Grumble** The fries served with the burgers looked good.

The chili, if you can call it that, came out about five minutes later. It had the consistency of a beef stew, and honestly taste wise was not very far off.  OK, I AM a chili snob, I know - but come on - it's chili. And if you are calling it Jail-house chili, it should have some sort of punch - some spiciness of some sort. But really, had I not "known" it was chili, I would have thought they served me stew. The only bonus, they had the right kind of beef in it - you know - stew beef - or chili beef when the seasoning says its chili. :) I had to ask for cheese to put on top, which I got the look of "huh cheese?" but got a small little serving of that. It would have been better served with a side of jalapenos and onions to mix in too - so I stole some jalapenos from my sandwich.

Oh, and all this ample blandness cost me $20 (food, beverage and tip).

The company was at least good - and maybe if I do go back with a small group/one other person - or for breakfast or dinner I will be happier - those eating breakfast foods seemed to enjoy it though the Canadian bacon was also canned. 

But as brunch and big groups go, big thumbs down - it will take a lot to convince me that this place is worth more then just a unique environment.

The converted gas station makes for a cool, fun atmosphere and it was nice to have an al fresco brunch on a beautiful day.  But my breakfast burrito was pretty bland and the service was not that attentive.

This place is disappointing. I've heard good things about brunch, but don't come for dinner. I had an appetizer. I sent it back because it was icebox cold, and it came back lukewarm. Definitely detracted from the experience. Beers for $5.75. I'm not coming back here.
Can't speak much to the food, but they pull off the classy hoosier feel pretty well. Drinks did seem a tad expensive for the venue, but the cornhole was a nice touch
Great atmosphere, lots of vegetarian and vegan options! Clean facilities and the dog patio is adorable! The veggyro was delicious and 100% vegan!

The Double Wide Grill is the place to get decent food and a couple drinks. They have a huge outdoor patio and they even have a part that you can bring your dog. They have tons of drinks available and offer the redneck refrigerator which is a cooler for your table filled with ice cold beer.

Not bad!  Kind of a fun theme, lots of vegetarian options, and a good beer list.  I'm not a vegetarian, but opted for the potato tacos as an interesting choice.  All the fixings of a soft taco, only with mashed potatoes instead of meat.  Very tasty!  Friendly service.  The three stars is because I found it kind of gimmicky (like a Quaker Steak), and that really isn't my favorite atmosphere.

Good food, horrible service. We got there at 5:15 on a Saturday. Our waitress was nice enough, but it took us one hour to get our entrees, which only consisted of a burger and a salad. The place not only about half full. The wings were some of the best I ever had. BBQ sauce was amazing. Sweet potato fries were great and has a tasty, sweet sauce.

HORRIBLE - went in with a group of five. Waitress was very nice took our order. I ordered the Maui Maui with coconut and fries. My sister in law ordered steak. When the meals came out the fries were cold, not warm but cold. My Maui Maui (about 2 oz), was really burnt. The steak was also over cooked. The manager came over and took our plates and said she would be out with replacements. About 10 minutes later the Steak came out and was cooked correctly. The manager said my Maui Maui would be right out. 20 minutes later, everybody was finished eating and No Maui Maui. Being really frustrated I told the waitress to forget it and I no longer wanted the dinner. A few minutes later another waitress brings out the meal. I told her I no longer wanted it. She said I should take it to go because they would only throw it out. She also took the meal off of my bill. I don't know what went on that evening because I never saw the manager again, but I WILL NOT GO BACK THERE. There are too many good restaurants to spend my time and money on crappy food

Well.....     there was high points and low points.    The meat served here is excellent.    Brisket, chicken, chorizo were all good and the sauces had a good amount of heat.     Fresh salad and food cornbread (which I generally don't like).....   but their sides kind of suck.    I got cheese frits and they didn't salt the grits..... and you just can't fix them after that......   my mashed potatoes were dry and just terrible.......   I didn't even take them home(you get a lot of food... so lunch is covered the next day)......

The service was OK......   the server was attentive but looked me like I was crazy to ask for ranch for my chicken....

The place is decorated pretty neat but is loud and their regulars are kind of obnoxious.....

Overall.....   the meats are great and I suggest people that like BBQ to go......

The first time I visited double wide, I was very pleased with my experience.  I ordered coconut-flavored tofu and it was delicious! The seitan wings were also very tasty and the service was great, however, the last two times that I have visited it was very disappointing in terms of service.  The service was very slow in seating us (said it would be 20 min for 2 people and it was 45), taking our order, and bringing out our food.  I'm not sure why there would be such a huge difference in service between my experiences, but I can only guess that it was because the second and third times were during the winter when they didn't have additional seating outside? I will probably give it another chance in the summer to redeem itself!

Atmosphere was very Americana, too Americana. Waited 15 minutes before I was even asked for my food. Servers nice, but inattentive. Got the Hawaiian burger, the tiny but of pineapple is supposed to "make" the burger. Ribs were excellent. Overall an okay experience probably will come back once in awhile. Not a place to hangout for a drink every weekend.
I love this place! Every time I travel to Irwin I make it a point to stop and eat. The ambience is fun the food is great and the beer is cold!
Food is flavorless. Unless you love salt. Then it's awesome. Service is slooooow. Food came out lukewarm. Even my 9 year old son thought his cheeseburger and fries were awful.
Great experience , stopped by an old gas station that it's now a  restaurant,  clever idea and the 40 different beers, unfortunately we only tried few of them, definitely we are coming back

Should be 1.5 stars. Service was very poor. Waitress asked us if we were ready to order, we told her we needed a couple more minutes. She was annoyed and didn't come back for 15 more minutes. Food took forever and we didn't order items that should take long.
Brought the wrong chili for 2 of the people at our table. Replaced it with the right chili, but very cold. Replaced the cold chili with hot chili. Cornbread was awful.  Burger was average. Mashed potatoes were average. Buffalo chicken salad was very stingy. It was basically buffalo chicken and lettuce. Buffalo sauce and chicken were good though.
I am normally not hard to please, but we said we would not go here again.

3 of us ordered BBQ. Ate outside. Good service. Fun atmosphere. Food was solid. Beef brisket was good. Pulled pork too. Cole slaw had highest rating of anything on our plates. Corn bread was too much like coffee cake. Overall true to the genre but nothing really stood out.

Moving from Pittsburgh to Irwin leaves much to be desired for the vegetarian palette. Double Wide offers plenty of menu items for those who don't  want to order the tired grilled cheese and French fries. After a brief overview of the menu, I came to Double Wide for brunch this past weekend with my partner. There were only three other small tables filled when we arrived, so we were sat quickly. I noticed it was a very spacious restaurant with a good size patio and separate bar.

We ordered the fruit plate for 4 to start. It featured cantaloupe, honeydew, pineapple and grapes. We  waited close to 20 minutes for the fruit plate (I assume we were the first table who ordered it for the day and the kitchen started to prep the fruit upon receiving our order). Disappointingly, the cantaloupe was not ripe; it was crunchy and flavorless. Also we expected the fruit to be cut up into pieces, but instead we got three planks of the melon and pineapple, and had to cut what we wanted to eat. 

A few minutes later, our dishes arrived! I was very happy with the Double Wide Benedict. The sweet cornbread and veggie sausage paired perfectly with the savory egg and smoky hollandaise. I wished my egg was runny, it was cooked to about medium instead. My partner enjoyed his veggie burrito and almost (impressively) ate the entire thing. Both meals were accompanied by over-seasoned roasted red skinned potatoes that needed more of a crisp to them. 

The service was great. Our coffee mugs were kept full thanks to the attentive staff. I could, however, hear many of the staff members conversations because the restaurant was so empty, and I am sure they weren't aware that customers heard about their their crazy Saturday night. Overall, we had a great vegetarian meal compared to what is available in the area (pizza, mostly).

If you're looking for healthy vegan options, stay home like a normal person.  If you want super tasty, dripping in bbq sauce, with several vegan options...run here.  The seitan is some of the best I've had pretty much anywhere, service is always most excellent, and obnoxious vegans such as myself super appreciate the handy little vegan icon next to the plethora of vegan choices.  

The seitan cheesesteak is damn delicious, but it most certainly isn't a Philly cheesesteak.  It's a delightful bbq sandwich, but don't order it if you're looking for a Philly cheesesteak.  


Stupid delicious, most excellent service, and more vegan options than you can shake a stick at.  If shaking a stick at something implied anything...whatever, just eat here.

Food was okay.   The famous ribs were hard and dry.  The corn bread was a small hunk of drywall.

It's sad because I typically go once or twice a month and it has steadily declined.

I can't say we had the worst server ever, but she was pretty close.

If she cared about the customer half as much as she cared about  talking to the other servers ...

She'd be much better off.

Lastly, the $18 - 8oz Sirloin was a half step up from Pondarosa.

Probably won't be back for a while and will probably tell everybody I know.

Let me get the food out of the way, I had the Setan Wings dusted with Cajun seasoning. They were excellent. Had the vegan gyro, also very good. Now this brings us to the attitude of the workers behind the bar....

Sat 10 minutes before even seeing a bartender, no lie, no one was manning the bar area. Finally, someone came and waited on us. I ordered an IPA and half order of the say-tan wings. My friend ordered a beer and neked burger. One bartender seemed agitated with my friend and the way he ordered his hamburger. Dear bartender, if someone wants cheese on their hamburger they would probably order a cheeseburger. 

Totally different feel from the South Side DWG. We were up for the AFC championship game. Nice crown except for one guy who spat profanities every time they showed Mike Tomlin on the screen. After awhile his wife finally paid the bill and got him out of there before he got sucker punched. I was thinking he didn't vote blue. 

Aside from a suburban crowd, slow service, and bartenders with attitude, the North Huntington DWG has great food and good beer selection. One thing they do have is free parking, unlike the South Side DWG. Deducted two stars for the long wait when we sat, and the petty bartender attitude.

Lots of choices on there menu. 
The grilled veggie appetizer is very good. 
Nice place with a different atmosphere than an ordinary restaurant. 
Very friendly staff. 
They also make there own soda  , which is  tasty.
The chicken and pork was really dry, and I was charged full price at 7:02 for a Yeungling (because happy hour was over at 7), when I waited ten minutes for the bartender to show up at the bar.

Wonderful place 
Nice people 
Loved the food 
Very relaxing place to eat for brunch..

We went to the Double Wide last week and left after being told that our favorite server, Billie, was "no longer working there." We went to the Double Wide Grill every week just to see Billie, and I was so upset to learn that she had been fired that we turned around and left. We won't be back -- Billie was far and away their best server, very warm and personable, always on top of our drink and food orders, and took the time to really get to know us. I genuinely can't imagine what justification they would have to terminate Billie, as she was truly fantastic, and we were just two of many regulars who came there just to see her. 

The food at the Double Wide is just OK. It isn't particularly flavorful or anything that you would make a special trip to eat.
